lines.speaker: u3937
lines.text: Yo. Charlie. Gimmie an order of brain deep-fry. Extra well done. Hold the neurons.  Patient exhibits symptoms of psycho neural overload. Notation: obviously higher settings can be dangerous to the subject.  Riddle me this, Fred. What is everything to someone and nothing to everyone else? Your mind of course. And now mine pumps with the power of yours.  New from Brain-bok. Da pump. Think faster. Reason higher. Out-cog-nate every homey on the court of life. Da pump. Yeah.  Ho! Mark. I sense an odd penchant for the anagramatic. The acrostic. The crypto-graphic. What doth this bode? Answer me Marcutio, you little runt.  Fred, I must confess you were a wonderful appetizer. Simply divine. But now I yearn for a meal of substance. The main course. A wide and varied palette. Ah, to taste the mind of a hero. A nobleman. A poet.  A chick in a short skirt wouldn't be so bad either.

lines.speaker: u3940
lines.text: ...Fired...your fired...your fired. You understand?! Fired!!

lines.speaker: u3937
lines.text: I don't think so.

lines.speaker: u3941
lines.text: A hit.

lines.text: You sunk my battleship.

lines.text: How long's it been, Alfred? A quarter of a century?  It seems like yesterday. I guess we ended up doing more harm than good.

lines.speaker: u3942
lines.text: Don't ever say that, sir. Don't ever believe it.

lines.speaker: u3944
lines.text: If not for you I never would've made it. You know that. My own parents couldn't have...  ... The boy, Alfred. You'll both be provided for. Don't let all this got to waste.

lines.text: Is this what you wanted?

lines.text: You could've killed him, you know. You could've killed the Joker.

lines.speaker: u3943
lines.text: I had to save you, Vicki. I --  -- Please trust me.

lines.text: We'll raid the Ace the moment we get a warrant.

lines.text: He'll be ready when you do. Remember what happened at the apartment.

lines.speaker: u3945
lines.text: All right, Bruce, what do you suggest?

lines.speaker: u3944
lines.text: I suggest a nice big bomb.

lines.speaker: u3945
lines.text: Good. A bomb. On a blind tip from Bruce Wayne -- We do have laws.

lines.speaker: u3944
lines.text: Then for God's sake, Harvey, cancel the anniversary celebration.

lines.speaker: u3945
lines.text: We've told him we'll deal. What could he possible have to gain by --

lines.speaker: u3944
lines.text: Do you still think the Joker cares about money??

lines.speaker: u3945
lines.text: I don't know. I'm just a D.A. I don't have access to all you expert sources.

lines.text: MOVE! Can't you do something??

lines.text: It's a detour. They're backed up for blocks!

lines.text: Got it all figured, huh?  Grissom just sits back and hands you the reins.  -- Maybe he don't know what we know.

lines.text: What are you talking about?

lines.speaker: u3947
lines.text: About how pretty you are, pretty boy.  Maybe he'd like to know --

lines.speaker: u3948
lines.text: You shouldn'ta turned the gun on that kid, man.  You shouldn'ta --

lines.speaker: u3954
lines.text: Do you want this money or don't you?  Now shut up!  Shut up --

lines.speaker: u3949
lines.text: Jack - - please - - WIPE THAT LUNATIC GRIN OFF YOUR FACE.

lines.speaker: u3950
lines.text: HA!  That's the best part. I CAN'T!!

lines.speaker: u3956
lines.text: I'll see you burn.  I'll see you dead -- GET AWAY FROM ME!!

lines.speaker: u3951
lines.text: Miss Vale, was it something I said?  Do you want to sniff my flower?

lines.speaker: u3952
lines.text: HOLY SHIT!!

lines.speaker: u3952
lines.text: Yeah. Yeah. Little winded. DID YOU SEE THAT?!

lines.speaker: u3956
lines.text: God yes, Allie. I've gotta say -- that was the ballsiest move I ever...

lines.speaker: u3952
lines.text: Holy shit. Holy...

lines.speaker: u3957
lines.text: He's not too bad.  I can live with him.

lines.speaker: u3961
lines.text: I'm afraid you don't know the half of it. Sit down.  I have a tale to tell.  And not a happy one.

lines.speaker: u3958
lines.text: David.  There's a call for you.  It's your wife.

lines.speaker: u3961
lines.text: Great.  Classic timing.  Why don't you ask her just to leave a date for the divorce?  I'll check my diary later.

lines.speaker: u3961
lines.text: It wasn't a dream, was it.  I have to go in to work and tell them Whistler's Mother now looks like Danny De Vito.

lines.speaker: u3959
lines.text: Well, Ahm....

lines.speaker: u3965
lines.text: He's a man with a plan who will haul us into profitability and the 21st century.

lines.speaker: u3960
lines.text: Thank you, sir.  Although, I'm afraid I don't quite see how we can ...

lines.speaker: u3965
lines.text: Good point Bernie - precisely the kind of perceptive interjection I'd expect from my new V.P. How can we, you ask, survive without Whistler's Mother - our single greatest asset?  Well, the truth is - we can't.  So what am I saying?  Will we find her again?  Never - this robber was clearly the work of a criminal of great genius.

lines.speaker: u3967
lines.text: ... in the distant future.

lines.speaker: u3961
lines.text: Bye, Bean.  Thanks for everything. And take care, huh?  I know it's insane, but I'm going to miss you.

lines.speaker: u3963

lines.text: I've known soldiers who've had their heads blown off who were more intelligent than you two.  Not only have you failed to protect your most valuable possession from theft - but you didn't even know it'd been stolen!  I'd sooner buy heroin from the guy who sells drugs outside my grandson's school than anything from you guys.

lines.speaker: u3965
lines.text: I am sorry you feel that way.

lines.speaker: u3979

lines.text: Oh, honey... I didn't mean anything ... it's just too big for you two. I know these things.

lines.text: W... What is it?

lines.speaker: u3986
lines.text: Your qu...?  But you're...

lines.text: They're already dead.  They can't feel a thing.

lines.text: Hellooo!  How's school?

lines.text: It's okay.  How's the dirt business?

lines.text: <u>Adam</u>!  <u>Adam</u>!

lines.speaker: u4000
lines.text: ... And he told us that he had been living there since he was a child, working as a gardener. He showed us a room in the garage, where he said he stayed, and I... Well, I didn't really believe him, of course - but why the act?

lines.speaker: u3990
lines.text: I have no idea...

lines.speaker: u4000
lines.text: Another thing that baffles me, Doctor - what was his connection with the deceased? Major financial dealings, obviously - but our firm has no record of any such transactions.

lines.text: Hmmm. You say he showed you his garden?

lines.speaker: u4000
lines.text: Well, he said it was his, he walked us through it.

lines.speaker: u3990
lines.text: I see.  Mr. Franklin, I must ask you and Miss Hayes to keep this incident with Mr. Gardiner to yourselves. There's no telling what he was involved in, and the matter may be extremely confidential. So please, not a word.

lines.speaker: u4000
lines.text: Of course, Doctor, I understand.

lines.speaker: u3990
lines.text: Fine. Thank you, Mr. Franklin.

lines.text: Certainly, glad to be of help.

lines.text: I don't think that's entirely true, Grover.

lines.text: Apparently the White House shares our curiosity - they have also launched an investigation, and, according to our sources, neither the F.B.I. nor the C.I.A. has met with success.

lines.text: Hmmm... Take this down.  I want this quote included in the Tass coverage; 'Chauncey Gardiner, in an intimate discussion with Ambassador Skrapinov, noted that "Unless the leaders of the opposing political systems move the chairs on which they sit closer to each other, all of their seats will be pulled from under them by rapid social and political changes."'

lines.speaker: u4005

lines.speaker: u4006
lines.text: Sorry to disturb you, chief but we have new developments.

lines.speaker: u4006
lines.text: We have word that the Soviets have put out a top priority alert for information on Gardiner's background. So far, they haven't come up with a thing - what's more, as a result of their eagerness, one of their ablest agents blew his cover, we have him in custody at this time.

lines.speaker: u4011
lines.text: Good. Anything else?

lines.speaker: u4006
lines.text: Yes, chief - eight other foreign powers have put Gardiner under surveillance. We're around-the clock now, sir - I'll keep you posted.

lines.speaker: u4010
lines.text: The rank-and-file in the FBI feel he is FBI, but others feel he is a CIA man who knows how to destroy FBI files.

lines.speaker: u4013

As for the NLF, they request that their members, in the event of capture, should maintain silence for twenty-four hours, and then, they may talk. Thus, the organization has already had the time necessary to render useless any information furnished ... What type of interrogation should we choose? ... the one the courts use for a crime of homicide which drags on for months?

No, gentlemen, believe me, it is a vicious circle. And we could discuss the problem for hours without reaching any conclusions. Because the problem does not lie here. The problem is: the NLF wants us to leave Algeria and we want to remain. Now, it seems to me that, despite varying shades of opinion, you all agree that we must remain. When the rebellion first began, there were not even shades of opinion. All the newspapers, even the left-wing ones wanted the rebellion suppressed. And we were sent here for this very reason. And we are neither madmen nor sadists, gentlemen. Those who call us fascists today, forget the contribution that many of us made to the Resistance. Those who call us Nazis, do not know that among us there are survivors of Dachau and Buchenwald. We are soldiers and our only duty is to win. lines.text: After I graduated college I was all set to go into my father business. Umbrella frames -- that's what he made. It was a sensible business, I suppose, but I didn't have the sense to be interested in anything sensible.

lines.speaker: u4415

lines.speaker: u4535
lines.text: Twenty bucks.

lines.speaker: u4539
lines.text: All right, asshole, you're on.

lines.speaker: u4541

lines.speaker: u4541

lines.speaker: u4547

lines.speaker: u4545
lines.text: What usually eats a banana?

lines.speaker: u4547

lines.speaker: u4545
lines.text: So...what are you, blind, son? This is a banana eating a monkey, nature in reverse.

lines.speaker: u4547
lines.text: Y'know, Jessie, doesn't Frank look like a normal guy--but he's not,  are you Frank?

lines.speaker: u4546
lines.text: Good memory.  You must be great with numbers.

lines.speaker: u4549
lines.text: Your mouth's writing a check your ass can't cash, but if ya wanna buy some life, bring me the money.

lines.speaker: u4546
lines.text: I burned it.

lines.speaker: u4549
lines.text: What the fuck you mean you burned it?

lines.speaker: u4546
lines.text: Never could save a thing.

lines.speaker: u4549
lines.text: Now you get burned.

lines.speaker: u4547
lines.text: Right.

lines.speaker: u4548

lines.speaker: u4553
lines.text: Calm down...give the gun to me. You're out of control, son.

lines.speaker: u4550
lines.text: What the hell are you waiting for, goddammit!  Don't you see what he's doing!  He's hijacking the shipment!

lines.speaker: u4551
lines.text: You got what we need?

lines.speaker: u4553
lines.text: No, that son-of-a-bitch Walker is alive.

lines.speaker: u4551
lines.text: No names, this is an open line!

lines.speaker: u4553
lines.text: I don't give a shit, Qualen!  I had to be insane to ever tie up with a low-life, piece of shit like you.  They beat us.  A couple of fuckin' hick mountain boys beat the man no law agency ever could.

lines.speaker: u4551
lines.text: Get off the radio!

lines.speaker: u4554
lines.text: Mostly.  Armored cars can be hijacked.  Trains can be derailed.  But nobody can get to us in flight.

lines.speaker: u4553
lines.text: I haven't lost a bill in eighteen years, don't jinx me, Walt.

lines.speaker: u4554
lines.text: I think Treasury personnel are the most superstitious people in the federal government.

lines.speaker: u4553
lines.text: We should be.  Everybody wants what we have.

lines.speaker: u4555
lines.text: If thou lose hope being weary in the days of distress, thy strength shall be diminished.

lines.speaker: u4572
lines.text: Fine, my boy, fine, fine.

lines.speaker: u4555
lines.text: Father, I have tried, have I not?

lines.speaker: u4572
lines.text: You have, my son.

lines.speaker: u4555
lines.text: I've done my best, have I not?

lines.speaker: u4572
lines.text: Indeed.

lines.speaker: u4555
lines.text: And, Father, I've never been guilty of any institutional infractions, have I?

lines.speaker: u4572
lines.text: You certainly have not, 655321. You've been very helpful, and you've shown a genuine desire to reform.

lines.speaker: u4555
lines.text: Father - may I ask you a question in private?

lines.speaker: u4572
lines.text: Certainly, my son, certainly. Is there something troubling you, my son? Don't be shy to speak up. Remember, I know all the urges that can trouble young men deprived of the society of women.

lines.speaker: u4555
lines.text: No Father. It's nothing like that, Father. It's about this new thing they're all talking about. About this new treatment that you out of prison in no time at all and makes sure you never get back in again.

lines.speaker: u4572
lines.text: Where did you hear about this? Whose been talking about these things?

lines.speaker: u4555
lines.text: These things get around, Father. Two Warders talk as it might be, and somebody can't help overhearing what they say. Then somebody picks up a scrap of newspaper in the workshops and the newspaper tells all about it. How about putting me in for this new treatment, Father?

lines.speaker: u4572
lines.text: I take it you are referring to the Ludovico Technique?

lines.speaker: u4555
lines.text: I don't know what it's called, Father, all I know is that it gets you out quickly and makes sure that you never get in again.

lines.speaker: u4572
lines.text: That's not proven, 655321. In fact, it is only in the experimental stage at this moment.

lines.speaker: u4555
lines.text: But it is being used, isn't it, Father?

lines.speaker: u4572
lines.text: It has not been used yet in this prison. The Governor has grave doubts about it and I have heard that there are very serious dangers involved.

lines.speaker: u4555
lines.text: I don't care about the danger, Father. I just want to be good. I want for the rest of my life to be one act of goodness.

lines.speaker: u4572
lines.text: The question is weather or not this technique really makes a man good. Goodness comes from within. Goodness is chosen. When a man cannot chose, he ceases to be a man.

lines.speaker: u4555
lines.text: I don't understand about the whys and wherefores, Father. I only know I want to be good.

lines.speaker: u4572
lines.text: Be patient, my son, and put your trust in the Lord.

lines.speaker: u4555
lines.text: Instruct thy son and he shall refresh thee and shall give delight to thy soul.

lines.speaker: u4572
lines.text: Amen. They cross themselves.

lines.speaker: u4557
lines.text: Mothballs, sir.

lines.speaker: u4558
lines.text: Now then. Face the wall. Bend over and touch your toes. Chief Guard inspects Alex's anus with a penlight.

lines.speaker: u4558
lines.text: Don't read it - sign it!

lines.speaker: u4567
lines.text: It says that you are willing to have the residue of your sentence commuted to the Ludovico treatment. Alex signs. Governor gathers up papers. Alex dots the last "i" and smiles.

lines.speaker: u4566
lines.text: Enough is remembered though, little Alex. Dim and Georgie laugh. They drag Alex to a low water through.

lines.speaker: u4560
lines.text: This is to make sure you stay cured. Georgie hits Alex in the stomach with his blackjack. Then, they push his head under the water and methodically start to beat him with their blackjacks. After a full minute of this, they drag him out, halt-drowned,

lines.speaker: u4565
lines.text: Hullo, son, how are you?

lines.text: Are you feeling better?

lines.text: Shall we go to my office?

lines.speaker: u4569
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.text: In my office?

lines.text: Where are you, what floor?

lines.speaker: u4575
lines.text: Seventh, files section.  What should I do?

lines.speaker: u4584
lines.text: He doesn't know you're up there!  Just stay right where you are!  Call the police!

lines.speaker: u4575
lines.text: Max, I'm scared.  Are you sure?

lines.speaker: u4584
lines.text: Yes!  Stay put, goddamn it!  Don't move from that spot...

lines.speaker: u4576
lines.text: You dizzy?  You want to sit down?

lines.speaker: u4584
lines.text: I'm...fine.  Fine.

lines.speaker: u4576
lines.text: You sure?  You look pretty shaky...

lines.speaker: u4577
lines.text: Lay it on me.

lines.speaker: u4587
lines.text: It's simple.  What was your pal Louis' first musical instrument?

lines.speaker: u4577
lines.text: I know the answer.  I know all there is to know about Louis.

lines.speaker: u4587
lines.text: Then let's have it.

lines.speaker: u4584
lines.text: As a token of my appreciation for your understanding in this matter, I'd like to offer you a discount for my services tonight.  Twenty five percent.

lines.text: Twenty five?

lines.speaker: u4578

lines.text: This isn't our goddamn game!

lines.text: ...oh God, don't shoot me...

lines.text: Where you been the last two hours? Your mother's been calling every ten minutes whining about how you didn't show up.

lines.speaker: u4588

lines.text: Look, I'm sorry --

lines.text: Flip.  You're the closest thing I got to a friend around here.  Tell me something.  You think I'm crazy?

lines.speaker: u4596
lines.text: I don't know...

lines.speaker: u4592

lines.speaker: u4592
lines.text: Whatever.

lines.text: I want this box rigged with a beacon!

lines.text: Liza, settle a bet for us.

lines.text: What do I look like to you? Switzerland?

lines.text: I'm, it really doesn't matter. Think C.I.A. and exponentiate. I'm a government employee and I've been watching Jerry for awhile.

lines.text: And Jonas?

lines.speaker: u4596
lines.text: He's why I watch Jerry.  Jerry's the bait for Jonas.

lines.speaker: u4595
lines.text: He's shown himself.  Why haven't you arrested him or killed him or done whatever it is you do?

lines.speaker: u4596
lines.text: Jonas builds assassins for a living.  Several of whom may be in place already.  We'd like to kill a few birds with one stone.

lines.speaker: u4595
lines.text: Where do you think Jerry is?

lines.speaker: u4596
lines.text: No idea.  Honest.  What are you going to do?

lines.speaker: u4595
lines.text: I'm going to find him.  Because he'd find me.

lines.speaker: u4596
lines.text: Don't go home.  And don't go to work.  Either one could be bad.

lines.speaker: u4595
lines.text: What do you suggest?

lines.speaker: u4596
lines.text: That you come with me.

lines.speaker: u4595
lines.text: I don't think so.

lines.speaker: u4599
lines.text: We've lost contact.

lines.speaker: u4609
lines.text: Pull the plug.  Get her out of there.

lines.speaker: u4599
lines.text: There's no plug to pull.

lines.speaker: u4609
lines.text: What?

lines.speaker: u4599
lines.text: There is no abort procedure -- we don't know how we turned the damn thing on, let alone how to turn it off.

lines.speaker: u4600
lines.text: You don't believe it to be... tell me something, Doctor.  Why do you think they would go to all this trouble... bring you tens of thousands of light years, and then send you home without a shred of proof?  Sort of bad form, wouldn't you say?  What was their intent?

lines.speaker: u4602
lines.text: I don't know.  Ultimately their motives may be as incomprehensible as their technology.

lines.speaker: u4601
lines.text: Ellie... we both know that if I was any kind of a man, I never would've entered this race.  That I would have told the President straight out:  Helen, Eleanor Arroway is naive and strident and an enormous pain in the ass... but she's got more courage and intelligence than the rest of us put together.  That more then anyone else on the planet, she's earned this.  And that she should be the one to go because she's the best we have.  But that's not who I am.  I like to think it's who I might've been if things had gone a different way; that I might have been worthy, really worthy of what I've been given...  You do what you have to do.  And in the end, as with everything, it comes down to power.  And it isn't fair...

lines.speaker: u4602
lines.text: What would you have me say, David?

lines.speaker: u4601
lines.text: Nothing.  I guess I just wanted to thank you.

lines.speaker: u4602
lines.text: Thank you?

lines.speaker: u4601
lines.text: For giving me a chance, just for a moment, to feel what it must be like to be you.

lines.speaker: u4602
lines.text: You kill me, you really do.  The first truly global, a-political event in history and you can't wait to spin it.

lines.speaker: u4611
lines.text: How would you propose we handle it, Doctor?

lines.speaker: u4602
lines.text: I guess I'd say I trust us enough to believe our response would be something to the effect of, thanks for the advice, but no thanks.  But to dilute or censor the truth, for whatever reason --

lines.speaker: u4611
lines.text: Nobody is proposing we censor the truth here, Doctor.  We're simply talking about putting a mechanism in place --

lines.speaker: u4602
lines.text: For managing the truth.  But the truth won't be managed, sir.  It stops being the truth the moment you try.

lines.speaker: u4607
lines.text: ... as have all attempts at internal analysis.  We've tried sonargrams, magnetic resonance, gamma rays; it's completely impenetrable.

lines.speaker: u4610
lines.text: Recommendations?

lines.speaker: u4607
lines.text: I don't know.  Maybe we built the damn thing wrong.  Maybe it was all a hoax...  The safest thing would probably be to do a Chernobyl; encase it in concrete.

lines.speaker: u4610
lines.text: Have your department make a full report.

lines.text: Hot damn, Drag. Tomorrow's Saturday. Another week almost made.

lines.speaker: u4615
lines.text: Nothin' to do with it. I ain't never give John the kind of feelin' I give you, so I'm payin' him off now. Don't feel you got to say anything. Way it is, sometimes, you just have a feelin' for a child or you don't, and with John I just didn't.

lines.text: Gotta go, Arletta.

lines.speaker: u4615

lines.text: Gaahhd!  What a <u>cop</u>!  You busted me!  The new one, in the Marina.  She has a police radio scanner. It's always on.  She turns it off, and then she has to turn it on again.  She's obsessed.  She can't not listen to it, but she can't listen to it, so she makes me listen to it.

lines.text: Daryll Lee Cullum, he wrote that book, he wanted the lady to have it.  They won't let him send it to her, so I'm getting out, he asks me to deliver it in person, he says, put it on her pillow.  It has all about how he tried to kill her.

lines.text: He told you she was loaded, any- thing you could steal you could keep, Conrad?  You bought yourself a return ticket to Quentin, breaking and entering.

lines.text: Conrad has the phone number. Conrad, where is he?

lines.speaker: u4629

lines.text: Ma'am, please get out of your vehicle...

lines.speaker: u4630

lines.speaker: u4637

lines.text: He's got Sergeant Halloran in there.  He'll kill her the minute he sees or hears your people...

lines.text: He's not treating her right...

lines.text: She left you, Nikko.  She's not your responsibility.  She takes very good care of herself.  If she wants to romance the kid, it ain't your business.  Your business is to snap out of it.

lines.speaker: u4635
lines.text: Don't give me six years!  You never divorced Patty, did you?  So what'd you expect from M.J.?

lines.speaker: u4633
lines.text: She knows I'm Catholic!  She never mentioned divorce!  Not once!

lines.speaker: u4635
lines.text: Then you shoulda known she wasn't buying.  She was just long-term leasing' you.  Ah, Nickie.  Except for that rare twenty-second twitch, there ain't nothin' about sex I don't hate. But of course, I'm Irish.  Plus I got <u>real</u> problems.  I'm worried I might have to put you in over M.J.  There's something going on here, the Commissioner is targeting her now, I can't leave a woman in that position.  But the thing is, how can I move <u>you</u> in, if you go on acting like a teenage asshole?

lines.speaker: u4633
lines.text: I don't want the job.  Don't do that to her.  She's worked too damned hard for it.

lines.text: What's going down with the sting in Chinatown?  That gonna be off your plate in a week or what?

lines.text: See, now you've annoyed her.  You know she doesn't like you to touch me.  Does she, widdle wee fing!  Wuhve you so much!  Did you feed her?

lines.speaker: u4639
lines.text: That's what I don't know.  Why would you lie?  That's the problem... I can't understand why anyone would lie.

That's why they stored so much o' their shit down here. It's all mine now. All mine. Just let 'em try ta come after us down here, which they will some day...take a likin' ta what all we got an' come after us. They'll hafta get past my army! An army that ain't afraid ta die...ha ha ha...'cause it's awreddy DAID! HA HA HA HA....

lines.text: The purpose of decapitation is to preserve as much...food...as possible. The purpose for feeding is to keep the beasts on our side. The fact that they can be taught to clean up our garbage or to fire a gun is a convenient side benefit, not the primary goal. The primary goal is to keep ourselves from becoming their supper. Keep them fed and they behave. Keep them hungry and they revert back to being the animals that they have always been. You saw them in there.

I wanted to get married ... He didn't really want it ... he's married already!  But he did it.  I don't know why.  I thought it would help me, but it didn't.  I was just as confused and unhappy was before; I did terrible things.

My God, he's in hock up to his ears already.

Sonny comes there and looks at me and just says: 'Wow!'  So when I hear he's in the bank, I almost go crazy because I know he's doin' it for me.

lines.text: I don't have time.  I have --

lines.speaker: u4997
lines.text: Just show me where they are!

lines.speaker: u4997
lines.text: I heard you like to shoot dogs.

lines.speaker: u4994
lines.text: Dogs got no reason to live.

lines.speaker: u4997
lines.text: Oh?  you feel that way about people, too?

lines.speaker: u4994
lines.text: Man, what're you saying?

lines.speaker: u4997
lines.text: Ray, we got the shotguns.

lines.speaker: u4994
lines.text: I don't own no shotguns.

lines.speaker: u4997
lines.text: Why were you throwing clothes in the building incinerator?

lines.speaker: u4994
lines.text: Say what?

lines.speaker: u4997
lines.text: You guys were arrested this morning, but none of you have last night's clothes.  <u>You</u> were seen burning them.  Add to that the fact that you hid the car you were cruising around in last night and it doesn't look good.

lines.speaker: u4994
lines.text: I got nothin' more to say till I see a judge.

lines.speaker: u4997
lines.text: Were you on hop?  You were passed out when you got arrested.  Were you hopped up, Ray?

lines.speaker: u4994
lines.text: Ty and Larry fuck with that shit, not me.

lines.speaker: u4997
lines.text: Where do they get their stuff? Come on.  Give me one to feed the D.A.  Just a little one.

lines.speaker: u4995
lines.text: What do you mean Deuce Perkins got clipped last night?!

lines.speaker: u5008
lines.text: They shot him in his library.

lines.speaker: u4995
lines.text: I don't want a floor plan; I want to know who!  Who's taking the ticket for this, Johnny?

lines.speaker: u5008
lines.text: Nobody.  At least not yet.

lines.speaker: u4995
lines.text: And what about the merchandise Deuce was holding for me?

lines.speaker: u5008
lines.text: Gone.  Not a trace.

lines.speaker: u4995
lines.text: Some ferstunkener is moving in and we don't know who?!  Maybe we should ask Hedda Hopper!

lines.speaker: u4996
lines.text: Have you discussed this with anyone else, John?

lines.speaker: u4999
lines.text: No.

lines.speaker: u4996
lines.text: Not even with Exley?

lines.speaker: u5002
lines.text: My daughter was a virgin!

lines.speaker: u4997
lines.text: I don't doubt it -- Oh, God.

lines.speaker: u4999
lines.text: Loew didn't go with him.  You're sure?

lines.speaker: u4998
lines.text: I put Reynolds in the cab myself. The night cost me a hundred scoots and I got bupkis.

lines.speaker: u4999
lines.text: Gee.  The Great Jerk-Off Book Caper of 1953.

lines.speaker: u5009
lines.text: Vincennes, is there someplace you'd rather be?

lines.speaker: u4999
lines.text: Yeah, Cap.  Back in Narcotics.

lines.speaker: u5009
lines.text: Oh?  Anyplace else?

lines.speaker: u4999
lines.text: Working whores with squad two.

lines.speaker: u5009
lines.text: Maybe you should have thought of that before you made Bloody Christmas page one.

lines.speaker: u5011
lines.text: 209 to anyone! I need some help here!

lines.speaker: u5016
lines.text: Who are you calling?!

lines.speaker: u5016
lines.text: It's actually DH-1 Digitech Pinpoint scanning with a frequency modulator.

lines.speaker: u5012
lines.text: I don't know what that means.

lines.speaker: u5016
lines.text: Me neither, but the upshot is I've got color live-action footage of you and Ms Hawkins and it doesn't look good.

lines.speaker: u5012
lines.text: So...how much money do you want in exchange for not ruining my life?

lines.speaker: u5016
lines.text: I don't want any money. And believe me, I have no interest in ruining your life. I'm not interested in this tape.

lines.speaker: u5012
lines.text: You're not.

lines.speaker: u5045
lines.text: No one. But I'm a little nervous.

lines.speaker: u5013
lines.text: When can you get it here?

lines.speaker: u5045
lines.text: I'm doing a transfer now.

lines.speaker: u5013
lines.text: Come straight here. Don't talk to anyone.

lines.speaker: u5045
lines.text: I'll come straight there.

lines.speaker: u5013
lines.text: Be careful, Danny.

lines.speaker: u5014
lines.text: Why don't you just call Brill directly.

lines.speaker: u5016
lines.text: I don't know who he is.

lines.speaker: u5014
lines.text: I'm told you had an affair with Rachel Banks four years ago.

lines.speaker: u5016
lines.text: Told by whom?

lines.speaker: u5014
lines.text: Considering the enormous exposure to which you've subjected this firm, I'd think you'd do best to simply answer my questions.

lines.speaker: u5016
lines.text: Really?

lines.speaker: u5014
lines.text: Yes.

lines.speaker: u5016
lines.text: Well considering what a colossal douche bag you are, David, maybe I'd do best to simply kick your ass all over the capitol.

lines.speaker: u5015
lines.text: I yanked this off your RV. It's a Global Positioning Tracker.

lines.speaker: u5040
lines.text: Oh my God.

lines.speaker: u5015
lines.text: Tracks your location to the inch and works directly with--you know...

lines.speaker: u5040
lines.text: With what?

lines.speaker: u5015
lines.text: With spy satellites. I don't like saying these things Senator...

lines.speaker: u5040
lines.text: Neil, thank you for your help.

lines.speaker: u5015
lines.text: Anytime.

lines.speaker: u5022
lines.text: Well we'd sure like to help you.

lines.speaker: u5016
lines.text: You would?

lines.speaker: u5022
lines.text: Yes. But we can't.

lines.speaker: u5016
lines.text: Why not?

lines.speaker: u5022
lines.text: Because we, and our associates, have paid out hundreds of thousands of dollars to shyster lawyers like you, <u>because</u> of shyster lawyers like you, and we'd just as soon sit back and sip a beer while you get ass-banged by as many people as possible.

lines.speaker: u5037
lines.text: What's your opinion?

lines.speaker: u5021
lines.text: It's hard to say for certain, these things are--

lines.speaker: u5037
lines.text: I'm not asking you to say for certain. This is what you're trained to do, right?

lines.speaker: u5021
lines.text: Yes sir.

lines.speaker: u5037
lines.text: Then what's your goddam opinion?

lines.speaker: u5021
lines.text: Zavitz had digital compression equipment. He could've downloaded into something. A disk, a chip, anything small enough to put in his pocket and run with. Whatever he put it in, he dropped it in that bag.

lines.speaker: u5037
lines.text: Get it.

lines.speaker: u5037
lines.text: "I know thy works and thy labour and how thou canst not bear them that are evil. And thou hast tried them who say they are apostles and hast found them to be liars". Revelations II.

lines.speaker: u5023
lines.text: What the hell does it mean?

lines.speaker: u5037
lines.text: It means who's side are you on?

lines.speaker: u5023
lines.text: You didn't ask me to meet you 30 miles from my office for a Bible study class.

lines.speaker: u5037
lines.text: It's a bi-partisan issue. Everyone needs to swallow hard. No one, including you, wants to be fingered as the one obstructing efforts to crack down on terrorism, and--

lines.speaker: u5023
lines.text: Fuck you.

lines.speaker: u5037
lines.text: What?

lines.speaker: u5023
lines.text: I said fuck you.

lines.speaker: u5037
lines.text: Is that anyway to talk to an old school chum?

lines.speaker: u5023
lines.text: You're gonna finger me as soft on terrorism? Terrorism, you unconscionable asshole?

lines.speaker: u5037
lines.text: There are planes falling out of the sky, buildings blowing up. American buildings. Americans getting bombs in the mail. What are we gonna do!?

lines.speaker: u5023
lines.text: We're not gonna hand you and your band of lunatics the keys to the kingdom. I'm not gonna sit in Congress and write a law that allows the NSA to point a camera and a microphone at anything they damn well feel like. And the next time you have something to say to me, we do it above-board, in my office, like everyone else. Now get outa my car, I've got a committee meeting on the hill.

lines.speaker: u5024
lines.text: Found him. Kent Island nailed the call five minutes ago. He's stationary.

lines.speaker: u5037
lines.text: Do you have visual?

lines.speaker: u5024
lines.text: Not yet. He's near "M" and 34th. I've got an ELSUR unit on the scene now. A residential building. Twelve units.

lines.speaker: u5037
lines.text: What's your ETA?

lines.speaker: u5024
lines.text: Three minutes. We're going in light. Myself and two others. Everyone else is held back in reserve.

lines.speaker: u5037
lines.text: He walked right up to me in church. At the holiest time of the wear. He approached me in a sanctified place.  Kill him now.

lines.speaker: u5045
lines.text: Yes?

lines.speaker: u5030
lines.text: Federal Express for 'Zavitz'.

lines.speaker: u5045
lines.text: Federal Express?

lines.speaker: u5030
lines.text: For Daniel Zavitz. I just need a signature.

lines.speaker: u5045
lines.text: How'd you get in the building?

lines.speaker: u5030
lines.text: The door was open, sir. I just need a signature.

lines.speaker: u5031
lines.text: It was pulsing on your SAT frequencies.

lines.speaker: u5041
lines.text: I don't know what's going on, but if you people have tripped over your own asshole again, you're not gonna get any help from us. It's ending at your doorstep.

lines.speaker: u5037
lines.text: Now is that clear?

lines.speaker: u5044
lines.text: Yes sir.

lines.speaker: u5046
lines.text: Hey!  Hey!  Stop this jeep!  Let me out of here - there's a woman dying, there's a woman dying while I'm - Hey!

lines.speaker: u5050
lines.text: Shut-up!

lines.speaker: u5046
lines.text: Please - I beg you, I beg you, I beg you, please listen to me, this is a terrible mistake. Just stop, please, and listen to me.  My wife is dying.

lines.speaker: u5050
lines.text: Listen, Fritz, if I have to listen to another word from you I'll give you a fucking good hiding.

lines.speaker: u5046
lines.text: Fritz?  What are you talking about? Who's Fritz?

lines.speaker: u5050
lines.text: That's your name innit?  Count Fucking Arsehole Von Bismarck? What's that supposed to be then, Irish?

lines.speaker: u5051
lines.text: No, I'll get you some tea. Wait till you're in Naples.  You'll find a girl there.

lines.speaker: u5047
lines.text: Just kiss me.  It would mean such a lot to me.

lines.speaker: u5051
lines.text: Would it? She kisses him, very softly, on the lips.

lines.speaker: u5047
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.speaker: u5048
lines.text: You get to the morning and the poison leaks away, doesn't it? Black nights, fucking black nights, when you want to howl like a dog. I thought I would kill you.  You killed my friends, you ruined my hands.  But the girl was always here, like some Guardian Angel.

lines.speaker: u5062
lines.text: You can't kill me.  I died years ago.

lines.speaker: u5048
lines.text: No, now I can't kill you.

lines.speaker: u5057
lines.text: And a special thank you to Geoffrey and Katharine, without whose fund raising heroics we should still be kicking our heels. They toast the Cliftons.

lines.speaker: u5049
lines.text: To arm-twisting.

lines.speaker: u5057
lines.text: Did Katharine say? - Geoffrey has to fly back to Cairo.

lines.speaker: u5049
lines.text: Have to return the favor - take a few photographs for the army.

lines.speaker: u5051
lines.text: You've got a mustache.

lines.speaker: u5061
lines.text: A bit of one.

lines.speaker: u5051
lines.text: I was looking forward to this evening.

lines.speaker: u5061
lines.text: I had a hotel room.

lines.speaker: u5051
lines.text: I thought that was for when we were very very old?

lines.speaker: u5061
lines.text: I'm feeling old.

lines.speaker: u5052
lines.text: You've got to cut, sir, that frost won't last.

lines.speaker: u5055
lines.text: Go away.

lines.speaker: u5052
lines.text: Yessir.

lines.speaker: u5055
lines.text: This is making me incredibly angry.

lines.speaker: u5056
lines.text: You should sit down, darling.  She's quite all right.  Are you pregnant?

lines.speaker: u5054
lines.text: I don't think so.

lines.speaker: u5056
lines.text: How romantic.  With Fiona I fell over every five minutes.  Ronnie Christened me Lady Downfall.

lines.speaker: u5054
lines.text: I think I might go inside and sit down for a few minutes.

lines.speaker: u5056
lines.text: I'll come with you.

lines.speaker: u5054
lines.text: No, please.  I shall be absolutely fine. They pass Almsy, who doesn't look up from his book.

lines.speaker: u5055
lines.text: They're excited!  They're happy about destroying a whole city. Would they do that to a White Man's City?  Never!

lines.speaker: u5062
lines.text: Go on, do it.  I don't need to hear any more.

lines.speaker: u5062
lines.text: Am I being interrogated?  You should be trying to trick me.  Ask me about Tottenham Hotspur.  Or Buckingham Palace. About Marmite - I was addicted.  Or make me speak German, which I can, by the way.

lines.speaker: u5059
lines.text: Why?  Are you German?

lines.speaker: u5062
lines.text: No.

lines.speaker: u5059
lines.text: How do you know you're not German if you don't remember anything?

lines.speaker: u5062
lines.text: You tell me.  I remember a lot of things. I remember a garden, plunging down to the sea - the Devil's Chimney we called it - and there was a cottage at the bottom, right on the shore, nothing between you and France.

lines.speaker: u5059
lines.text: This was your garden?

lines.speaker: u5062
lines.text: Or my wife's.

lines.speaker: u5059
lines.text: Then you were married?

lines.speaker: u5062
lines.text: I think so.  Although I believe that to be true of a number of Germans. Might I have a glass of water?

lines.speaker: u5063
lines.text: Gin? Where the hell are you?

lines.speaker: u5064
lines.text: I'm in the middle.

lines.speaker: u5063
lines.text: In the middle? You've got the Mask, why don't we have him?

lines.speaker: u5064
lines.text: He's on to something bigger.

lines.speaker: u5063
lines.text: Listen to me. Whatever you're doing, stop. Pull out.

lines.speaker: u5064
lines.text: Too late now.

lines.speaker: u5063
lines.text: Tell me where you are, or just leave the line open so I can trace you.

lines.speaker: u5064
lines.text: I'm going to get him, I promise you.

lines.speaker: u5066
lines.text: A true master. Classic, yet extremely sexual, don't you think?

lines.speaker: u5064
lines.text: We need to make the trade tomorrow.

lines.speaker: u5066
lines.text: Always in a rush.

lines.speaker: u5064
lines.text: You should know, when I come back here with the Mask--if anything goes wrong, a detailed description of everything you've done goes to the PRC.

lines.speaker: u5066
lines.text: Gin, really.

lines.speaker: u5064
lines.text: Tomorrow. It has to be tomorrow. Or forget the Mask.

lines.speaker: u5067
lines.text: See you.

lines.speaker: u5065
lines.text: Probably not.

lines.speaker: u5067
lines.text: Yeah. Probably not.

lines.speaker: u5068
lines.text: Um, Erin?  Listen.  Even though you're not necessarily my favorite person in the world ...  ... sometimes you're not half-bad.

lines.speaker: u5076
lines.text: I'm gonna assume that was meant as a compliment, Anna, and just say thank you.

lines.speaker: u5074
lines.text: Tell you what, why don't you go on over to reception, tell them I said Mario should take you to the airport.

lines.speaker: u5069
lines.text: Hey, excellent.  Thanks.

lines.speaker: u5074
lines.text: Fax these to this number, okay?

lines.speaker: u5070
lines.text: All of 'em?

lines.speaker: u5074
lines.text: All of them.

lines.speaker: u5076
lines.text: What?  Hey -- <u>he</u> hit <u>me</u>.

lines.speaker: u5071
lines.text: So you say.

lines.speaker: u5076
lines.text: He came tearing around the corner, out of control --

lines.speaker: u5071
lines.text: An ER doctor who spends his days saving lives was the one out of control --

lines.speaker: u5076
lines.text: That asshole smashed in my fucking neck!

lines.speaker: u5078
lines.text: Meningitis?  What the hell is meningitis?

lines.speaker: u5072
lines.text: It's an inflammation of the spinal cord and part of the brain.

lines.speaker: u5078
lines.text: Jesus.

lines.speaker: u5072
lines.text: She must be a tough cookie, cause it's a pretty advanced case.  I'd say she's been walking around with it for a few weeks now.

lines.speaker: u5078
lines.text: How does someone get meningitis?

lines.speaker: u5072
lines.text: Usually, in adults, it's from exposure to bacteria or a virus or ...

lines.speaker: u5078
lines.text: ... or lemme guess -- toxic waste?

lines.speaker: u5073
lines.text: I can put them in a good school.

lines.speaker: u5076
lines.text: Any school you want.

lines.speaker: u5073
lines.text: And get someone to help around the house.

lines.speaker: u5076
lines.text: Yup.

lines.speaker: u5073
lines.text: Oh my God.  Oh my God.

lines.speaker: u5086
lines.text: I've also been thinking about the team. Responsibilities, who should cover what --

lines.speaker: u5074
lines.text: Right.

lines.speaker: u5086
lines.text: I think we should makes some changes.

lines.speaker: u5076
lines.text: How come you didn't say anything when you found these things?

lines.speaker: u5075
lines.text: At the time, I thought, I got six kids, some of 'em want to go to college.  I can't afford to lose my job.  I told myself I was being honorable.  But there's nothing honorable in what I did.  Maybe that's why they picked me for the job. Maybe they knew what kind of man I was.

lines.speaker: u5085
lines.text: I gotta say, Erin -- first time I saw you, I did not peg you as the kind to go off and conduct her own epidemiological study.

lines.speaker: u5076
lines.text: Don't go telling anyone.  It'll ruin my reputation.

lines.speaker: u5090
lines.text: It was .... the Emperor ....

lines.speaker: u5104
lines.text: The Emperor?

lines.speaker: u5090
lines.text: Yes, he commands you make contact with him ....

lines.speaker: u5104
lines.text: Move this ship out of the asteroid field and into a position where we can send a clear transmission.

lines.speaker: u5090
lines.text: Yes, My Lord.

lines.speaker: u5104
lines.text: And code the signal to my private chamber.

lines.speaker: u5091
lines.text: Lord Vader, our ships have completed their scan of the area and found nothing.  The Millennium Falcon definitely went into lightspeed. It's probably on the other side of the galaxy by now.

lines.speaker: u5104
lines.text: Alert all commands.  Calculate every possible destination along their last known trajectory and disburse the fleet to search for them.  Don't fail me again, Admiral, I've had quite enough!

lines.speaker: u5091
lines.text: Yes, My Lord.  We'll find them.

lines.speaker: u5092
lines.text: Will you?  You underestimate The Emperor.  It is you he wants ... that is why your friends suffer.

lines.speaker: u5100
lines.text: And that is why I must go.

lines.speaker: u5092
lines.text: Luke, I will not lose you to the Emperor, as I lost Vader.

lines.speaker: u5100
lines.text: You won't.

lines.speaker: u5092
lines.text: Only a fully trained Jedi Knight, with The Force as his ally, will conquer Vader and his Emperor. If you end your training now, if you choose the quick and easy path ... as Vader did ... you will become an agent of evil ... and the galaxy will be plunged deeper into the abyss of hate, despair and pain that you feel your friends suffering now.

lines.speaker: u5099
lines.text: Okay, Chewie, it's now or never.

lines.speaker: u5093
lines.text: Barks his agreement.

lines.speaker: u5100
lines.text: ... I told you, I'm not hungry.

lines.speaker: u5094
lines.text: Patience.  It's time to eat.

lines.speaker: u5100
lines.text: Look, it smells good.  I'm sure it's delicious   But I don't know why we can't see Yoda now.

lines.speaker: u5094
lines.text: It's the Jedi's time to eat, too.

lines.speaker: u5100
lines.text: Will it take long to get there? How far away is he?

lines.speaker: u5094
lines.text: Not far, not far.  Be patient. Soon you will see him.  Why wish you become a Jedi?

lines.speaker: u5100
lines.text: Because of my father, I guess.

lines.speaker: u5094
lines.text: Oh, your father ... a powerful Jedi was he, powerful Jedi.

lines.speaker: u5100
lines.text: How could you know my father? You don't even know who I am.  Can't we get on with this already?

lines.speaker: u5095
lines.text: The night storms will start before you can reach the first marker.

lines.speaker: u5097
lines.text: Then I'll see you in Hell.

lines.speaker: u5104
lines.text: What is thy bidding, My Master?

lines.speaker: u5096
lines.text: There is a grave disturbance in The Force.

lines.speaker: u5104
lines.text: I have felt it.

lines.speaker: u5096
lines.text: Our situation is most precarious. We have a new enemy who could bring about our destruction.

lines.speaker: u5104
lines.text: Our destruction?  Who?

lines.speaker: u5096
lines.text: The son of Skywalker.  You must destroy him ... or he will be our undoing.

lines.speaker: u5104
lines.text: He's not a Jedi, he's just a boy. Obi-wan could not have taught him so much that ...

lines.speaker: u5096
lines.text: You are weak!  I have seen it. The Force is strong with him. He must be destroyed.

lines.speaker: u5104
lines.text: But, if he could be turned, he would be a powerful ally.

lines.speaker: u5096
lines.text: Yes ... yes.  That would be a great asset.

lines.speaker: u5104
lines.text: He will join us or die, My Master.

lines.speaker: u5098
lines.text: Don't shoot!  I've done what I can for you.  I'm sorry it's not better, but I've got my own problems.  I've already stuck my neck out further than I should ...

lines.speaker: u5097
lines.text: Yeah, you're a real hero.

lines.speaker: u5098
lines.text: I'm sure my men fixed it.  We've got nothing to worry about.

lines.speaker: u5099
lines.text: That sounds familiar.

lines.speaker: u5099
lines.text: This hyperdrive had better work.

lines.speaker: u5100
lines.text: I've never seen it fail.

lines.speaker: u5104
lines.text: There is no escape.  You must join me or die.  Don't make me destroy you here ... The Emperor is strong with The Force.  But if you join me, together we could overthrow Him.  Do not resist. It is our destiny!

lines.speaker: u5100
lines.text: Never.

lines.speaker: u5101
lines.text: Seventeen ships destroyed, we don't know how many got away.

lines.speaker: u5104
lines.text: Anything on the Millennium Falcon?

lines.speaker: u5101
lines.text: It won't get through the blockade.

lines.speaker: u5104
lines.text: I want that ship.

lines.speaker: u5107
lines.text: Excuse me.  I didn't mean to disturb....  What am I saying?

lines.speaker: u5106
lines.text: They're...pretending to dress.

lines.speaker: u5107
lines.text: What d'you mean, pretending? They are dressing.  Where'd they get those clothes?

lines.speaker: u5108
lines.text: To a lot of psychiatric small talk --

lines.speaker: u5110
lines.text: And we can watch ...

lines.speaker: u5108
lines.text: A display of primitive apparatus --

lines.speaker: u5112
lines.text: May I say something personal?

lines.speaker: u5109
lines.text: Please

lines.speaker: u5112
lines.text: I like you.

lines.speaker: u5113
lines.text: You were injected with glucose. There is no Plutoxin 7 virus. You were never going to die - at least not from anything we gave you.

lines.speaker: u5116
lines.text: C'mon, Snake - it's L.A. Everything's phony, you know that.

lines.speaker: u5117
lines.text: Oh Cuervo...

lines.speaker: u5114
lines.text: What?

lines.speaker: u5117
lines.text: It's so good to see you again.

lines.speaker: u5114
lines.text: Where's Plissken?

lines.speaker: u5117
lines.text: He's... near.

lines.speaker: u5114
lines.text: You're stalling, Eddie.  Talk, you little gringo!

lines.speaker: u5117
lines.text: Cuervo, look out behind you!

lines.speaker: u5120
lines.text: I think we've burned off enough fuel. We may be lighter enough to hover. Just barely.

lines.speaker: u5115
lines.text: Can you land?

lines.speaker: u5120
lines.text: No. The right skid's broken. If I try to set it down she'll crash. I have to stay in a hoverwhile you jump off.  Hey, Carjack. We gotta hide the girl. Give her your dress.

lines.speaker: u5115
lines.text: My name is no longer Carjack. Will you please get that through your fucking head?

lines.speaker: u5116
lines.text: Relax, war hero. We took you for a ride, and you came through. Not bad for a dirtbag like you.

lines.speaker: u5121
lines.text: You're free, Plissken. But if you even so much as break wind on a country road I'll crush you like a bug.

lines.speaker: u5120
lines.text: Is that what I think it is?

lines.speaker: u5117
lines.text: Yeah. The place kept changing owners. Finally went bankrupt. That thing in Paris killed 'em.

lines.speaker: u5118
lines.text: Say, you need anything, Snake? Guns? Explosives? I can get you a crate of hellfire grenades, no problem - five hours.

lines.speaker: u5120
lines.text: Yeah. So how do I get to Venice?

lines.speaker: u5118
lines.text: All the sewers are collapsed under Venice. You have to go topside. Right up there.

lines.speaker: u5119
lines.text: You ain't doin' so good, Snake. You need help.  You should talk to Hershe. She hates Cuervo. They used to be partners, but they split up.

lines.speaker: u5120
lines.text: Who?

lines.speaker: u5119
lines.text: Hershe. She lives downtown with Mojo Dellasandro in the big boat. Down that way.

lines.speaker: u5120
lines.text: The President's promised to give whoever helps me 1 million dollars.

lines.speaker: u5122
lines.text: Yeah? Greenbacks? I got ten million of them.

lines.speaker: u5120
lines.text: Uh-uh. Bluebacks.

lines.speaker: u5127
lines.text: I loved you much, as King, and sometimes as husband, but one cannot gaze too long at the sun in the sky.

lines.speaker: u5125
lines.text: Forgive me, my wife, if you can. I was not born to live a man's life, but to be the stuff of future memory. The fellowship was a brief beginning, a fair time that cannot be forgotten; and because it will not be forgotten, that fair time may come again. Now once more I must ride with my knights to defend what was, and the dream of what could be.

lines.speaker: u5127
lines.text: I have kept it.

lines.speaker: u5126
lines.text: Who does it serve?

lines.speaker: u5133
lines.text: You, my lord.

lines.speaker: u5126
lines.text: I have waited long for you. Once you almost saw, but fear blinded you. Why am I served from the chalice?

lines.speaker: u5133
lines.text: Because you and the land are one.

lines.speaker: u5126
lines.text: I am wasting away and I cannot die. And I cannot live.

lines.speaker: u5133
lines.text: You and the land are one. Drink from the chalice. You will be reborn and the land with you.

lines.speaker: u5129
lines.text: The King without his sword, the land without a king...

lines.speaker: u5127
lines.text: We are to blame.

lines.speaker: u5133
lines.text: I have found you. The Queen. An apple. Tomorrow. Sir Gawain...

lines.speaker: u5129
lines.text: --It must wait, child. These good ladies, for whom I intervened once, will honor me with a meal. I am beholden to them now as I was when they begged my protection.

lines.speaker: u5130
lines.text: It's not for you, Uther, hearth and home, wife and child.

lines.speaker: u5135
lines.text: To kill and be king, is that all?

lines.speaker: u5130
lines.text: Maybe not even that, Uther. I thought once that you were the one to unite the land under one sword. But it'll take another, a greater king...

lines.speaker: u5135
lines.text: You strike me with words as hard as steel.

lines.speaker: u5130
lines.text: They are not weapons, my friend, but truths. You betrayed the Duke, stole his wife and took his castle, now no one trusts you. Lot, Uryens, your allies will turn against you. Give me the child, Uther, I will protect him. Go back to your war tent.

lines.speaker: u5138
lines.text: What honey?

lines.speaker: u5136
lines.text: Fuck it.

lines.speaker: u5137
lines.text: You're convinced that it's genuine.

lines.speaker: u5144
lines.text: I don't know. No, not really I suppose. But I've made a prudent judgement that it meets the conditions set down in the Ritual.

lines.speaker: u5137
lines.text: You'd want to do the exorcism yourself?

lines.speaker: u5144
lines.text: Yes.

lines.speaker: u5137
lines.text: It might be best to have a man with experience. Maybe someone who's spent time in the foreign missions.

lines.speaker: u5144
lines.text: I see, your excellency.

lines.speaker: u5137
lines.text: Let's see whose around. In the meantime I'll call you as soon as I know.

lines.speaker: u5144
lines.text: Thank you your excellency.

lines.speaker: u5141
lines.text: There haven't been more than a hundred authenticated cases of so- called split personality, Mrs. MacNeil. Now I know the temptation is to leap to psychiatry, but any reasonable psychiatrist would exhaust the somatic possibilities first.

lines.speaker: u5138
lines.text: So what's next?

lines.speaker: u5141
lines.text: A pneumoencephelogram, I would think, pin down that lesion. It will involve another spinal.

lines.speaker: u5138
lines.text: Oh, Christ.

lines.speaker: u5141
lines.text: What we missed in the EEG and the arteriogram could conceivably turn up there. At the least, it would eliminate certain other possibilities.

lines.speaker: u5145
lines.text: Do you like films?

lines.speaker: u5142
lines.text: Sure.

lines.speaker: u5145
lines.text: I get passes. In fact I got a pass for The Crest tomorrow night. Would you like to go?

lines.speaker: u5142
lines.text: What's playing.

lines.speaker: u5145
lines.text: Withering Heights.

lines.speaker: u5142
lines.text: Who's in it?

lines.speaker: u5145
lines.text: Heathcliff, Jackie Gleason, and in the role of Catherine Earnshaw, Lucille Ball.

lines.speaker: u5142
lines.text: I've seen it.

lines.speaker: u5145
lines.text: Another one. Had your lunch?

lines.speaker: u5142
lines.text: No.

lines.speaker: u5145
lines.text: Hey, Father? You like movies?

lines.speaker: u5144
lines.text: Very much.

lines.speaker: u5145
lines.text: I get passes to the best shows in town. Mrs. K though, she gets tired and never likes to go.

lines.speaker: u5144
lines.text: That's to bad.

lines.speaker: u5145
lines.text: Yeah, I hate to go alone. You know, I like to talk film; discuss the critique. D'you wanna see a film with me? I got passes to The Crest. It's Othello.

lines.speaker: u5144
lines.text: Who's in it?

lines.speaker: u5145
lines.text: Who's in it? Debbie Reynolds, Desdemona, and Othello, Groucho Marx. You're happy?

lines.speaker: u5144
lines.text: I've seen it.

lines.speaker: u5145
lines.text: One last time: Can you think of some priest who fits the bill?

lines.speaker: u5144
lines.text: Come on!

lines.speaker: u5145
lines.text: Answer the question, Father Paranoia.

lines.speaker: u5144
lines.text: Alright. You know who I think really did it?

lines.speaker: u5145
lines.text: Who?

lines.speaker: u5144
lines.text: The Dominicans. Go pick on them.

lines.speaker: u5145
lines.text: I could have you deported, you know that?

lines.speaker: u5146
lines.text: ...look down in pity...

lines.speaker: u5152
lines.text: You killed your mother!!! You left her alone to die!!!! She'll never forgive you!!! Bastard!!!

lines.speaker: u5154
lines.text: Miss?

lines.speaker: u5148
lines.text: Yes?

lines.speaker: u5154
lines.text: We want to see Mrs. Karras.

lines.speaker: u5148
lines.text: Do you have an appointment?

lines.speaker: u5154
lines.text: Yes

lines.speaker: u5148
lines.text: Are you a relative?

lines.speaker: u5154
lines.text: Yes I am her brother, he's the son

lines.speaker: u5148
lines.text: Just a minute.

lines.speaker: u5151
lines.text: No.

lines.speaker: u5150
lines.text: Why not?

lines.speaker: u5151
lines.text: I'm afraid.

lines.speaker: u5150
lines.text: If he talks to me, I think he'll leave you. Do you want him to leave you?

lines.speaker: u5151
lines.text: Yes.

lines.speaker: u5156
lines.text: Give me the keys.

lines.speaker: u5163
lines.text: You're not going to drive.

lines.speaker: u5156
lines.text: Give me the keys!

lines.speaker: u5163
lines.text: You're not going to drive!

lines.speaker: u5156
lines.text: It's my goddamn car!

lines.speaker: u5163
lines.text: It's our goddamn car!

lines.speaker: u5156
lines.text: Give me the keys.

lines.speaker: u5163
lines.text: No.

lines.speaker: u5161
lines.text: What're you saying, Charlie?

lines.speaker: u5157
lines.text: Look, Frankie.  You and Jack been playing here, a long time.

lines.speaker: u5161
lines.text: Twelve years.

lines.speaker: u5157
lines.text: Right, twelve years.  Couple times a month.

lines.speaker: u5161
lines.text: So?

lines.speaker: u5157
lines.text: So maybe it's time we took a vacation from each other.

lines.speaker: u5161
lines.text: Vacation?  Christ, Charlie, it's a Monday night. You said so yourself.

lines.speaker: u5157
lines.text: It wasn't half full out there tonight, Frankie. I got six waiters standing in back listening to baseball.  I gotta move the liquor. To move the liquor, I gotta fill the tables. It's a matter of economics.  Me, I love you. I love both you guys, you know that. You're class.  But people today. They don't know class if it walks up and grabs 'em by the balls.

lines.speaker: u5158
lines.text: Honey ...

lines.speaker: u5161
lines.text: You believe this?  The kid won't come out.  I'm playing 'Camptown Races' for him and the next thing I know he's locked himself in the bathroom. There's nothing sharp in there, is there?

lines.speaker: u5158
lines.text: Honey ...

lines.speaker: u5161
lines.text: Where are our kids? Has he got one of them in there?

lines.speaker: u5158
lines.text: Frank.

lines.speaker: u5164
lines.text: What do you do to him?

lines.speaker: u5159
lines.text: Don't worry, Mr. Baker.  We'll knock him out. He won't feel a thing.

lines.speaker: u5164
lines.text: I think maybe I'll bring him back next week ...

lines.speaker: u5159
lines.text: The sooner we do this the better, Mr. Baker.

lines.speaker: u5160
lines.text: What do you say we go for a walk, pal.

lines.speaker: u5164
lines.text: Get your hand off me.

lines.speaker: u5160
lines.text: Come on, friend.  I can smell it on you. Get yourself a cup of coffee.  You'll forget what you're angry about.

lines.speaker: u5164
lines.text: Go fuck yourself.

lines.speaker: u5160
lines.text: You're a real tough guy when the ladies are around, aren't you, Ace?

lines.speaker: u5164
lines.text: I don't see any ladies here. Except maybe you.

lines.speaker: u5166
lines.text: Yes, sir.  That's quite a girl you boys latched onto.  She a local?

lines.speaker: u5161
lines.text: Born and bred.

lines.speaker: u5166
lines.text: Lucky for you.  Well, there you go, guys. Don't spend it all in one place. Oh ... you want to count it, Jack?

lines.speaker: u5161
lines.text: We trust you, Lloyd.  You know that.

lines.speaker: u5164
lines.text: Brought it.

lines.speaker: u5162
lines.text: Shit, thank God.  You look like a creep.

lines.speaker: u5164
lines.text: Thanks.

lines.speaker: u5162
lines.text: I mean, I'd hate to think I'd pick up someone who wore that shit.

lines.speaker: u5170
lines.text: How's that dog of yours?  What was his name?

lines.speaker: u5164
lines.text: Eddie.

lines.speaker: u5170
lines.text: Yes.  Right.  Eddie.  How is he?

lines.speaker: u5164
lines.text: He's losing his teeth.

lines.speaker: u5189
lines.text: You better be nice, Castor. You could get mighty lonely now that Pollux is gone.

lines.speaker: u5177
lines.text: Pollux is -- what?

lines.speaker: u5189
lines.text: Archer cut him a deal for turning state's evidence. He's free.

lines.speaker: u5177
lines.text: Walton, you have to let me see the warden --

lines.speaker: u5189
lines.text: Or what?  You'll have me fired?

lines.speaker: u5179
lines.text: Just saving the tax-payers the cost of a trial.  So take a hike.

lines.speaker: u5178
lines.text: What's the matter with your voice, Commander?

lines.speaker: u5179
lines.text: Castor Troy almost strangled me to death.  Where the hell were you?

lines.speaker: u5182
lines.text: Remember this from our junior prom?  Boy, were you ever mad for Madonna.

lines.speaker: u5179
lines.text: Back then -- who wasn't?

lines.speaker: u5182
lines.text: Wait a second -- you hated Madonna.  Didn't you?

lines.speaker: u5200
lines.text: Hello?

lines.speaker: u5192
lines.text: Hey Santa, where are you? Everybodys here.

lines.speaker: u5200
lines.text: Adelle?

lines.speaker: u5192
lines.text: You were supposed to be here half an hour ago...the emergency strategy session? Your trip to Aspen? Theyre all panicked here...

lines.speaker: u5200
lines.text: No.

lines.speaker: u5193
lines.text: So what are we gonna do, Jack?

lines.speaker: u5194
lines.text: Is it morning yet?

lines.speaker: u5200
lines.text: No, honey. Go back to sleep.

lines.speaker: u5195
lines.text: Wait a second...  Jack...Jack...

lines.speaker: u5200
lines.text: Yes...Jack Campbell...

lines.speaker: u5195
lines.text: Of course. Jack Campbell. I went to high school with you...you played baseball, right?  Youre doing well...

lines.speaker: u5200
lines.text: Yes, thats it...yes, we went to high school together.

lines.speaker: u5195
lines.text: You never really talked to me.  I wanted to talk to you, man...

lines.speaker: u5200
lines.text: Yeah...I guess I just wanted you to know, we couldve been really good friends...

lines.speaker: u5196
lines.text: Cmon Jack...

lines.speaker: u5200
lines.text: I mean it.  From what I can tell, were a mom and pop operation, were already over-extended in sales, and any price advantage we could offer would easily be matched by a larger supplier...

lines.speaker: u5208
lines.text: You leave now.  Take ticket somewhere else.  Next customer in line...!

lines.speaker: u5197
lines.text: You first generation, xenophobic, money-theistic, hot pastrami sandwich making...

lines.speaker: u5208
lines.text: Get out!

lines.speaker: u5198
lines.text: Are we finally being honest?

lines.speaker: u5200
lines.text: It would help me if we were.

lines.speaker: u5198
lines.text: Okay, youre right, weve been dancing around this for years...

lines.speaker: u5199
lines.text: Whoa, whoa, whoa...hold it right there...

lines.speaker: u5200
lines.text: Frank.  Wheres Alan Mintz?  Is he here yet?

lines.speaker: u5199
lines.text: Mr. Mintz?  I dont think so...buildings closed pal.  Youll have to come back tomorrow.

lines.speaker: u5200
lines.text: Look, I dont know whats going on here but I am Senior Vice President of this company.

lines.speaker: u5199
lines.text: I dont care who you are.  Its Christmas and like I told you the building is closed.

lines.speaker: u5200
lines.text: Maybe youre not hearing me.  I am Jack Campbell...  Right here.  Jack Campbell, President...

lines.speaker: u5200
lines.text: Thats totally see through...

lines.speaker: u5207
lines.text: Merry Christmas...

lines.speaker: u5200
lines.text: Christmas?  It cant be Christmas...

lines.speaker: u5201
lines.text: I found it!

lines.speaker: u5204
lines.text: Congratulations. The La Guardia flights canceled but I got you out of Kennedy on United at nine. Am I good or what?

lines.speaker: u5210
lines.text: We're going to have to work on your touch.

lines.speaker: u5211
lines.text: I like the sound of that.

lines.speaker: u5218
lines.text: <u>Where is Reed</u>?

lines.speaker: u5211
lines.text: Victor must've taken him.

lines.speaker: u5213
lines.text: But...this disease...is progressive... degenerative...

lines.speaker: u5220
lines.text: That's terrible news...

lines.speaker: u5218
lines.text: What are you doing --

lines.speaker: u5214
lines.text: Sis.  Let <u>me</u> take care of <u>you</u> for once.

lines.speaker: u5218
lines.text: But Johnny...you <u>can't fly</u>.

lines.speaker: u5220
lines.text: Make sure you find Ben, bring him back here.  And keep it quiet.  I don't need this to hit the press.

lines.speaker: u5215
lines.text: Yes sir.  You've got the Mayor at eight, then a nine-thirty interview with the Journal --

lines.speaker: u5220
lines.text: Front page?

lines.speaker: u5215
lines.text: Top left, like you asked.  Today Wall Street.  Tomorrow, who knows...maybe Washington.

lines.speaker: u5216
lines.text: I found a broken gasket, from space --

lines.speaker: u5218
lines.text: A <u>gasket</u>?  Reed, we're at a party.

lines.speaker: u5218
lines.text: Please don't make this personal --

lines.speaker: u5220
lines.text: Oh, I think you already have.

lines.speaker: u5218
lines.text: Victor, we <u>can't do anything</u> until the research is ready.

lines.speaker: u5219
lines.text: Reed's gonna fix me up --

lines.speaker: u5220
lines.text: For your sake I hope you're right. I'm sorry if that sounds a little skeptical.

lines.speaker: u5219
lines.text: Skeptical...?

lines.speaker: u5226
lines.text: I'll be standing by. <I'll> know.

lines.speaker: u5221
lines.text: And no matter what happens, you're to take orders <only> from Dr. Michaels, understand?

lines.speaker: u5224
lines.text: We better get back to the sub. Every second counts now.

lines.speaker: u5222
lines.text: Look! They follow the direction of her glance, are startled to see:

lines.speaker: u5224
lines.text: You said there was a quick way out!

lines.speaker: u5223
lines.text: What about Dr. Michaels?

lines.speaker: u5224
lines.text: It's too late!

lines.speaker: u5229
lines.text: How's it look?

lines.speaker: u5224
lines.text: I could use a lawnmower...

lines.speaker: u5228
lines.text: It's a dangerous procedure. If I miss the timing, we could explode the tanks... But I'm willing to try it.

lines.speaker: u5226
lines.text: Yes, by all means. We must try it.

lines.speaker: u5227
lines.text: There seems to be something wrong with the Escape Hatch...

lines.speaker: u5228
lines.text: What do you mean?

lines.speaker: u5227
lines.text: Fluid is seeping through. Better come down and have a look!

lines.speaker: u5232
lines.text: Ophhem ma fuchem gaphe!

lines.speaker: u5231
lines.text: May I have your ticket, please?

lines.speaker: u5240
lines.text: Yah, I got the money, but, uh -

lines.speaker: u5232
lines.text: Don't you fucking but me, Jerry.  I want you with this money on the Dayton- Radisson parking ramp, top level, thirty minutes, and we'll wrap this up.

lines.speaker: u5240
lines.text: Yah, okay, but, uh -

lines.speaker: u5232
lines.text: You're there in thirty minutes or I find you, Jerry, and I shoot you, and I shoot your fucking wife, and I shoot all your little fucking children, and I shoot 'em all in the back of their little fucking heads. Got it?

lines.speaker: u5240
lines.text: ...Yah, well, you stay away from Scotty now -

lines.speaker: u5232
lines.text: GOT IT?

lines.speaker: u5240
lines.text: Okay, real good, then.

lines.speaker: u5240
lines.text: Yah, ya got yer, this loaded here, this has yer independent, uh, yer slipped differential, uh, yer rack- and-pinion steering, yer alarm and radar, and I can give it to ya with a heck of a sealant, this TruCoat stuff, it'll keep the salt off -

lines.speaker: u5233
lines.text: Yah, I don't need no sealant though.

lines.speaker: u5240
lines.text: Yah, you don't need that. Now were you thinking of financing here?  You oughta be aware a this GMAC plan they have now, it's really super -

lines.speaker: u5234
lines.text: Both of these.

lines.speaker: u5243
lines.text: Oh, no, I can't let you do that.

lines.speaker: u5234
lines.text: Oh, don't be silly.

lines.speaker: u5243
lines.text: Well, okay - thank you, Detective.

lines.speaker: u5234
lines.text: Oh, don't be silly.

lines.speaker: u5235
lines.text: The numbers y'asked for, calls made from the lobby pay phone at the Blue Ox. Two to Minneapolis that night.

lines.speaker: u5243
lines.text: Mm.

lines.speaker: u5235
lines.text: First one's a trucking company, second one's a private residence.  A Shep Proudfoot.

lines.speaker: u5243
lines.text: Uh-huh... A what?

lines.speaker: u5235
lines.text: Shep Proudfoot. That's a name.

lines.speaker: u5243
lines.text: Uh-huh.

lines.speaker: u5235
lines.text: Yah.

lines.speaker: u5243
lines.text: ...Yah, okay, I think I'll drive down there, then.

lines.speaker: u5235
lines.text: Oh, yah? Twin Cities?

lines.speaker: u5237
lines.text: They said they were goin' to the Twin Cities?

lines.speaker: u5243
lines.text: Oh, yah?

lines.speaker: u5238
lines.text: He was a little older. Looked like the Marlboro man.

lines.speaker: u5243
lines.text: Yah?

lines.speaker: u5238
lines.text: Yah. Maybe I'm sayin' that cause he smoked Marlboros.

lines.speaker: u5243
lines.text: Uh-huh.

lines.speaker: u5238
lines.text: A subconscious-type thing.

lines.speaker: u5243
lines.text: Yah, that can happen.

lines.speaker: u5238
lines.text: Yah.

lines.speaker: u5247
lines.text: ...What's the big deal? It's an hour -

lines.speaker: u5239
lines.text: Hold on.

lines.speaker: u5240
lines.text: Say, Shep, how ya doin' there?

lines.speaker: u5249
lines.text: Mm.

lines.speaker: u5240
lines.text: Say, ya know those two fellas ya put me in touch with, up there in Fargo?

lines.speaker: u5249
lines.text: Put you in touch with Grimsrud.

lines.speaker: u5240
lines.text: Well, yah, but he had a buddy there. He, uh -

lines.speaker: u5249
lines.text: Well, I don't vouch for him.

lines.speaker: u5240
lines.text: Well, that's okay, I just -

lines.speaker: u5249
lines.text: I vouch for Grimsrud. Who's his buddy?

lines.speaker: u5240
lines.text: Carl somethin'?

lines.speaker: u5249
lines.text: Never heard of him. Don't vouch for him.

lines.speaker: u5240
lines.text: Well, that's okay, he's a buddy of the guy ya vouched for, so I'm not worryin'. I just, I was wonderin', see, I gotta get in touch with 'em for, I might not need it anymore, sumpn's happenin', see -

lines.speaker: u5249
lines.text: Call 'em up.

lines.speaker: u5240
lines.text: Yah, well, see, I did that, and I haven't been able to get 'em, so I thought you maybe'd know an alternate number or what have ya.

lines.speaker: u5249
lines.text: Nope.

lines.speaker: u5243
lines.text: How we doin' on that vehicle?

lines.speaker: u5241
lines.text: No motels registered any tan Ciera last night. But the night before, two men checked into the Blue Ox registering a Ciera and leavin' the tag space blank.

lines.speaker: u5243
lines.text: Geez, that's a good lead. The Blue Ox, that's that trucker's joint out there on I-35?

lines.speaker: u5241
lines.text: Yah. Owner was on the desk then, said these two guys had company.

lines.speaker: u5243
lines.text: Oh, yah?

lines.speaker: u5242
lines.text: ...I'll fix ya some eggs.

lines.speaker: u5243
lines.text: Aw, Norm.

lines.speaker: u5243
lines.text: Uh-huh.

lines.speaker: u5254
lines.text: We called his house; his little boy said he hadn't been there.

lines.speaker: u5243
lines.text: And his wife?

lines.speaker: u5254
lines.text: She's visiting relatives in Florida. Now his boss, this guy Gustafson, he's also disappeared. Nobody at his office knows where he is.

lines.speaker: u5243
lines.text: Geez. Looks like this thing goes higher than we thought. You call his home?

lines.speaker: u5254
lines.text: His wife's in the hospital, has been for a couple months. The big C.

lines.speaker: u5243
lines.text: Oh, my.

lines.text: Well, that's alright... alright. Good.  You'll graduate in another year, isn't that right?  You know... I never finished college.  I was a good student, but I never finished. Of course, there was a war then.

lines.text: Mr. Cicci.  From the year 1927 to the present time, you were an employee of the "Genco Olive Oil Company."

lines.speaker: u5555
lines.text: But in actuality, you were a member of the Corleone Crime organization.

lines.speaker: u5530
lines.text: The Corleone Family, Senator.  We called it, "The Family."

lines.text: What position did you occupy?

lines.speaker: u5530
lines.text: At first, like everybody, I was a soldier.

lines.speaker: u5531
lines.text: Vitone!  Our driver has drunk too much wine.

lines.speaker: u5558

lines.text: I want to talk to you, Michael.

lines.speaker: u5545

lines.speaker: u5532
lines.text: I hated you for so long, Michael; for so many years.  I think I did things to myself, to hurt myself, so that you would know -- and you would be hurt too.  But I understand you now; I think I do.  You were being strong for all of us, like Papa was.  And I forgive you, and want to be close to you now.  Can't you forgive Fredo; he's so sweet, and helpless without you.

lines.speaker: u5545

lines.speaker: u5534

lines.text: I know.  I know, Michael.  It's Christmas, your brothers and sister are all here -- we are happy. Let's not spoil this.  Go your own way, but when you are ready, come to me the way a son should.  I have hopes for you...

lines.text: I didn't know it was a hit.  I swear to you I didn't know.  Johnny Ola contacted me in Beverly Hills -- said he wanted to talk.  He said you and Roth were in on some big deal, and there was a place for me in it if I could help them out. They said you were being tough on the negotiation, and if they had a little bit of help, they could close it fast and it would be good for you.

Send Fredo off to do this, send Fredo to take care of that... take care of some little unimportant night club here, and there; pick somebody up at the airport.  Mike, I'm your older brother; I was stepped over!

lines.speaker: u5538
lines.text: It wasn't the way I wanted it!  I can handle things.  I'm not dumb Christ, not like everyone says. I'm smart; and I want respect.

lines.text: You're nothing to me now, Fredo; not a brother, not a friend, I don't want to know you, or what happens to you.  I don't want to see you at the hotels, or near my home.  When you visit our Mother, I want to know a day in advance, so I won't be there.  Do you understand?

lines.speaker: u5545
lines.text: How can I let you leave; how can I let you take my children away? Don't you know me?  You understand, it's an impossibility.  I would never let it happen; no, never, not if it took all my strength, all my cunning.  But in time, soon, you'll feel differently.  You see, you'll be happy that I stopped you.  I know you.  You'll forget about this; you'll forget about the baby we lost... and we'll go on, you and I.

lines.speaker: u5541
lines.text: The baby I lost...

lines.speaker: u5545
lines.text: I know what it meant... and I'm prepared to make it up to you.  I will make changes; I can.  I CAN change; that I have learned, that I have the strength to change... And we have another child, a boy... and you'll forget the miscarriage.

lines.speaker: u5541
lines.text: It wasn't a miscarriage.  And you with your cunning, couldn't you figure it out!  It was an abortion; an abortion, like our marriage is an abortion, something unholy and evil.  I don't want your son; I wouldn't bring another of your sons into this world.  An abortion, Michael... it was a son, and I had it killed, but this must all end!

lines.text: But the rest of it?  The killing headaches.  The phantom smells.  My inability to close my eyes without thinking a hundred things at once. It's all nothing more than bad electricity?
