lines.text: I ought to done it then--an' not come on any trip like this.

lines.speaker: u5652
lines.text: Fella named Spencer sent us--said they was work pickin' peaches.

lines.speaker: u5630
lines.text: Want to work, do you?

lines.speaker: u5652
lines.text: Sure do.

lines.speaker: u5630
lines.text: Pull up behind that car.  Okay for this one. Take 'em through.

lines.speaker: u5652
lines.text: What's the matter? What's happened?

lines.speaker: u5630
lines.text: Little trouble up ahead, but you'll get through. Just follow the line.

lines.speaker: u5643
lines.text: Have it your own way, son, but just as sure as you touch my house with that cat I'm gonna blow you plumb to kingdom come.

lines.speaker: u5631
lines.text: You ain't gonna blow nobody nowhere. First place, you'd get hung and you know it. For another, it wouldn't be two days before they'd have another guy here to take my place.

lines.speaker: u5632
lines.text: I never asked you!

lines.speaker: u5652
lines.text: Sure, but you'd a throwed a fit if I hadn't tol' you.

lines.speaker: u5633
lines.text: You people got a lotta nerve.

lines.speaker: u5652
lines.text: What you mean?

lines.speaker: u5633
lines.text: Crossin' the desert in a jalopy like this.

lines.speaker: u5652
lines.text: You been acrost?

lines.speaker: u5633
lines.text: Sure, plenty, but not in no wreck like this.

lines.speaker: u5652
lines.text: If we broke down maybe somebody'd give us a han'.

lines.speaker: u5633
lines.text: Well, maybe. But I'd hate to be doin' it. Takes more nerve than I got.

lines.speaker: u5652
lines.text: It don't take no nerve to do somep'n when there ain't nothin' else you can do.

lines.speaker: u5635
lines.text: An' the nex' thing you know you'll be out, because they got it all figgered down to a T--until the harvest is in you're a *migrant* worker--afterwards, just a bum.

lines.speaker: u5652
lines.text: Five they're a-gettin' now, an' that's all they're int'rested in. I know exackly what Pa'd say. He'd jus' say it wasn't none a his business.

lines.speaker: u5636
lines.text: I could break up some bresh if you want me, ma'am.

lines.speaker: u5640
lines.text: You want to get ast to eat, hunh?

lines.speaker: u5636
lines.text: Yes, ma'am.

lines.speaker: u5640
lines.text: Didn' you have no breakfast?

lines.speaker: u5636
lines.text: No, ma'am. They ain't no work hereabouts. Pa's in tryin' to sell some stuff to get gas so's we can get along.

lines.speaker: u5640
lines.text: Didn' none of these have no breakfast?

lines.speaker: u5637
lines.text: *Ain't* a-goin'... ain't a-goin'...

lines.speaker: u5652
lines.text: 'S all right, Grampa. You just kind a tar'd, that's all. Somebody fix a pallet.

lines.speaker: u5638
lines.text: Where you think you're going?

lines.speaker: u5652
lines.text: Thought I'd take a walk. Any law against it?

lines.speaker: u5638
lines.text: Well, you just turn around and walk the other way.

lines.speaker: u5652
lines.text: You mean I can't even get outa here?

lines.speaker: u5638
lines.text: Not tonight you can't. Want to walk back?--or you want me to whistle up some help and take you back?

lines.speaker: u5652
lines.text: I'll walk back.

lines.speaker: u5639
lines.text: I got to get a lot curiouser than I am--with all them cops out there.

lines.speaker: u5652
lines.text: Okay. I be back a little later.

lines.speaker: u5652
lines.text: They was some cops here, Ma. They was takin' down the license numbers. It looks like somebody knows sump'n.

lines.speaker: u5640
lines.text: It had to come, I reckon, soon or later.

lines.speaker: u5652
lines.text: I'd like to stay. I'd like to be with ya--  --an' see your face when you an' Pa get settled in a nice little place. I sure wish I could see you then. But--  --I guess I won't never be able to do that. Not now.

lines.speaker: u5640
lines.text: I could hide you, Tommy.

lines.speaker: u5652
lines.text: I know you would, Ma. But I ain't gonna let you. You hide somebody that's kilt a man an'... an' you'd be in trouble too.

lines.speaker: u5640
lines.text: Awright, Tommy. What you figger you gonna do?

lines.speaker: u5652
lines.text: You know what I been thinkin' about, Ma? About Casy. About what he said, what he done, an' about how he died. An' I remember all of it.

lines.speaker: u5640
lines.text: He was a good man.

lines.speaker: u5652
lines.text: I been thinkin' about us, too--about our people livin' like pigs, an' good rich lan' layin' fallow, or maybe one fella with a million acres, while a hundred thousan' farmers is starvin'. An' I been wonderin' if all our folks got together an' yelled--

lines.speaker: u5640
lines.text: Tommy, they'll drive you, an' cut you down like they done to Casy.

lines.speaker: u5652
lines.text: They gonna drive me anyways. Soon or later they'll get me, for one thing if not another. Until then...

lines.speaker: u5640
lines.text: You don't aim to kill nobody, Tom!

lines.speaker: u5652
lines.text: No, Ma. Not that. That ain't it. But long as I'm a outlaw, anyways, maybe I can do sump'n. Maybe I can jus' fin' out sump'n. Jus' scrounge aroun' an' try to fin' out what it is that's wrong, an then see if they ain't sump'n could be done about it.  But I ain't thought it out clear, Ma. I can't. I don't know enough.

lines.speaker: u5640
lines.text: How'm I gonna know 'bout you? They might kill you an' I wouldn't know. They might hurt you. How'm I gonna know?

lines.speaker: u5652
lines.text: Well, maybe it's like Casy says, a fella ain't got a soul of his own, but on'y a piece of a big soul--the one big soul that belongs to ever'body-- an' then...

lines.speaker: u5640
lines.text: Then what, Tom?

lines.speaker: u5652
lines.text: Then it don't matter. Then I'll be all aroun' in the dark. I'll be ever'where--wherever you look. Wherever there's a fight so hungry people can eat, I'll be there. Wherever there's a cop beatin' up a guy, I'll be there. I'll be in the way guys yell when they're mad--an' I'll be in the way kids laugh when they're hungry an' they know supper's ready. An' when our people eat the stuff they raise, an' live in the houses they build, why, I'll be there too.

lines.speaker: u5640
lines.text: I don't understan' it, Tom.

lines.speaker: u5652
lines.text: Me neither.  It's jus' stuff I been thinkin' about. Gimme you han', Ma. Good-by.

lines.speaker: u5640
lines.text: Good-by, Tom. Later--when it's blowed over--you'll come back? You'll try to fin' us?

lines.speaker: u5652
lines.text: Sure. Good-by.

lines.speaker: u5640
lines.text: Good-by, Tommy.

lines.speaker: u5641
lines.text: Oh, them? Well, no--them's *two* for a penny.

lines.speaker: u5644
lines.text: Well, give me two then, ma'am.

lines.speaker: u5643
lines.text: Then who *do* we shoot?

lines.speaker: u5650
lines.text: Brother, I don't know. If I did I'd tell you. But I just don't know *who's* to blame!

lines.speaker: u5643
lines.text: Well, I'm right here to tell you, mister, ain't *nobody* going to push me off *my* land! Grampa took up this land seventy years ago. My pa was born here. We was *all* born on it, and some of us got killed on it, and some died on it. And that's what makes it ourn--bein' born on it, and workin' it, and dyin' on it--and not no piece of paper with writin' on it! So just come on and try to push me off!

lines.speaker: u5644
lines.text: But what does *that* prove?

lines.speaker: u5648
lines.text: Look at 'em! Same yella han'bill-- 800 pickers wanted. Awright, this man wants 800 men. So he prints up 5,000 a them han'bills an' maybe 20,000 people sees 'em. An' maybe two-three thousan' starts movin, wes' account a this han'bill. Two- three thousan' folks that's crazy with worry headin' out for 800 jobs! Does that make sense?

lines.speaker: u5652
lines.text: Cut it out, Pa. He'p Al with the truck.  Don't fret, honey. You goin' to be awright.

lines.speaker: u5645
lines.text: Tom, I jus' don't feel like nothin' a tall. Without him I jus' don't wanta live.

lines.speaker: u5652
lines.text: Maybe he'll be back. We'll leave word for him. Jus' don't cry.

lines.speaker: u5653
lines.text: Lemme go! I didn't go to do it!

lines.speaker: u5646
lines.text: Keep qui'te, will ya! Shet your mouth!

lines.speaker: u5653
lines.text: I never knowed it! All I done was pull that string!

lines.speaker: u5646
lines.text: Lissen. You done busted it. You hear?  But lissen here. I won't tell nobody, y'understan'?

lines.speaker: u5653
lines.text: Please don't.

lines.speaker: u5646
lines.text: I won't--  --if you won't tell what *I* done!

lines.speaker: u5647
lines.text: Now you done it! You busted it!

lines.speaker: u5654
lines.text: I never--

lines.speaker: u5649
lines.text: Morning.

lines.speaker: u5652
lines.text: Morning.

lines.speaker: u5649
lines.text: You people looking for work?

lines.speaker: u5652
lines.text: Mister, we're lookin' even under boards for work.

lines.speaker: u5649
lines.text: Can you pick peaches?

lines.speaker: u5652
lines.text: We can pick anything.

lines.speaker: u5649
lines.text: Well, there's plenty of work for you about forty miles north, this road just outside Pixley. Turn east on 32 and look for Hooper's ranch. Tell 'em Spencer sent you.

lines.speaker: u5652
lines.text: Yes, sir.

lines.speaker: u5651
lines.text: Awright. An' if she gets outa han', I'll be in the right han' corner, this side the dance floor.

lines.speaker: u5652
lines.text: Ain't gonna get outa han'.

lines.speaker: u5655
lines.text: You do not.

lines.speaker: u5668
lines.text: Yes I do.

lines.speaker: u5655
lines.text: You don't...

lines.speaker: u5668
lines.text: In the corporate offices.

lines.speaker: u5655
lines.text: Oh... really?

lines.speaker: u5668
lines.text: Yeah...

lines.speaker: u5655
lines.text: What do you do?

lines.speaker: u5668
lines.text: I sell biscuits to the Southland.

lines.speaker: u5655
lines.text: You do not.

lines.speaker: u5668
lines.text: It's what I do.

lines.speaker: u5655
lines.text: You're so funny...

lines.speaker: u5668
lines.text: I sell biscuits and gravy all over the Southland--

lines.speaker: u5655
lines.text: --Stop it--

lines.speaker: u5668
lines.text: You know those horsey biscuit gravy packets? I move all of those--

lines.speaker: u5655
lines.text: --No.

lines.speaker: u5668
lines.text: Sometimes we sell them to McDonald's and just change them to special barbecue sauce.

lines.speaker: u5656
lines.text: We had pictures put on, that way everybody knows who everybody was!

lines.speaker: u5668
lines.text: Wonderful.

lines.speaker: u5656
lines.text: So, what are you doing now?

lines.speaker: u5668
lines.text: Whatever I can get away with.

lines.speaker: u5657
lines.text: What am I gonna do?

lines.speaker: u5668
lines.text: What do you want to do?

lines.speaker: u5657
lines.text: I want to be an actor.

lines.speaker: u5668
lines.text: Then express yourself, Bob.

lines.speaker: u5668
lines.text: Oh I see. You got your individual slices of hope, dignity, confidence, self-love, justice, and harmony.

lines.speaker: u5658
lines.text: You open 'em up and there's the sayings, stories, little bites of insight. It's the P.P.P. Six Day Week.

lines.speaker: u5668
lines.text: So you eat-- read it everyday?

lines.speaker: u5658
lines.text: Yes.

lines.speaker: u5668
lines.text: And these pan pizzas have opened up the doors to heaven?

lines.speaker: u5658
lines.text: Correct.  That's for you. Keep it.

lines.speaker: u5661
lines.text: You kill people.

lines.speaker: u5668
lines.text: I have no illusions about the future. What is, is. We make choices. And we become the sum total of our choices. I can live with that.

lines.speaker: u5661
lines.text: Other people can't.

lines.speaker: u5668
lines.text: ...I am at home with the me. I am rooted in me, who is on this adventure.

lines.speaker: u5662
lines.text: Take a deep breath and realize, that this is me breathing.

lines.speaker: u5668
lines.text: This is me breating.

lines.speaker: u5663
lines.text: I am part of a network of minds, a group of five people who are all connected, over hundreds, even thousands of miles, through the mind. We can think with each other, think for each other. I can be driving somewhere, sleeping with a woman-- whatever it is-- and at the same time be thinking a thought in someone else's mind, far away. Running someone else's brain.

lines.speaker: u5668
lines.text: Up on the right.

lines.speaker: u5663
lines.text: And when you think of it, it's not so surprising that a small group of people control the whole world, is it?

lines.speaker: u5668
lines.text: There you go. I left it blank.

lines.speaker: u5664
lines.text: Excellent. Here they come.

lines.speaker: u5665
lines.text: The more things change, the more they Goddamned well stay the same.

lines.speaker: u5668
lines.text: I guess.

lines.speaker: u5666
lines.text: Did you see Blank in there?

lines.speaker: u5670
lines.text: No...

lines.speaker: u5666
lines.text: Good. For a second there I thought we were in trouble.

lines.speaker: u5667
lines.text: I'll call them and tell them you're taking your time. Being a professional.

lines.speaker: u5668
lines.text: Okay, call them. Fine. Oh-- And if you could find out why they double- booked the job, and who is trying to kill me, and call me back-- that's be great.

lines.speaker: u5667
lines.text: Will do.

lines.speaker: u5668
lines.text: Why not?

lines.speaker: u5671
lines.text: So what are you doing with your life now, son?

lines.speaker: u5668
lines.text: I'm a professional killer.

lines.speaker: u5671
lines.text: That's good.

lines.speaker: u5674
lines.text: Maybe we should give him another sedative.

lines.speaker: u5681
lines.text: Problem is, there aren't many volunteers. He's already had enough to sink a battleship. You have a pin, just in case?

lines.speaker: u5674
lines.text: Of course not.

lines.speaker: u5681
lines.text: Probably best. You may want to shoot yourself half way to Ohio.

lines.speaker: u5676
lines.text: I have some brownies left over. Want one?

lines.speaker: u5684
lines.text: No thanks.

lines.speaker: u5677
lines.text: We thought we lost him in the snow storm... Told the kids. Had a funeral for the damn thing. Finally, snow stops. Staring to warm up. I go out and start cleaning the truck... Goddamn if that dog doesn't jump out from the back seat covered in snow... I nearly stained myself.

lines.speaker: u5684
lines.text: He thought it was a ghost.

lines.speaker: u5682
lines.text: Shouldn't we have invited Tom over?

lines.speaker: u5678
lines.text: I did. He said he had work to do until late.

lines.speaker: u5679
lines.text: Don't be such a baby!

lines.speaker: u5685
lines.text: You just showing off for her!

lines.speaker: u5679
lines.text: You shut up, stupid!

lines.speaker: u5685
lines.text: You're the one who's stupid -- letting her go and fall off your horse!!

lines.speaker: u5684
lines.text: Is the poverty worse, now, you think?

lines.speaker: u5682
lines.text: I haven't been back in over twenty years, but I wouldn't be surprised. The population's larger.

lines.speaker: u5684
lines.text: You know, Rona, we weren't all that good together even when we were good together.

lines.speaker: u5683
lines.text: Honey... I was always good.

lines.speaker: u5684
lines.text: Well, that'll happen.

lines.speaker: u5686
lines.text: Where did you learn all this stuff?

lines.speaker: u5684
lines.text: What stuff is that?

lines.speaker: u5686
lines.text: About horses? I'd love to learn more about it myself. Do you offer any private lessons for riders?

lines.speaker: u5684
lines.text: Well... Dale... you know, a lot of this stuff... it just... nuts and bolts.

lines.speaker: u5686
lines.text: What do you mean?

lines.speaker: u5684
lines.text: Well, if the rider's nuts, the horse bolts.  That's the whole lesson right there. You have a good day now... Just... keep on freeing yourself up.

lines.speaker: u5688
lines.text: Secret Service!

lines.speaker: u5687
lines.text: Don't move!

lines.speaker: u5692
lines.text: How's it going, Ray?

lines.speaker: u5688
lines.text: It looks good, sir. We've got an uncorrupted hard drive.

lines.speaker: u5692
lines.text: In English, please. I didn't spend ten years protecting the president so I could finish my career feeling like an idiot.

lines.speaker: u5688
lines.text: I'm sorry, sir. We caught him by surprise, so we don't think he had time to erase his computer files.

lines.speaker: u5692
lines.text: Good. Good man. Alright, let's finish up here, and take him in for interrogation.

lines.speaker: u5688
lines.text: Alright sir.

lines.speaker: u5689
lines.text: That's it! An electronic army! If I were us, I'd get on the internet, send out a major distress signal.

lines.speaker: u5704
lines.text: Hackers of the World, Unite!

lines.speaker: u5689
lines.text: How are you going to take care of the cops?

lines.speaker: u5690
lines.text: Ai! Boom boom aiaiaiaiaee! Alright, that was a little tension breaker, that had to be done, alright?

lines.speaker: u5695
lines.text: Cereal.

lines.speaker: u5690
lines.text: Yeah?

lines.speaker: u5695
lines.text: Go fix the phones.

lines.speaker: u5690
lines.text: Roger.

lines.speaker: u5696
lines.text: So, um, what's your interest in Kate Libby, eh? Academic? Purely sexual?

lines.speaker: u5691
lines.text: Homicidal?

lines.speaker: u5696
lines.text: What's up, man? I'm the Phreak!

lines.speaker: u5692
lines.text: You're welcome.

lines.speaker: u5703
lines.text: What's going on? Let go of me! Stewardess! I'll never fly this airline again!

lines.speaker: u5703
lines.text: Die, dickweeds!

lines.speaker: u5693
lines.text: The rabbit is in the administration system.

lines.speaker: u5702
lines.text: Yo, what's up?

lines.speaker: u5694
lines.text: Dude dude dude, I gotta talk to you a minute, listen listen listen. I copied a garbage file from...

lines.speaker: u5702
lines.text: Big deal. A garbage file's got shit in it, Joey, come on.

lines.speaker: u5694
lines.text: Nono, it's like hot or something. I don't know.

lines.speaker: u5702
lines.text: Joey, a garbage file holds miscellaneous data. Junk. Bits of stuff that's been erased, man.

lines.speaker: u5694
lines.text: I copied it from Ellingson, okay? They're asking me about it, alright? Will you take a look for me?

lines.speaker: u5695
lines.text: Hello?

lines.speaker: u5702
lines.text: Hey, it's me.

lines.speaker: u5695
lines.text: Phreak?

lines.speaker: u5702
lines.text: I'm freaking! Joey wasn't making it up! He really hacked into Ellingson! He gave me the disc with a file he copied and now I'm in jail! They're charging me with some serious shit! And there's stuff I didn't even do, like inserting some virus called Da Vinci, and they keep asking about you guys.

lines.speaker: u5695
lines.text: You think they're going to bust us?

lines.speaker: u5702
lines.text: Yeah! You better figure out what's on that disc, cause we're being framed. It's in that place where I put that thing that time?

lines.speaker: u5703
lines.text: Send a Flu-shot.

lines.speaker: u5697
lines.text: Rabbit, Flu-shot, someone talk to me.

lines.speaker: u5701
lines.text: Hello, operator services.

lines.speaker: u5702
lines.text: Hello, operator? I'm having trouble dialing a number.

lines.speaker: u5701
lines.text: What number please?

lines.speaker: u5701
lines.text: Just one moment.

lines.speaker: u5702
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.speaker: u5705
lines.text: Purpose of visit?

lines.speaker: u5717
lines.text: A patient pickup and transfer to Smith's Grove.

lines.speaker: u5705
lines.text: You're late.

lines.speaker: u5717
lines.text: Yeah.  Should be on the road.

lines.speaker: u5705
lines.text: Yeah, ha, hell of a night huh?

lines.speaker: u5717
lines.text: Real charmer.

lines.speaker: u5705
lines.text: I'll take you down there.

lines.speaker: u5717
lines.text: All right.

lines.speaker: u5719
lines.text: Brady!

lines.speaker: u5706
lines.text: Get up there Rachel!

lines.speaker: u5719
lines.text: Brady! Come with us! Brady!

lines.speaker: u5706
lines.text: Go!

lines.speaker: u5707
lines.text: I've seen bodies thrown 50-60 feet from a crash site.

lines.speaker: u5709
lines.text: Look, even if by some miracle Michael is conscience, his muscles would be totally useless.  Give the troopers a chance to search.

lines.speaker: u5708
lines.text: Honey, I don't think their home.

lines.speaker: u5720
lines.text: How do you know their not?

lines.speaker: u5708
lines.text: Because the lights are all out.

lines.speaker: u5720
lines.text: I told them to be here by nine. Its not 9:30 yet.

lines.speaker: u5708
lines.text: We should call the fire department.

lines.speaker: u5720
lines.text: I'm not calling the fire department.

lines.speaker: u5717
lines.text: Night Doc.

lines.speaker: u5709
lines.text: Drive Carefully.

lines.speaker: u5710
lines.text: Okay everybody, listen up. I've got Rachel Corruthers and her sister in the truck, and I'm taking them outta town route 410. State police are on the way. Got that?

lines.speaker: u5711
lines.text: Got it Earl.

lines.speaker: u5710
lines.text: Okay, out.

lines.speaker: u5712
lines.text: You don't believe that do you?

lines.speaker: u5716
lines.text: No.

lines.speaker: u5713
lines.text: I didn't know you and Brady had anything okay?

lines.speaker: u5719
lines.text: You knew. You just didn't care.

lines.speaker: u5713
lines.text: He's not married. Besides, I've got a right to do what's best for me.

lines.speaker: u5719
lines.text: Don't you mean what you do best?

lines.speaker: u5713
lines.text: Wise up to what men want Rachel, or Brady won't be the last man you lose to another woman.

lines.speaker: u5719
lines.text: Call me.

lines.speaker: u5714
lines.text: Okay, bye.

lines.speaker: u5718
lines.text: I'll be out on gateway and I doubt I'll be back before the troopers get here.

lines.speaker: u5715
lines.text: Maybe you ought to wait here till they do.

lines.speaker: u5718
lines.text: Hey. I got a town full of beer bellies running around in the dark with shotguns. Who's gonna be next? Somebody's wife? Somebody's kid?

lines.speaker: u5716
lines.text: I know that Mr. Sayer.

lines.speaker: u5721
lines.text: Oh your a pilgrim all right. I saw it on your face back there in the dust. I saw it clear as Breasts and blue suede shoes. Would you like a drink?

lines.speaker: u5718
lines.text: Jamie! Get away!

lines.speaker: u5719
lines.text: Don't touch him Jamie!

lines.speaker: u5727
lines.text: Yes.

lines.speaker: u5722
lines.text: Come with me.

lines.speaker: u5729
lines.text: Fantastic. Totally.

lines.speaker: u5723
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.speaker: u5729
lines.text: Want a beer?

lines.speaker: u5723
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.speaker: u5729
lines.text: Is that all you say?

lines.speaker: u5723
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.speaker: u5729
lines.text: Go get me a beer.

lines.speaker: u5723
lines.text: I thought you were gonna get one for me.

lines.speaker: u5729
lines.text: YEAH?

lines.speaker: u5724
lines.text: I gotta go.

lines.speaker: u5732
lines.text: Will you call me tomorrow?

lines.speaker: u5724
lines.text: Yeah, sure.

lines.speaker: u5732
lines.text: Promise?

lines.speaker: u5724
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.speaker: u5725
lines.text: Where were you? I went back to the Myers house...

lines.speaker: u5800
lines.text: All we want is to be treated like human beings, not like guinea pigs to be experimented on and not like bunny rabbits to be patronized.

lines.speaker: u5798
lines.text: Veronica! J.D. told me you committed suicide last night!

lines.speaker: u5800
lines.text: Where is he? Where's J.D.?

lines.speaker: u5798
lines.text: We have to talk.  Whether to kill yourself is one of the most important decisions a teenager has to make.

lines.speaker: u5800
lines.text: Get a job.

lines.speaker: u5800
lines.text: The world wants winners, I guess. Not people stained with loserness.

lines.speaker: u5801
lines.text: Stained with loserness. Oh, I like it. Can I use that. It'd be dynamite on interoffice memoranda.

lines.speaker: u5800
lines.text: It's all yours, Heather. Now if you'll excuse me, I'm going to go throw up.

lines.speaker: u5801
lines.text: Sure. Ciao.

lines.speaker: u5802
lines.text: wanders out. HONORA turns to Pauline and Juliet.

lines.speaker: u5803
lines.text: Well . . . I better make myself a bit more presentable.

lines.speaker: u5804
lines.text: But you're not fat, Mrs. Rieper!

lines.speaker: u5803
lines.text: I put on a lot of weight over Christmas.

lines.speaker: u5804
lines.text: Isn't it beautiful!

lines.speaker: u5805
lines.text: Let's go for a walk down here . . . come on, Mummy!

lines.speaker: u5820
lines.text: Allison I think I did some very, very bad things. I mean very bad.

lines.speaker: u5806
lines.text: Trevor things like this happen to people who experience temporary memory loss. Everybody does things they regret. You just couldn't remember doing these things and now you are so it's a shock to the system. I'm telling you. You will never get better if you keep blaming yourself for your wife's death.

lines.speaker: u5820
lines.text: Maybe I wasn't responsible for the car accident...

lines.speaker: u5820
lines.text: Bret... what the fuck...?

lines.speaker: u5807
lines.text: Tonight was supposed to be the night, Trevor. Remember? I couldn't believe you went through five dart games and didn't even joke about it.

lines.speaker: u5820
lines.text: Bret. What the hell is going on?

lines.speaker: u5807
lines.text: We were gonna be millionaires you said. Nobody'd suspect a thing. I had never even met her. No connection. Then you went and had that fucking car accident.

lines.speaker: u5820
lines.text: Bret you are making no sense whatsoever.

lines.speaker: u5807
lines.text: I followed her Trevor. I got to know her life. And what a boring one it was. Six a.m. gym, nine a.m. trendy coffee shop, noon bookstore, one soap operas, four o'clock news, five wait for Trevor to come home. And wait and wait and wait. Nine o'clock get ready for bed.

lines.speaker: u5808
lines.text: Who's Allison?

lines.speaker: u5820
lines.text: Allison Dormere. Your intern.

lines.speaker: u5809
lines.text: Now I want you to tell me what you remember happening- in your own words- exactly the way you told Detective Lange. But this time I want you to make one small adjustment.

lines.speaker: u5820
lines.text: What's that?

lines.speaker: u5810
lines.text: Good boy.  Where's is it?

lines.speaker: u5820
lines.text: What?

lines.speaker: u5810
lines.text: Our little toy. You usually have it up and running by now.

lines.speaker: u5820
lines.text: Do I really want to know what you're talking about?

lines.speaker: u5811
lines.text: Trevor I've decided we have got to agree on a name before we reach my mother's. This poor kid's going to be starting preschool as student x if we don't make up our minds. So, I've been thinking, what about Daisy?

lines.speaker: u5820
lines.text: It's perfect.

lines.speaker: u5820
lines.text: Morgue...?

lines.speaker: u5812
lines.text: That's right Trevor. The timing was impeccable wasn't it? It's been eight months two weeks and three days but we finally found the body. Just need you to ID it for us.

lines.speaker: u5820
lines.text: Please Larry. Pretend you like me and humor me.

lines.speaker: u5813
lines.text: Seeing you were her sole benefactor, and I'm the executive of the will, Kirsty's entire estate would have to be donated to the city.

lines.speaker: u5820
lines.text: Hello? City? Cops? It's a fucking conspiracy!

lines.speaker: u5813
lines.text: Pardon my glibness Trevor but you sound like a raving lunatic. The next time you seek counsel it should be of the psychiatric type. You're obviously on the verge of some nervous collapse.

lines.speaker: u5820
lines.text: Thanks for your concern Larry. And fuck you too.

lines.speaker: u5820
lines.text: What do you want?!

lines.speaker: u5814
lines.text: Who the hell are you talking to?

lines.speaker: u5820
lines.text: You mean... when the car went off the bridge?

lines.speaker: u5815
lines.text: Wow you are out of it.

lines.speaker: u5820
lines.text: What's under that sheet...?

lines.speaker: u5816
lines.text: You probably don't remember the night we played. Your first year as husband and wife.

lines.speaker: u5820
lines.text: But I saw these women. I saw their mutilated bodies. I saw their ghosts. I just know it happened I can feel it...

lines.speaker: u5817
lines.text: All you've got is the here and the now Trevor. That's all anyone really has. Maybe this will make things easier to understand. A man goes to sleep every night and has recurring dream that he's a butterfly. In time he begins to wonder if he might actually be a butterfly who dreams he's a man. And at the end of the day does it even matter? All these events you're describing. How can you be sure any of them really happened?

lines.speaker: u5820
lines.text: But that's what I need. To be sure... to be absolutely sure...

lines.speaker: u5817
lines.text: Shh. It's okay son. There is but one truth. One thing you can be absolutely sure of. And that thing is this:

lines.speaker: u5820
lines.text: Wait... what the hell is this...

lines.speaker: u5818
lines.text: Surrender yourself... surrender yourself...

lines.speaker: u5819
lines.text: Whoa, I have serious space issues, dude. What do you want?

lines.speaker: u5820
lines.text: I... think we need to talk, there's something really strange going on...

lines.speaker: u5819
lines.text: Hey you're the guy from down the hall.

lines.speaker: u5820
lines.text: Come on, quit fucking around. Listen it's about... what we did together last night.

lines.speaker: u5819
lines.text: WHAT?!

lines.speaker: u5821
lines.text: You remember where I said how I was gonna explain about life, buddy?  Well, the thing about life is...  it gets weird.  See people are always gonna be talking to you about "truth." Everybody always knows what the truth is, like it was toilet paper or something and they got a supply in the closet. But what you learn as you get older is, there ain't no truth. All there is is bullshit .  Layers of it. One layer of bullshit on top of another.  So what you do in life, like when you get older, is you pick the layer of bullshit you prefer and that's <u>your</u> bullshit, so to speak.  You got that?

lines.speaker: u5831
lines.text: Uh, no.

lines.speaker: u5821
lines.text: Mmmmm.  Well, it's complicated. Maybe when you're older.  Anyhow, what I'm gonna tell you here is in strict confidence, okay?  It don't go no further.  What happened is, you remember that night I was gonna take you to the movies an' it was raining like a sonofabitch, ..?

lines.speaker: u5822
lines.text: "A little mistake"!

lines.speaker: u5829
lines.text: No, John, you're too hard on yourself.  I've got the creep here, the guy who's...

lines.speaker: u5824
lines.text: He's gotta be a nut!  He saves all those people and swipes a <u>purse</u>?

lines.speaker: u5829
lines.text: Because he was a <u>real</u> hero, Chucky. He was acting out of a deep instinctive decency, not out of some ego thing.  He didn't expect the media to lionize him.  He didn't expect a million dollar reward. He saved fifty-four people because something inside him, some fundamental love for his fellow man, made him rush into that plane when "good sense" told him otherwise. He was willing to settle for some credit cards he sold to LaPlante....  For how much, LaPlante?  A couple of bucks?  Did you give him enough for a decent meal?

lines.speaker: u5834
lines.text: It's not unthinkable.

lines.speaker: u5825
lines.text: What?

lines.speaker: u5834
lines.text: The Presidency.  The public loves him.

lines.speaker: u5825
lines.text: For ten more minutes they love him, Wally.  I'm sick of him and I'm always about ten minutes ahead of the public.

lines.speaker: u5828
lines.text: Oh my God!  Bernie!

lines.speaker: u5831
lines.text: Dad!

lines.speaker: u5832
lines.text: Excuse me, Ms. Gayley.  That guy Inspector Dayton... he's recovered a bunch of your credit cards and he wants...

lines.speaker: u5829
lines.text: Who?

lines.speaker: u5832
lines.text: Inspector Dayton, the cop from Robbery Detail who was looking for you.  They caught the guy who stole your credit cards trying to sell them and he wants...

lines.speaker: u5829
lines.text: Nobody stole my credit cards.  They burned up in the crash.  Which reminds me, did you get me cash? And what about the reservations?

lines.speaker: u5836
lines.text: Look at that.  You can't buy better protection than that.  That there is your Man's Best Friend.

lines.speaker: u5838
lines.text: How are they with kids?

lines.speaker: u5836
lines.text: They're great with kids.  They love 'em.  They eat 'em up.  I'm kidding.

lines.speaker: u5838
lines.text: So this really does the trick, eh?

lines.speaker: u5836
lines.text: Friend, that animal will go after whoever's approaching the sound of that whistle.  And God help whoever it is.  Because that dog will not let up until there's dead meat on the ground.  Put your faith in that, pal.

lines.speaker: u5837
lines.text: So where are all your toys?

lines.speaker: u5841
lines.text: Let's watch some TV.

lines.speaker: u5837
lines.text: Where are these toys of yours?

lines.speaker: u5841
lines.text: A lot of my stuff hasn't been unpacked yet.  Here's the TV.

lines.speaker: u5837
lines.text: What toys do you have?

lines.speaker: u5840
lines.text: About what?

lines.speaker: u5838
lines.text: About us.

lines.speaker: u5840
lines.text: Mr. Sykes, I think you should go home.

lines.speaker: u5839
lines.text: Mommy!

lines.speaker: u5840
lines.text: It's okay, baby, the police are coming.

lines.speaker: u5844
lines.text: You'll see that there's really much more space than the average three bedroom.

lines.speaker: u5840
lines.text: Oh, space!  -- You said the right thing.

lines.speaker: u5844
lines.text: How large is your brood?

lines.speaker: u5840
lines.text: Two -- three if you count the husband.

lines.speaker: u5844
lines.text: We must <u>always</u> count the husband. By my count there've been... four. But I still live in hope.

lines.speaker: u5841
lines.text: I thought I was supposed to stay in my room.

lines.speaker: u5843
lines.text: Get on the other side of that.

lines.speaker: u5847
lines.text: Really?

lines.speaker: u5843
lines.text: Really.

lines.speaker: u5859
lines.text: Yes -- I think it is.

lines.speaker: u5849
lines.text: Hey -- somebody want to gimme a hand here?

lines.speaker: u5859
lines.text: You can go first.

lines.speaker: u5851
lines.text: No -- after you.

lines.speaker: u5853
lines.text: This cannot be.

lines.speaker: u5859
lines.text: It is.  Do not ask me how.  I do not know.  I must leave, for if I stayed others would surely hear of this and worse than they will come.

lines.speaker: u5853
lines.text: Agreed.

lines.speaker: u5859
lines.text: I would like to say goodbye.

lines.speaker: u5853
lines.text: How?

lines.speaker: u5868
lines.text: We had a bargain.  You promised.

lines.speaker: u5854
lines.text: I lied.

lines.speaker: u5855
lines.text: Why?

lines.speaker: u5859
lines.text: I cannot explain.

lines.speaker: u5855
lines.text: Do you love me, Conner?

lines.speaker: u5859
lines.text: Aye.

lines.speaker: u5855
lines.text: Then take me with you.

lines.speaker: u5859
lines.text: Where I'm going you cannot follow.

lines.speaker: u5855
lines.text: Why are you doing this?

lines.speaker: u5859
lines.text: Because, it's for the best.  There are somethings that are better left unexplained.

lines.speaker: u5862
lines.text: Do you?  Then why don't you go out? Meet someone.  Make a life for yourself instead of hiding away in the past?

lines.speaker: u5856
lines.text: I like my work.

lines.speaker: u5862
lines.text: I'm having some people over tonight for dinner -- I'd like you come.

lines.speaker: u5856
lines.text: We'll see.

lines.speaker: u5857
lines.text: Fine -- I've waited over three centuries.  I can wait a little longer.

lines.speaker: u5859
lines.text: Why did you wait?

lines.speaker: u5857
lines.text: It was not by choice.  A small matter of a mountain falling down on us.  We were trapped inside.  When the time of the Gathering came the urge to go was so strong we tried to claw through rock with our bare hands.  What you thought was the end -- was not.  This is the end.  We are the last of our kind, Macleod.

lines.speaker: u5859
lines.text: It will not end tonight.

lines.speaker: u5857
lines.text: You cannot hide from me.  You will not stand between me and my destiny. After I have your head the power will let me hold any form as long as I want.  Do you know what that means? I can become the President -- I can become anyone I want.  The world will be mine.

lines.speaker: u5863
lines.text: I'm glad you've come home, Conner.

lines.speaker: u5858
lines.text: Me too.

lines.speaker: u5859
lines.text: Dear, sweet, Rachel.  Men's lifes are measured by the good they do.

lines.speaker: u5863
lines.text: If you search your heart you know all the good you have done.  Your strength comes from your heart -- because in your heart you know what you are fighting for is good and just.  This room is filled with memories. If you search through them you can find the good -- the difference you have made.  And now, it is for you to make the greatest difference of all. Look in your heart, Conner -- and you will see the good that you have done.

lines.speaker: u5867
lines.text: Good afternoon, Mr. Parker.

lines.speaker: u5860
lines.text: Good afternoon...  ... Shirley.

lines.speaker: u5867
lines.text: Would you like to deposit this in your account?

lines.speaker: u5860
lines.text: No.  The money, please.

lines.speaker: u5867
lines.text: This check is for sixteen thousand dollars.  That's a lot of cash to be carrying around.

lines.speaker: u5860
lines.text: I can take care of myself.

lines.speaker: u5867
lines.text: Alright.  It's going to take a few minutes.  I have to call and verify the funds.

lines.speaker: u5869
lines.text: Wow.  Sure, right away, Chief.

lines.speaker: u5891
lines.text: Don't tell anyone what you're doing, not Louise, not the other guys, not the Sheriffs.  You understand me, Larry?

lines.speaker: u5869
lines.text: I guess so.

lines.speaker: u5891
lines.text: Fuck guessing.  You keep your mouth shut.

lines.speaker: u5869
lines.text: I will, Chief.  Absolutely.

lines.speaker: u5891
lines.text: Get to work.

lines.speaker: u5891
lines.text: You get anything on Smith?

lines.speaker: u5870
lines.text: Chief...it's like none of this exists. I'm sorry.

lines.speaker: u5891
lines.text: Keep trying.

lines.speaker: u5873
lines.text: And by doing so, he would've known we have spies in his organization.

lines.speaker: u5871
lines.text: Yes, sir.  But what about the disks?  If the cops end up with the disks, we're gonna see a whole lot of heat.

lines.speaker: u5873
lines.text: I hate that Mickey Mouse bastard.  I hated his father, and I hate Sonny, too. Always with the tan.

lines.speaker: u5871
lines.text: What do you want to do?

lines.speaker: u5873
lines.text: Our people out there, they good people? People in the right place?

lines.speaker: u5871
lines.text: The best.

lines.speaker: u5873
lines.text: Sonny's a fuckup.  If he pulls this off, fine--life goes on.  But if the cops end up with those disks, we cut our losses.

lines.speaker: u5871
lines.text: I understand.

lines.speaker: u5873
lines.text: I want a message sent:  No fuckups allowed.

lines.speaker: u5871
lines.text: I'll make the call.

lines.speaker: u5872
lines.text: What, he's cute?  That's his idea of humor?

lines.speaker: u5876
lines.text: If the Feds get those disks, the East Coast is gonna take a hit, too.  You should let them know.

lines.speaker: u5872
lines.text: No way.  I tell them, that Old Man is gonna handle this from back there.

lines.speaker: u5874
lines.text: You mean he <u>left</u>, as in went out the front door?

lines.speaker: u5886
lines.text: I overheard him with the girl.

lines.speaker: u5874
lines.text: <u>Shit</u>!  That <u>fuck</u>!  Even when I want to turn myself in he screws it up!  Did he take the kids with him?

lines.speaker: u5886
lines.text: I don't know.

lines.speaker: u5874
lines.text: Jesus, get upstairs and find out!  If he took those kids, we're fucked!

lines.speaker: u5891
lines.text: Is Krupchek an aggressive guy?  Hot- tempered?  Anything like that?

lines.speaker: u5875
lines.text: Keeps to himself, more like.

lines.speaker: u5891
lines.text: You have his address?

lines.speaker: u5875
lines.text: Pretty sure I do.  Yeah, here we go --

lines.speaker: u5891
lines.text: I gave the other one to the Sheriffs and they're giving it to the <u>real</u> FBI.  This one's a fake.

lines.speaker: u5877
lines.text: You'd better be kidding.

lines.speaker: u5891
lines.text: I'm scared shitless.

lines.speaker: u5878
lines.text: That's okay.  I love you anyway.

lines.speaker: u5879
lines.text: What happened?

lines.speaker: u5881
lines.text: Do you want to go or not?  I'm offering you a way out of here.

lines.speaker: u5879
lines.text: I can't go without Thomas.

lines.speaker: u5881
lines.text: All three of us will go, but we have to move fast.  Mars and Dennis don't know I'm doing this.

lines.speaker: u5879
lines.text: How can we get out?

lines.speaker: u5881
lines.text: Dennis and Mars are in the den.  I'll get your brother, then come back for you. We'll go down the stairs and out the front door, you understand?

lines.speaker: u5879
lines.text: Yes.

lines.speaker: u5880
lines.text: What's going on?

lines.speaker: u5891
lines.text: Get in the car.  <u>Now</u>.

lines.speaker: u5882
lines.text: That's enough.

lines.speaker: u5891
lines.text: Another minute.  Please --

lines.speaker: u5891
lines.text: Is something wrong with Jane?

lines.speaker: u5883
lines.text: We have a boy on the line.  He says he's Thomas Smith and he's calling from the house.

lines.speaker: u5891
lines.text: It's a crank, Louise.  C'mon, don't waste my time with that!

lines.speaker: u5883
lines.text: His cell number belongs to the Smiths.  I think it's real, Chief.  I think this boy is inside that house.

lines.speaker: u5891
lines.text: Did you find Jane and Mandy?

lines.speaker: u5884
lines.text: Could you call me back on your phone? Right away.

lines.speaker: u5891
lines.text: What's wrong with the radio?

lines.speaker: u5884
lines.text: Other people can hear us.  Just call. <u>Please</u>.

lines.speaker: u5891
lines.text: Stand by.

lines.speaker: u5891
lines.text: Let it go, Captain.

lines.speaker: u5887
lines.text: Goddamned small town bullshit.

lines.speaker: u5891
lines.text: Mickey?  Call the state Homicide Bureau. Don't touch anything, just sit back and wait.

lines.speaker: u5888
lines.text: Yes, sir.

lines.speaker: u5891
lines.text: The kids are in here!

lines.speaker: u5889
lines.text: Where's the office?

lines.speaker: u5891
lines.text: Help me, goddamnit, we can get the disks later!

lines.speaker: u5893
lines.text: I guess we each have something the other wants.

lines.speaker: u5891
lines.text: I guess we do.

lines.speaker: u5893
lines.text: My people are good to go.  You know who I mean?

lines.speaker: u5891
lines.text: Your phony FBI assholes.

lines.speaker: u5893
lines.text: We're almost home, you and me.  Keep your shit together.  This isn't L.A.

lines.speaker: u5891
lines.text: What do you mean by that?

lines.speaker: u5893
lines.text: You don't want another dead child on your conscience.

lines.speaker: u5897
lines.text: Paul, we would like to speak to you in your office.

lines.speaker: u5909
lines.text: We, who is we?

lines.speaker: u5897
lines.text: A delegation.

lines.speaker: u5898
lines.text: Paul...  ...I have to talk to you.

lines.speaker: u5909
lines.text: I'll be back.

lines.speaker: u5909
lines.text: Don't be foolish. There's more money to be made here.

lines.speaker: u5899
lines.text: You want to buy anymore cockroaches ask for Captain Naramunju.

lines.speaker: u5900
lines.text: Paul, I need you to buy me a day or two. I don't have the fuel for this convoy. I will have to scrounge it.

lines.speaker: u5909
lines.text: I can't. I have nothing left to bribe with. Can your men at the gate hold out for another day?

lines.speaker: u5900
lines.text: No, Paul, they're afraid. They've demanded to be moved back to headquarters now.

lines.speaker: u5909
lines.text: Give me their uniforms. I will put people at the gate, in disguise.

lines.speaker: u5900
lines.text: I wish I could, Paul. Try to hold out.

lines.speaker: u5901
lines.text: You lie.

lines.speaker: u5909
lines.text: If you do not help me, you will stay on that list.

lines.speaker: u5901
lines.text: I committed no war crimes.

lines.speaker: u5909
lines.text: Who will tell them? You need me to tell how you helped the hotel. The others who have gone, they blame you for all their misfortune. They say you led the massacres.

lines.speaker: u5901
lines.text: I led no massacres.

lines.speaker: u5909
lines.text: You think they will believe you?

lines.speaker: u5901
lines.text: You will tell them the truth.

lines.speaker: u5909
lines.text: I will do nothing unless you help me now.

lines.speaker: u5909
lines.text: Let's go.

lines.speaker: u5902
lines.text: Take the river road back. It is clear.

lines.speaker: u5903
lines.text: The news room has heard that the French and the Belgians are putting together an intervention force.

lines.speaker: u5909
lines.text: When will they be here?

lines.speaker: u5903
lines.text: Very soon.

lines.speaker: u5909
lines.text: Thank God.

lines.speaker: u5909
lines.text: Are you sure this is the river road?

lines.speaker: u5904
lines.text: I saw the sign.

lines.speaker: u5909
lines.text: This is a Rolex, I can't take it.

lines.speaker: u5905
lines.text: Take it for Christ sake. I wish it was a fucking aeroplane.

lines.speaker: u5906
lines.text: Who did you call?

lines.speaker: u5909
lines.text: Call, sir?

lines.speaker: u5906
lines.text: Don't lie to me. What's your name?

lines.speaker: u5909
lines.text: Rusesabagina. Paul Rusesabagina.

lines.speaker: u5906
lines.text: I will remember that name.  Let's go.

lines.speaker: u5907
lines.text: Show us the manager. He wears a suit.

lines.speaker: u5909
lines.text: They have him in the lobby, go quickly.

lines.speaker: u5908
lines.text: It is dangerous to be here. The radio says this is a nest of cockroaches.

lines.speaker: u5909
lines.text: I need one last favor. Go back and get the twins.

lines.speaker: u5908
lines.text: No, it is impossible. That side of town has been destroyed in the fighting. The children are dead.

lines.speaker: u5909
lines.text: How do you know?

lines.speaker: u5908
lines.text: Everyone is dead there. The dogs eat the bodies in the street. I have to go.

lines.speaker: u5909
lines.text: I will give you my house.

lines.speaker: u5911
lines.text: Moses, Moses Seradungu.

lines.speaker: u5909
lines.text: Can I help you?

lines.speaker: u5911
lines.text: I'm looking for Moses Seradungu's room.

lines.speaker: u5909
lines.text: What is his room number?

lines.speaker: u5911
lines.text: I don't know.

lines.speaker: u5909
lines.text: Go downstairs, I will help you.

lines.speaker: u5918
lines.text: Shouldn't somebody like, stand guard or something -- just in case?

lines.speaker: u5917
lines.text: I'll stay, if it'll ease your mind.

lines.speaker: u5918
lines.text: You sure? You'll be alright by yourself?

lines.speaker: u5918
lines.text: Then what the hell are we doing here?

lines.speaker: u5922
lines.text: How'd you make your guest list, Price: throw darts at a phone book?

lines.speaker: u5923
lines.text: Evelyn... Get up... NOW!

lines.speaker: u5919
lines.text: Steven??

lines.speaker: u5925
lines.text: ...wow....WOW! Hey, Ms. Jenzen -- ?

lines.speaker: u5920
lines.text: Are you still fucking here??

lines.speaker: u5921
lines.text: Please! Something! Oh-God!

lines.speaker: u5923
lines.text: Maybe if I --

lines.speaker: u5923
lines.text: -- hey! Next time give me a couple seconds notice before you wing a gag like that!

lines.speaker: u5926
lines.text: The lockdown thing.

lines.speaker: u5923
lines.text: I mean, not that it didn't give Evelyn the kind of coronary I had in mind, just...

lines.speaker: u5926
lines.text: -- it wasn't me.

lines.speaker: u5923
lines.text: Rewind that.

lines.speaker: u5926
lines.text: I was just sitting here -- it happened. I had nothing to do with it.

lines.speaker: u5923
lines.text: Then who did??

lines.speaker: u5926
lines.text: No idea. I didn't even know the damn thing still worked!

lines.speaker: u5923
lines.text: It works.

lines.speaker: u5926
lines.text: Maybe it was just its time to finally fall apart.

lines.speaker: u5923
lines.text: No. Somehow -- I don't know how -- she did it.

lines.speaker: u5926
lines.text: Pretty amazing feat: all that shit down the basement and your wife's up in the bedroom the whole time.

lines.speaker: u5923
lines.text: Don't take your eyes off her for a second. I think she just declared War.

lines.speaker: u5924
lines.text: -- ten.

lines.speaker: u5927
lines.text: Please.....anyone....help me?

lines.speaker: u5925
lines.text: Melissa...?

lines.speaker: u5927
lines.text: For the love of God....please...?

lines.speaker: u5925
lines.text: Melissa, it's Sara -- is that you?

lines.speaker: u5927
lines.text: Sara...?

lines.speaker: u5925
lines.text: Keep talking, I'll find you!

lines.speaker: u5927
lines.text: Something....happened --

lines.speaker: u5925
lines.text: -- I'm coming --

lines.speaker: u5927
lines.text: -- something horrible...I don't understand --

lines.speaker: u5928
lines.text: What do these ingredients mean?

lines.speaker: u5931
lines.text: Pearl, is the twilight, the divinity... Onyx is the sickle, death...

lines.speaker: u5929
lines.text: Mommy!

lines.speaker: u5933
lines.text: Aubrey run! Aubrey stares in horror at Maura - just then the knife FADES AWAY as Maura rolls over, returned to normal -

lines.speaker: u5931
lines.text: She's coming back.  Keep talking!

lines.speaker: u5930
lines.text: Come back to us honey!

lines.speaker: u5931
lines.text: Well, you know where to reach me. The church is a stone's throw away if you want to come to mass.

lines.speaker: u5933
lines.text: We'll be there.

lines.speaker: u5932
lines.text: There's something in there.

lines.speaker: u5933
lines.text: What?

lines.speaker: u5932
lines.text: There's something through that wall!

lines.speaker: u5933
lines.text: Well what is it!

lines.speaker: u5932
lines.text: I don't know!  Trust what I'm saying, we have to open this wall!

lines.speaker: u5934
lines.text: Not on station time.

lines.speaker: u5937
lines.text: No.  Not on station time.  My story.  My time.

lines.speaker: u5937
lines.text: Hello?

lines.speaker: u5935
lines.text: You wanted a story.  You got it.  Turn on the TV now.  And then get your ass down here ...  ...

lines.speaker: u5937
lines.text: Doc?  ...  Doc ... Hello?

lines.speaker: u5936
lines.text: The Box, Joey.  He wants the Box.

lines.speaker: u5939
lines.text: Never mind.  I'm glad it's gone.  Made the store feel strange.  Who'd make such a thing?

lines.speaker: u5937
lines.text: Fine.  Fine.  But can you tell us anything about it?

lines.speaker: u5939
lines.text: It was part of a job-lot.  Some loony- bin they shut down.  Unclaimed stuff.

lines.speaker: u5937
lines.text: What else came with it?  Anything still here?

lines.speaker: u5939
lines.text: Sure.  Just papers, photos.  Stuff nobody'd ever want.

lines.speaker: u5937
lines.text: Can we see?

lines.speaker: u5939
lines.text: You gonna buy?

lines.speaker: u5937
lines.text: I don't know.  Maybe.

lines.speaker: u5939
lines.text: Right at the back there.  Middle shelves.  Coupla folders.  Nice stuff. I'd do you a good price.

lines.speaker: u5942
lines.text: Really?

lines.speaker: u5938
lines.text: Yes!  God, yes.  I ... I just want to hug you.  To hold you.  To tell you it's alright.

lines.speaker: u5943
lines.text: Get 'em.  They went down the hallway.

lines.speaker: u5951
lines.text: Let's just forget it, I mean...

lines.speaker: u5943
lines.text: Get em....

lines.speaker: u5944
lines.text: How.

lines.speaker: u5951
lines.text: You're unemployed, Alfie.  Boss is dead.  Her plan is over.

lines.speaker: u5944
lines.text: My plan is just beginning.  I'll forgive you for denying me the pleasure of slaughtering my boorish employers, but I'm afraid the birth of the new British Empire can have no witnesses!

lines.speaker: u5951
lines.text: Ooh-kay...

lines.speaker: u5945
lines.text: What the hell....

lines.speaker: u5954
lines.text: You're supposed to be dead!

lines.speaker: u5946
lines.text: Cat got his tongue?

lines.speaker: u5952
lines.text: Actually he never told us what it was.

lines.speaker: u5948
lines.text: Good job, not pretty, but good.

lines.speaker: u5951
lines.text: Ah, the mafia, the cops; do I know how to party or what?

lines.speaker: u5949
lines.text: What a pleasant surprise.  You're probably wondering...

lines.speaker: u5951
lines.text: But you're going to tell us anyway...

lines.speaker: u5950
lines.text: All this trouble for a horsey. I may not know art, but I know what I like.

lines.speaker: u5951
lines.text: You certainly do.

lines.speaker: u5950
lines.text: So when's that Sebastian-Cabot- Buckingham-Palace-looking- Butlerhead getting here?

lines.speaker: u5951
lines.text: Why does this have to be so hard...

lines.speaker: u5952
lines.text: Tell me about it...

lines.speaker: u5955
lines.text: The Hoopsucker!

lines.speaker: u5956
lines.text: The Hudswinger!

lines.speaker: u5955
lines.text: The Hoop-dee-doo!

lines.speaker: u5956
lines.text: The Hudsucker Hoop!

lines.speaker: u5957
lines.text: Nobody told me! Nobody told me! You sold all of our stock?

lines.speaker: u5970
lines.text: We dumped the whole load. Now quit showboating, Addison --

lines.speaker: u5957
lines.text: I had twenty thousand shares! I'd be a millionaire now!

lines.speaker: u5970
lines.text: Sure, sure, we'd all be millionaires. There's no point in looking back. At the time, Stilson thought dumping our position would panic the market, further depress the stock -- then we'd buy it all back, and more of course, once it got cheap --

lines.speaker: u5957
lines.text: Cheap! Cheap! It's never been more valuable! And I'm ruined! Ruined!

lines.speaker: u5963
lines.text: Whatever! It's no dig on you, Archer, but this story is hot and you're no longer on top of it. Why, it's the scoop of the century -- the other papers won't have the Gunderson dope 'til tomorrow -- The Allemeinischer Zeitung, Le Figaro, they'll be choking on our dust come mornin' --

lines.speaker: u5958
lines.text: You're fools, both of you! It's obvious they're out to crucify Norville! They're trying to destroy him!

lines.speaker: u5963
lines.text: Amy -- take a break. You've worked hard on this story -- heck, you broke it for us! But it's passed you by and Smith here has taken up the slack.

lines.speaker: u5971
lines.text: How long've you been down here?

lines.speaker: u5959
lines.text: Forty-eight years...

lines.speaker: u5960
lines.text: Yeah, daddy, that's a roger, but we don't sell alcohol.

lines.speaker: u5971
lines.text: What kind of bar is it if ya can't get a martini?!

lines.speaker: u5960
lines.text: It's a juice and coffee bar, man, like I been tellin' ya --

lines.speaker: u5971
lines.text: I want a martini! On this bar, right now! I've had a martini in every bar on the way down here, and I'm not about to --

lines.speaker: u5960
lines.text: Martinis are for squares, man.

lines.speaker: u5961
lines.text: ...It's the most beautiful t'ing I ever saw.

lines.speaker: u5967
lines.text: It's the most beautiful t'ing I ever saw.

lines.speaker: u5971
lines.text: ...You don't?

lines.speaker: u5962
lines.text: Nah, that's all forgotten.

lines.speaker: u5971
lines.text: ...It is?

lines.speaker: u5962
lines.text: Sure, Mr. Muss -- uh, Sid said I could have the job back.

lines.speaker: u5971
lines.text: Absolutely, Buzz, I'm glad he --

lines.speaker: u5962
lines.text: But he told me you stole that swell hoop idea from me. What gives!

lines.speaker: u5971
lines.text: But, Buzz --

lines.speaker: u5962
lines.text: Say, that was a swell idea!

lines.speaker: u5971
lines.text: But, Buzz, you know I never --

lines.speaker: u5962
lines.text: And Sid says you stole it!

lines.speaker: u5971
lines.text: But Buzz --

lines.speaker: u5965
lines.text: ...Yeah, go ahead.

lines.speaker: u5971
lines.text: '...But Sid, let me urge you to work closely with the new president, and to keep giving Hudsucker Industries all your energies -- but not your soul. For while we must strive for success, we must not worship it. Long live the Hud. Waring Hudsucker...'

lines.speaker: u5971
lines.text: ...Well, I'm not sure where I --

lines.speaker: u5966
lines.text: I need that voucher! I told you a week ago it was important!

lines.speaker: u5971
lines.text: But look, I'm president of the company now and I --

lines.speaker: u5966
lines.text: I don't care if you're president of the company! I need that voucher! Now!

lines.speaker: u5969
lines.text: Well, frankly, I...

lines.speaker: u5971
lines.text: You have a charming wife, Mr. Muss -- uh, Sid.

lines.speaker: u5971
lines.text: Sorry I'm late, Sid. That back nine at Riverdale is really murder.

lines.speaker: u5970
lines.text: Sure, sure, it's a tough course. Well thanks for coming, kid. I thought the board room would be a swell place to chat undisturbed -- it seems we're having some security problems here at the Hud.

lines.speaker: u5971
lines.text: Ya don't say.

lines.speaker: u5970
lines.text: Mm. Ordinarily I wouldn't bother you with it, but -- this is embarrassing, kid -- it seems to concern you directly.

lines.speaker: u5971
lines.text: How's that, Sid?

lines.speaker: u5970
lines.text: It's not important in itself -- some elevator boy you fired came to me claiming you'd stolen the idea for the, uh, the hoop dingus from him --

lines.speaker: u5971
lines.text: Huh?! He -- no, I -- he's just -- maybe I was a little rough on the boy, ya see I --

lines.speaker: u5970
lines.text: Ah forget it, kid, ya don't have to explain to me. He's a little person. He's nothing. Like I say, ordinarily it would just be a nuisance. But it seems -- well, there was a spy in the company...

lines.speaker: u5973
lines.text: She's good, Bennie.

lines.speaker: u5974
lines.text: She's damn good, Lou.

lines.speaker: u5975
lines.text: Things so bad, nobody can help -- not even Doctor Maxwell.

lines.speaker: u5976
lines.text: Doctors and nurses can only do so much, Alma.  They can't cure everything.

lines.speaker: u5975
lines.text: Doctors that are people can't cure everything.

lines.speaker: u5976
lines.text: What do you mean -- "doctors that are people"?

lines.speaker: u5975
lines.text: There are other doctors...Yes, other doctors...Better doctors...

lines.speaker: u5976
lines.text: Where?

lines.speaker: u5975
lines.text: At the Houmfort.

lines.speaker: u5976
lines.text: That's nonsense, Alma.

lines.speaker: u5975
lines.text: They even cure nonsense, Miss Betsy.  Mama Rose was mindless.  I was at the Houmfort when the Houngan brought her mind back.

lines.speaker: u5976
lines.text: You mean Mama Rose was like Mrs. Holland?

lines.speaker: u5975
lines.text: No.  She was mindless but not like Miss Jessica.  But the Houngan cured her.

lines.speaker: u5976
lines.text: Are you trying to tell me that the Houngan -- the voodoo priest -- could cure Mrs. Holland?

lines.speaker: u5975
lines.text: Yes, Miss Betsy.  I mean that.  The Houngan will speak to the rada drums and the drums will speak to Shango and Damballa.

lines.speaker: u5979
lines.text: Considering that the paper is three months old and this isn't Sunday -- no thank you.

lines.speaker: u5976
lines.text: I guess I'll wait until I'm home, Mrs. Rand.

lines.speaker: u5979
lines.text: Dr. Maxwell is right, Mother.

lines.speaker: u5978
lines.text: Emotion tricks all of us, Mrs. Rand.  And you are a woman with a very strong conscience.  That conscience has been tormenting you. The rest is coincidence.  There is no such thing as a Zombie.  The dead do not come back to life. Death is final.

lines.speaker: u5980
lines.text: That could be a serious accusation, Rand, if it weren't a foolish one.

lines.speaker: u5982
lines.text: Foolish?  Tell them how foolish it is, Paul -- tell them!

lines.speaker: u5982
lines.text: That isn't true.  You never understood her.

lines.speaker: u5981
lines.text: That night, I went to the Houmfort. I kept seeing Jessica's face -- smiling -- smiling because two men hated each other -- because she was beautiful enough to take my family in her hands and break it apart. The drums seemed to be beating in my head.  The chanting -- the lights --  everything blurred together.  And then I heard a voice, speaking in a sudden silence.  My voice.  I was possessed.  I said that the woman at Fort Holland was evil and that the Houngan must maker her a Zombie.

lines.speaker: u5984
lines.text: Good shit.

lines.speaker: u5989
lines.text: Sure is good shit. It's opiated. I had it in my chamber for a while. I was smoking this other --

lines.speaker: u5984
lines.text: It's what?

lines.speaker: u5989
lines.text: Don't fret, Benjie, it's --

lines.speaker: u5984
lines.text: Darn it, Dave.

lines.speaker: u5985
lines.text: Hello you two. Am I barging in on some kind of religious study group? Elena, you look marvelous. Will I see you and Ben at the Halford's?

lines.speaker: u5986
lines.text: I suppose we'll make an appearance.

lines.speaker: u5985
lines.text: And Reverend Edwards? Did you make the list?

lines.speaker: u5986
lines.text: You're here... I'm a bit surprised.

lines.speaker: u5997
lines.text: Sometimes the shepherd needs the company of the sheep.

lines.speaker: u5986
lines.text: I'm going to try hard not to understand the implications of that simile.

lines.speaker: u5987
lines.text: Come on Paulie, share the wealth. You copped 'em from her mom's stash anyway.

lines.speaker: u5993
lines.text: Let's see!

lines.speaker: u5991
lines.text: Hey.  I'll take this stuff.

lines.speaker: u5998
lines.text: You going to tell dad?

lines.speaker: u5991
lines.text: Would it matter?  And what's that?

lines.speaker: u5998
lines.text: You know, it's the whip -- the one uncle Frank got me from Mexico.

lines.speaker: u5991
lines.text: It's not packed with explosives, is it?

lines.speaker: u5998
lines.text: No!

lines.speaker: u5991
lines.text: Play with the whip.

lines.speaker: u5993
lines.text: I do.

lines.speaker: u5996
lines.text: Right. Cool. So, how about we take a bath together?

lines.speaker: u5993
lines.text: Hah hah you're funny. A bath. Like a brother and sister. Oh man, I'm so wasted.

lines.speaker: u5996
lines.text: I'm in love with Libbets Casey.

lines.speaker: u5994
lines.text: Yeah, well, you've been in love with like every other girl here, I was wondering when you'd get around to Libbets.

lines.speaker: u5996
lines.text: It's beyond mere physical attraction.

lines.speaker: u5994
lines.text: That's good, because I don't think Libbets is capable of the sex act.

lines.speaker: u5996
lines.text: Truly? Do speak.

lines.speaker: u5994
lines.text: My diagnosis is messed in the head. A poor little rich girl -- I mean check out the jeans and fur look. And lend your ears to this brutality. Like her mom and step dad and her step-sisters are going to Switzerland to ski over Thanksgiving break -- and like they didn't invite her!

lines.speaker: u5996
lines.text: How do you know this shit?

lines.speaker: u5994
lines.text: They did it last year too. It's like traditional or something. They've got this humongoid Park Ave apartment and she just holes up there with a wad of cash.  Aren't the hugely wealthy sad?

lines.speaker: u5996
lines.text: You think Francis is going to beat me to the punch here?

lines.speaker: u5994
lines.text: Since he sleeps with every girl you ever show an interest in, why don't you just keep your Libbets thing a secret from him?

lines.speaker: u5996
lines.text: Good thinking Marge.

lines.speaker: u5995
lines.text: You're parents at that party?

lines.speaker: u5999
lines.text: Yeah. Yours?

lines.speaker: u5995
lines.text: You get in trouble?

lines.speaker: u5999
lines.text: Maybe. Can't really tell yet.

lines.speaker: u5995
lines.text: I'm sorry if I got you into trouble. Maybe we don't have to, you know... unless you really want to.

lines.speaker: u5999
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.speaker: u5999
lines.text: Hood residence.

lines.speaker: u5996
lines.text: Charles, what time is it?

lines.speaker: u5999
lines.text: Is this Charles?

lines.speaker: u5996
lines.text: What time is it?

lines.speaker: u5999
lines.text: Um, ten-o-five. Why? Where are you?

lines.speaker: u5996
lines.text: I'm, uh, in the midst of a moral dilemma. And I was wondering, because I know you're a very moral person, and --

lines.speaker: u5999
lines.text: And?

lines.speaker: u5996
lines.text: Shit. I can't really talk about it. I guess I better get to the train.

lines.speaker: u5999
lines.text: Right.

lines.speaker: u5996
lines.text: What are you doing at home on a Friday night?

lines.speaker: u5999
lines.text: I have plans.

lines.speaker: u5998
lines.text: I love you.

lines.speaker: u5999
lines.text: That's nice. Are you drunk?

lines.speaker: u5998
lines.text: I don't know. How do I know?

lines.speaker: u5999
lines.text: I don't know either. You spin around, when you lie down.

lines.speaker: u6009
lines.text: I have to get back.

lines.speaker: u6000
lines.text: Too bad...

lines.speaker: u6009
lines.text: What about your shoulder?

lines.speaker: u6001
lines.text: Don't worry.  I'll have a cool scar.

lines.speaker: u6002
lines.text: Oh, you know.  Don't feel that much. Bullet went right through.

lines.speaker: u6009
lines.text: Right.  Got lost in the rocks.

lines.speaker: u6002
lines.text: We'll get the other one, though.

lines.speaker: u6003
lines.text: Are you sure about that?

lines.speaker: u6008
lines.text: She'd come to me, sometimes in the middle of the night.  Bruises all over her back, her upper arms.  I pled with her to let me call the police, but she wouldn't hear it.  Wanted to keep it a secret.

lines.speaker: u6004
lines.text: I'm thinking I could get off with probation.  Keep half my pension.  That's all I want.

lines.speaker: u6009
lines.text: Goddammit, Hap.  Think about what you're doing...

lines.speaker: u6004
lines.text: You don't have to be involved, Will.

lines.speaker: u6009
lines.text: You tell Buck and I'm involved whether I like it or not...

lines.speaker: u6005
lines.text: What if someone finds out?

lines.speaker: u6009
lines.text: We're under investigation now.  Back in Seattle.  Hap wanted to talk.  As soon as we got back.  Thought he could work out some kind of deal.

lines.speaker: u6006
lines.text: Thought I smelled something.

lines.speaker: u6009
lines.text: Good to see you, too, Randy.

lines.speaker: u6007
lines.text: It was like some big fucking secret!

lines.speaker: u6009
lines.text: What was?

lines.speaker: u6007
lines.text: She kept saying she was gonna get out of here. Leave us all behind. That he was going to take her!

lines.speaker: u6009
lines.text: Who?

lines.speaker: u6007
lines.text: My arm!

lines.speaker: u6009
lines.text: Who?

lines.speaker: u6007
lines.text: She used some stupid code name.

lines.speaker: u6009
lines.text: What was it?

lines.speaker: u6007
lines.text: Brody...I don't know...  ...Something Brody!

lines.speaker: u6008
lines.text: Wild card.

lines.speaker: u6009
lines.text: Drop the gun, Walter.

lines.speaker: u6010
lines.text: Your melancholy eyes...

lines.speaker: u6013
lines.text: What a pair we are. We deserve each other, don't we?

lines.speaker: u6010
lines.text: We are a pair, and that's what counts.

lines.speaker: u6013
lines.text: Bear me no ill will, my love. We are now even.

lines.speaker: u6011
lines.text: What do you mean?

lines.speaker: u6013
lines.text: What died tonight inside that room was not that woman. It will take her many nights to die, perhaps yeaars. What has died in that room tonight is the last vestige in me of what was human.

lines.speaker: u6012
lines.text: I tried to tell you Louis... that night in Paris... when I first came to you... no-one can refuse the dark gift, Louis... not even you.

lines.speaker: u6013
lines.text: I tried...

lines.speaker: u6012
lines.text: And the more you tried, the more I wanted you... a vampire with your beautiful, suffering human heart. And how you suffered... I need your forgiveness, Louis.

lines.speaker: u6013
lines.text: You have it...

lines.speaker: u6013
lines.text: Look at the gaslight. Don't tke your eyes off it. You will be drained to the point of death, but you must stay alive. Do you hear me?

lines.speaker: u6014
lines.text: Yes!

lines.speaker: u6019
lines.text: Then I'll call the mainland for a charter.

lines.speaker: u6016
lines.text: Phones went down a few minutes ago.

lines.speaker: u6017
lines.text: I don't know, man. Maybe we should keep going, find a phone --

lines.speaker: u6024
lines.text: No.

lines.speaker: u6017
lines.text: The guy looks dead.

lines.speaker: u6018
lines.text: I got work to do. Take the bake elsewhere.

lines.speaker: u6025
lines.text: Up-tighteous and self-righteous.

lines.speaker: u6019
lines.text: ...Why?

lines.speaker: u6027
lines.text: Why? Come on, Julie. Think. You'll get it. Will Benson -- Ben's son.

lines.speaker: u6020
lines.text: Waaaaahhhhhhhhhh!

lines.speaker: u6022
lines.text: We'll call you back with all the details...So what's your favorite radio station?

lines.speaker: u6021
lines.text: Hell, that's worth three, easy. And you got your waiting period.

lines.speaker: u6024
lines.text: I'm not waiting...So give me the gun and keep the ring.

lines.speaker: u6023
lines.text: I'm sorry, but you could've been the one doing all of this --

lines.speaker: u6026
lines.text: And so could you -- crazy fool.

lines.speaker: u6023
lines.text: You stumbled into my hiding place.

lines.speaker: u6026
lines.text: Must have missed the sign.

lines.speaker: u6023
lines.text: Excuse me, but this island didn't have a murder rate until you people showed up.  I've never seen a dead body before.

lines.speaker: u6027
lines.text: Where'd Estes go?

lines.speaker: u6026
lines.text: What is up with that weirdo?

lines.speaker: u6027
lines.text: I'll go find him.

lines.speaker: u6028
lines.text: Another sad task. We'll bury her tomorrow.  I think we'd better lock the door for tonight. It will make them less uncomfortable.

lines.speaker: u6031
lines.text: No.  She shall not be left here.

lines.speaker: u6028
