lines.text: No, I think hygiene is important. It helps you get into the part.

lines.speaker: u7776
lines.text: Very professional of you.

lines.speaker: u7777
lines.text: Is that clear?

lines.speaker: u7784
lines.text: That's clear.

lines.speaker: u7777
lines.text: Good.  Now you'll hear from me when I have the new coordinates. In the meantime don't bug me.

lines.speaker: u7784
lines.text: Sheesh!  Aye aye cap'n!

lines.speaker: u7777
lines.text: Over and out!

lines.speaker: u7778
lines.text: It's getting hard to breathe...

lines.speaker: u7781
lines.text: Just don't move around too much.

lines.speaker: u7779
lines.text: I'm going back for Taylor!

lines.speaker: u7781
lines.text: Are you nuts!  It's too risky!

lines.speaker: u7780
lines.text: What the hell is that?

lines.speaker: u7781
lines.text: The engines!

lines.speaker: u7786
lines.text: Is it safe for human transport?

lines.speaker: u7782
lines.text: That's affirmative.

lines.speaker: u7789
lines.text: Did you hear about that bowler who got smeared? I saw them pull a body bag out of the alley. I heard he was kacked but good. They had to take apart the pin machine to get him out.

lines.speaker: u7802
lines.text: The pin machine?

lines.speaker: u7789
lines.text: Just like Junior did the last time; lane six. All's I know is it's gonna be a closed coffin. My advice to you is to lay low. He puts on a pair of dark 7-Eleven shades, flips up his collar and skulks away.

lines.speaker: u7790
lines.text: You a mini-golfer?

lines.speaker: u7802
lines.text: Nope.

lines.speaker: u7790
lines.text: Paradise, huh? Might be one of the new putt-putts off route 99. Theo turns to leave.

lines.speaker: u7790
lines.text: Can I get you something for the road?

lines.speaker: u7802
lines.text: You have orange whips?

lines.speaker: u7790
lines.text: Orange who? Not from 'round here, are ya?

lines.speaker: u7802
lines.text: No. I'm from Akron.

lines.speaker: u7801
lines.text: The Faz sure took care a her.  Breeze makes a nasal GRUNT as he tries to suppress a snigger. Sid - trying to keep a straight face - elbows him. Sid and Breeze approach the coffin. Breeze pulls an orange whip out of a paper bag and carefully places it on the coffin lid.

lines.speaker: u7791
lines.text: Nectar of the bowling gods, Faz.

lines.speaker: u7801
lines.text: See ya 'round Faz.

lines.speaker: u7798
lines.text: My poor baby!

lines.speaker: u7792
lines.text: You see what you did?  Take your ball and get out.

lines.speaker: u7793
lines.text: Hello?

lines.speaker: u7802
lines.text: Hello, mom?

lines.speaker: u7793
lines.text: Theodore? Where are you? Are you alright?

lines.speaker: u7802
lines.text: I found dad.

lines.speaker: u7793
lines.text: He's dead, isn't he.  Buzz Fazeli might just as well have died before you were born.

lines.speaker: u7802
lines.text: Mom, you know I had to do it. I just did it a little too late.

lines.speaker: u7793
lines.text: You sure you're OK Teddy? You're not bowling are you?

lines.speaker: u7802
lines.text: I gotta go. Love ya mom.

lines.speaker: u7802
lines.text: Don't tell me, John.

lines.speaker: u7794
lines.text: Cool!

lines.speaker: u7802
lines.text: Theo. Howzitgoin.

lines.speaker: u7794
lines.text: Hey man, welcome to our parking lot. Lemme give you some advice, if she asks you to dance, make sure her brother's not around. Somebody blew out Junior's pilot light, if you get my meaning.

lines.speaker: u7802
lines.text: How's that?

lines.speaker: u7794
lines.text: I was doing the lambada with her and the guy freaks, he breaks my arm, tries to kill me. I swear man, the guy thought I was a piata. If nobody else hadn't a been there, he wouldn't have stopped. He woulda killed me. Fuckin' guy man, just snapped. How do you like your burger?

lines.speaker: u7802
lines.text: Uh...over easy.

lines.speaker: u7794
lines.text: I'll tell you one thing, you won't see me around that alley with that freak on the loose. Stay away from his ass - and don't play any of his fuckin' knock-knock jokes.

lines.speaker: u7796
lines.text: I have someone for you to play with Junior.

lines.speaker: u7795
lines.text: Someone wants to play with me?

lines.speaker: u7796
lines.text: I have someone for you to play Blueface with Junior.

lines.speaker: u7795
lines.text: Blueface! Blueface is my favorite.

lines.speaker: u7796
lines.text: I get them while they're young. Builds loyalty.

lines.speaker: u7799
lines.text: She hit it, Mr. Kastle!

lines.speaker: u7796
lines.text: Four or five years when a girl like that's bowling on the pro tour for Team Kastle, she'll pay a handsome profit on my investment.

lines.speaker: u7797
lines.text: Hole in one! You're the queen of stroke!

lines.speaker: u7803
lines.text: Yippy!

lines.speaker: u7798
lines.text: Careful with that one. He won't tell me anything, but I know there's something strange going on over at the lanes. If you ask me, I'd say the old fart wants to die.

lines.speaker: u7802
lines.text: Where can I find him?

lines.speaker: u7798
lines.text: The Peter Pan.

lines.speaker: u7800
lines.text: Very professional.

lines.speaker: u7802
lines.text: I am a professional man.

lines.speaker: u7800
lines.text: Lips still for sale?

lines.speaker: u7802
lines.text: You bet. For five bucks, I'll even throw in the tongue.

lines.speaker: u7800
lines.text: Can you change something this big?

lines.speaker: u7802
lines.text: You faked my dad's murder. You used him! Where is he! Theo chases Sid and Breeze around their car. He catches Sid and grabs the middle fingers on his right hand. Sid howls.

lines.speaker: u7801
lines.text: Ow! Ooh! No, please! Doc said I'd be back on the planks in a week! Show him Breeze! Breeze pulls a copy of "New York Bowler" from his pocket. The headline reads "RUB OUT!:BOWLING LEGEND KACKED BY DWARFSCAM KINGPIN" with a photo of Buzz Fazeli.

lines.speaker: u7805
lines.text: ... Your civil rights have been overridden!

lines.speaker: u7804
lines.text: Open it, Captain!

lines.speaker: u7805
lines.text: Dr. Levine, please!  Return to your seat!

lines.speaker: u7805
lines.text: Well, until we know exactly what it is, nobody goes outside, understood?

lines.speaker: u7814
lines.text: What was Edmunds doing outside?

lines.speaker: u7805
lines.text: Resetting the sub.

lines.speaker: u7814
lines.text: What sub?

lines.speaker: u7805
lines.text: In the dome hanger.  All our tapes are transferred to the sub.  It's on a 12 hour timer.  If someone doesn't reset the "delay" button, the sub ascends to the surface with the tapes.

lines.speaker: u7809
lines.text: They're going to want answers and they're going to keep asking until they get them.

lines.speaker: u7806
lines.text: We can refuse to talk.

lines.speaker: u7809
lines.text: Won't make any difference.  The tapes document everything.

lines.speaker: u7811
lines.text: When did it come across?

lines.speaker: u7807
lines.text: Minutes ago.  Harry's trying to decode it in his room now.

lines.speaker: u7811
lines.text: Where's it coming from?

lines.speaker: u7807
lines.text: No idea.  We have no surface support. It transmitted too fast to be coming from underwater.

lines.speaker: u7811
lines.text: Is it coming from our own computer?

lines.speaker: u7807
lines.text: Harry thinks it's some sort of discharge from our own system, but I've seen it discharge before -- and it didn't look anything like this.

lines.speaker: u7814
lines.text: Don't gimme that psychology bullshit, Norman.  Psychology isn't a science, it's superstition.  It's a bunch of soft, subjective theories without any hard data to back it up. With an intellect like this, emotions don't mean shit.

lines.speaker: u7809
lines.text: It's like showing Leonardo da Vinci a laptop computer.  He'd run screaming "witchcraft".  And you couldn't explain it to him, either. Modems, microchips, particle physics.

lines.speaker: u7811
lines.text: That whole time -- I couldn't stop thinking of what Harry was saying earlier...

lines.speaker: u7810
lines.text: What was that, sir?

lines.speaker: u7811
lines.text: About the time paradox.  How we were all going to die -- that there was no way we would make it out of here alive --

lines.speaker: u7815
lines.text: There's a U.S.  Navy car outside, Norman.

lines.speaker: u7811
lines.text: What?

lines.speaker: u7815
lines.text: Was it a military crash?

lines.speaker: u7811
lines.text: I don't know.

lines.speaker: u7815
lines.text: They never used to send a Navy car.

lines.speaker: u7824
lines.text: The Kiber Crystal.

lines.speaker: u7816
lines.text: Keep it with you always.  You'll have more need of it than I.  It will bring the Force to you.  You've already learned to feel it... Now you must learn to use it.

lines.speaker: u7817
lines.text: I'll tell you, Luke, and this is between you and me.  The star force isn't all it's cracked up to be. Frankly, it's a bore, and it's going to stay that way as long as this system is neutral...

lines.speaker: u7824
lines.text: But you always said things were so great at the academy... What happened?

lines.speaker: u7817
lines.text: The academy is fantastic... Of course, they won't teach you anything about flying you don't already know.  Most of the instructors are very conservative pilots.  You can fly circles around them... but there is a lot on the scientific side that is down-right amazing, and you get a lot of discipline... but after you graduate, don't join the star force -- go free-lance.  It's the only way to get into the action... I can't wait until my hitch is up.

lines.speaker: u7824
lines.text: At least you're doing something... I'd give anything to be in your position.

lines.speaker: u7817
lines.text: Just be warned, that things aren't always as they seem... especially the starforce recruiting posters.

lines.speaker: u7818
lines.text: Blue Five, break off your cover attack.  It's too late.  Make your own run on the exhaust port.  Do you copy, Luke?

lines.speaker: u7824
lines.text: Yes, sir, but I can get him...

lines.speaker: u7818
lines.text: Forget it, son.

lines.speaker: u7819
lines.text: We don't get many visitors.  Let's take a look at it.

lines.speaker: u7820
lines.text: Send out a boarding party.  Full assault gear.

lines.speaker: u7821
lines.text: I noticed you were having some problems, Blue Five... I thought I'd help.

lines.speaker: u7824
lines.text: Thanks, old buddy.  I'll be with you in a second.

lines.speaker: u7824
lines.text: A Wookiee broke loose up here, but we've subdued him... There is a lot of damage, and three, no four, casualties...

lines.speaker: u7822
lines.text: We'll send a squad up.

lines.speaker: u7824
lines.text: No need, everything's under control.

lines.speaker: u7822
lines.text: With four casualties?!

lines.speaker: u7824
lines.text: The... ah door's jammed.  Give us a few minutes to get it fixed.

lines.speaker: u7822
lines.text: Who is this?  What's your operating...

lines.speaker: u7823
lines.text: And you?

lines.speaker: u7824
lines.text: I... I don't know.  I guess I never thought about it... I just want to help.  I want to be in on the attack. I want my own ship.

lines.speaker: u7823
lines.text: If you're as good a pilot as you are a swordsman... We're the ones who have been rewarded.

lines.speaker: u7826
lines.text: Thank you, sir.  Your kindness is greatly appreciated, but if it's at all possible, Artoo and I would like to remain in your service.

lines.speaker: u7824
lines.text: I'd consider it an honor.

lines.speaker: u7837
lines.text: Saddle up, Roughnecks !

lines.speaker: u7828
lines.text: You heard the Lieutenant ! On the bounce, troopers !

lines.speaker: u7837
lines.text: Sir, I wish to reconsider my request to drop out, sir.

lines.speaker: u7829
lines.text: Sorry, son. I can't do it. You signed the 1240/A. It would be illegal.

lines.speaker: u7837
lines.text: Sir, i know it was wrong. I didn't learn from one mistake and I made another, sir.  Sir, my family... my whole family was in Buenos Aires, sir.

lines.speaker: u7837
lines.text: You always told me you couldn't do human...

lines.speaker: u7830
lines.text: I can't... but like I told you, it's a number's game. The Federation needs all the pilots it can get...

lines.speaker: u7832
lines.text: Leave me, Lieutenant ! That's an order !

lines.speaker: u7831
lines.text: No way, ma'am !

lines.speaker: u7832
lines.text: This isn't random or light. Someone made amistake...!

lines.speaker: u7843
lines.text: That's it, we're empty ma'am !

lines.speaker: u7833
lines.text: I bought the farm, didn't I, Johnny ?

lines.speaker: u7837
lines.text: No, you're gonna be alright, Diz !

lines.speaker: u7833
lines.text: It's alright 'cause I got to have you, Johnny...

lines.speaker: u7834
lines.text: Well, it's just good to hear from you. What's up, son ?

lines.speaker: u7837
lines.text: It's not really working out for me here, dad. I was thinking... I was hoping it would be alright if I came home.

lines.speaker: u7840
lines.text: Gillespie, put in call for retrieval. We're off this rock. Gillespie, do you read me ?

lines.speaker: u7835
lines.text: AAAAAAAAAAA !

lines.speaker: u7836
lines.text: Take your group down to P and have a look see. Leave the thinking to us, Lieutenant. That's not your job.

lines.speaker: u7840
lines.text: My job is to protect the lives of my soldiers so they can kill bugs, Major, and if you're walking me into a trap-

lines.speaker: u7836
lines.text: Bugs don't lay traps... They aren't intelligent ! Unlike you, they're stupid enough to follow orders !

lines.speaker: u7840
lines.text: This is my farm. Get on the boat, NOW ! That's an order, Sergeant.

lines.speaker: u7837
lines.text: Give'em hell, sir !

lines.speaker: u7847
lines.text: And when V'ger melds? What will happen to you?

lines.speaker: u7845
lines.text: It will... take me from <U>you</U>...

lines.speaker: u7846
lines.text: Tractor beam strength lessening, Captain.

lines.speaker: u7849
lines.text: Mr. Scott... on my next signal.

lines.speaker: u7848
lines.text: Was he difficult?

lines.speaker: u7847
lines.text: No more than I expected  Not as difficult as this. I'm sorry...

lines.speaker: u7848
lines.text: That you left? or that you didn't say 'goodbye'?

lines.speaker: u7847
lines.text: If I'd seen you again, would you have been able to say it?

lines.speaker: u7848
lines.text: No.

lines.speaker: u7848
lines.text: Fifteen seconds to Cloud Boundary.

lines.speaker: u7849
lines.text: Viewer, standard ahead.

lines.speaker: u7849
lines.text: Engineering... Status, Mr. Scott?

lines.speaker: u7851
lines.text: We're ready, sir.

lines.speaker: u7849
lines.text: Thank you, Scotty. Stand by.

lines.speaker: u7855
lines.text: Starfleet has been apprised of our situation, Captain.

lines.speaker: u7854
lines.text: Tractor beam remains constant...

lines.speaker: u7856
lines.text: Maude, this <u>man</u> wrote this <u>play</u>!

lines.speaker: u7871
lines.text: That a fact.  Now, is it a good play?

lines.speaker: u7856
lines.text: Yes, Maude, it is.  It is a <u>very</u> good play.

lines.speaker: u7871
lines.text: Well, then, what's he doing here?

lines.speaker: u7856
lines.text: What're you doing here...?

lines.speaker: u7866
lines.text: Cluster of events.  Don't see something, ten years, allasudden.  Three times inna night.

lines.speaker: u7857
lines.text: That's what they call an events cluster. Some guy, nobby orders a Manhattan, fifteen, twenty years, allasudden, three times inna night.

lines.speaker: u7869
lines.text: Well, where do they hold court?

lines.speaker: u7858
lines.text: Hold court, they have to, science lab, the high school.

lines.speaker: u7877
lines.text: How big is this horse?

lines.speaker: u7859
lines.text: Fifteen hands.

lines.speaker: u7877
lines.text: What is that in fingers...?  Just kidding, get me this horse.

lines.speaker: u7859
lines.text: This horse is booked.

lines.speaker: u7877
lines.text: Tell the guy, get me the horse, I'll give him an Associate Producer credit.

lines.speaker: u7877
lines.text: You do...?

lines.speaker: u7860
lines.text: I just don't know what <u>order</u> they come in...

lines.speaker: u7861
lines.text: It's a formality.  Any case of damage to city prop...you hit the control box of the new stop light, and...  They'll, uh, these things <u>happen</u>, I hope you're alright, and that you're feeling...

lines.speaker: u7870
lines.text: Well, Officer, don't worry ab...

lines.speaker: u7861
lines.text: If there's anything I...

lines.speaker: u7870
lines.text: It's a mistake.  It's all over.  I'm sorry that we've inconvenienced you.

lines.speaker: u7862
lines.text: I wasn't in the car.

lines.speaker: u7870
lines.text: We know that you weren't.

lines.speaker: u7863
lines.text: No, are you kidding me, Bob, not at all.

lines.speaker: u7877
lines.text: Marty...

lines.speaker: u7877
lines.text: "Bring it in on time and there's more where these came from.  Marty.  P.S. I want to talk to you about a product tie- in..."

lines.speaker: u7864
lines.text: I'll put the, in your r...

lines.speaker: u7877
lines.text: Somebody make a note.  I want Li..., for the broad...what does she like?  Lilacs. Okay.  A truck of lilacs when the broad comes.  And get something for Bob Barrenger, get him, what does he like...?

lines.speaker: u7864
lines.text: Bob Barrenger...Bob...Bob Barrenger's in this movie?

lines.speaker: u7877
lines.text: That's cor...

lines.speaker: u7864
lines.text: He's staying here?  Bob Barrenger is staying he...?

lines.speaker: u7877
lines.text: Put something in his room.  What does he like?

lines.speaker: u7865
lines.text: She doesn't want to Bare Her Breasts.

lines.speaker: u7877
lines.text: She Doesn't Want to Bare Her Breasts...what, in the "Nude Scene...?" What are we paying her three mil?

lines.speaker: u7865
lines.text: -- she's got 'religion.'

lines.speaker: u7877
lines.text: Her religion bars her from fulfilling her contr...

lines.speaker: u7869
lines.text: Aren't you supposed to set an example for people...?

lines.speaker: u7866
lines.text: Nope.  I'm just supposed to hold people's hands, while they die.  What'd you say your problem was...

lines.speaker: u7869
lines.text: ...I just swore my life away, back in that...

lines.speaker: u7866
lines.text: Mornin, Chessy...how's the back...?

lines.speaker: u7867
lines.text: Half a buck I'd close it down...it's per...you know, it's perfidy, you got your Barrenger, molesting little girls...

lines.speaker: u7868
lines.text: He should be put in jail.

lines.speaker: u7867
lines.text: Half a buck I'd put him in jail...

lines.speaker: u7868
lines.text: You should.

lines.speaker: u7867
lines.text: I had a witness I would.

lines.speaker: u7868
lines.text: A witness to what...?

lines.speaker: u7867
lines.text: You know, the rape, to...even to the accident...

lines.speaker: u7868
lines.text: You mean <u>with White</u>...?

lines.speaker: u7867
lines.text: What?

lines.speaker: u7868
lines.text: You mean you need a witness in addition to White...?

lines.speaker: u7867
lines.text: Who's White...?

lines.speaker: u7868
lines.text: The writer.

lines.speaker: u7867
lines.text: He saw the accident...?

lines.speaker: u7868
lines.text: Sure.

lines.speaker: u7867
lines.text: He saw the girl in the car...

lines.speaker: u7868
lines.text: You bet he did.

lines.speaker: u7868
lines.text: I'm trying, honey...I'm...look, is your Ma, when is your <u>Mom</u> coming?  Oh.  What did the <u>midwife</u>...?

lines.speaker: u7877
lines.text: Did you, where are we going tonight...?

lines.speaker: u7877
lines.text: Some, you were, you were going to make a reservation for us?  Where's my schedule? Where are we <u>booked</u> tonight?

lines.speaker: u7868
lines.text: My <u>wife's having a baby</u>...

lines.speaker: u7877
lines.text: You what...?  Is that on the callsheet, is that on the callsheet, or is that <u>personal business</u>?  Ah, Christ. <u>Marty</u>...Are we <u>paying</u> you?

lines.speaker: u7869
lines.text: I was walking down the street...I remember, I was writing a...

lines.speaker: u7870
lines.text: What glasses were you wearing?  Were you wearing your reading glasses...?

lines.speaker: u7870
lines.text: You told me you were writing.  Don't you wear your reading glasses to write...?

lines.speaker: u7877
lines.text: Do something.

lines.speaker: u7870
lines.text: You tell me what to do, I'll do it.

lines.speaker: u7872
lines.text: Well, these things happen.  <u>Purpose</u> of my call, my wife wanted to know what brand of <u>cigarettes</u> Mr. Barrenger smokes, so she could lay some out tonight...we got the list of his dietary <u>requirements</u>...

lines.speaker: u7877
lines.text: So we just got lucky.

lines.speaker: u7875
lines.text: You see where Tom Miller's playin' the Old Farmer?

lines.speaker: u7873
lines.text: He's been playin' Old Farmer nigh on sixty years.

lines.speaker: u7875
lines.text: I read for that part.  Did pretty good too.

lines.speaker: u7873
lines.text: Bet you did.

lines.speaker: u7875
lines.text: But I couldn't r'member all the words. Ast them would they gimme a second chance.

lines.speaker: u7873
lines.text: Ain't no second chances in life.

lines.speaker: u7875
lines.text: Zat true?

lines.speaker: u7873
lines.text: Only second chance we git, z'ta make the same mistake twice...

lines.speaker: u7877
lines.text: Why?

lines.speaker: u7876
lines.text: Because they gots a window with a dogs in it.  You want me to "push in."  Or I can lose the shot.

lines.speaker: u7877
lines.text: No you can't lose the shot.  The meaning of the <u>film</u> <u>is</u> in that shot.

lines.speaker: u7876
lines.text: But, Wally, the window of the <u>firehut</u>...

lines.speaker: u7877
lines.text: I don't care.  <u>Fix</u> it.

lines.speaker: u7884
lines.text: ...your hating me.

lines.speaker: u7878
lines.text: Cos she loves you.

lines.speaker: u7884
lines.text: Cos she loves <u>you</u>.  She wanted you to have a daddy to love.  Even if he didn't...completely...deserve it.

lines.speaker: u7879
lines.text: It's not good enough.

lines.speaker: u7883
lines.text: No, it isn't.  Because it isn't everything.  And we want every- thing, don't we?

lines.speaker: u7880
lines.text: May I remind you that Duncan has the <u>client</u> arriving at exac...

lines.speaker: u7885
lines.text: Sure.  I was just doin' my nails.

lines.speaker: u7883
lines.text: Why would his worry?  Or my children's worry.  Or anyone's worry.  Help the sit...

lines.speaker: u7881
lines.text: Sooner than later.  You really need to.

lines.speaker: u7882
lines.text: You can't <u>do</u> that, I won't <u>let</u> you!

lines.speaker: u7885
lines.text: No, no, no, this is a job that's hard to <u>keep</u>, <u>not</u> a job that's hard to <u>lose</u>, can't be both.

lines.speaker: u7882
lines.text: Rachel, <u>don't</u> do this, you will <u>never</u> forgive yourself!

lines.speaker: u7885
lines.text: You know, there's nothing you have to say.  Because they know your heart.  You don't have t...

lines.speaker: u7883
lines.text: Just sit me up.  Nice and tall. Bring Benjamin first.

lines.speaker: u7884
lines.text: Where you goin'?

lines.speaker: u7885
lines.text: I'm gonna get me a drink.

lines.speaker: u7885
lines.text: Hi, I'm here to pick up Ben.

lines.speaker: u7886
lines.text: Does Jackie know this?

lines.speaker: u7885
lines.text: No.  I'm doing it behind her back.

lines.speaker: u7886

lines.text: Maybe we can make a deal.

lines.speaker: u7950
lines.text: Bank branch!

lines.speaker: u7948
lines.text: All of you!

lines.speaker: u7950
lines.text: What the hell do you want?

lines.speaker: u7952
lines.text: I want to help.  I'm part of this squad...

lines.speaker: u7954
lines.text: We're ready with the shot, Mr. deMille.

lines.speaker: u7958
lines.text: You'll pardon me, Norma? Why don't you just sit and watch?  O.K.  Here we go.

lines.speaker: u7954
lines.text: Roll 'em.

lines.speaker: u7958
lines.text: Action! The scene starts.

lines.speaker: u7955
lines.text: The accent! I've got it: this guy is in the pay of a foreign government. Get those studs.  Get those cuff-links.

lines.speaker: u7959
lines.text: I've got to run along.  Thanks any- way for your interest in my career.

lines.speaker: u7959
lines.text: Her own movie theatre.

lines.speaker: u7956
lines.text: I didn't come here to see a house. What about Norma Desmond?

lines.speaker: u7959
lines.text: I'm trying to tell you.  This is an enormous place.  Eight master bedrooms.  A sunken tub in every bathroom.  There's a bowling alley in the cellar.  It's lonely here, so she got herself a companion. A very simple set-up: An older woman who is well-to-do.  A younger man who is not doing too well ... Can you figure it out yourself?

lines.speaker: u7956
lines.text: No.

lines.speaker: u7959
lines.text: All right.  I'll give you a few more clues.

lines.speaker: u7956
lines.text: No, no! I haven't heard any of this.  I never got those telephone calls.  I've never been in this house ... Get your things together. Let's get out of here.

lines.speaker: u7959
lines.text: All my things? All the eighteen suits, all the custom-made shoes and the eighteen dozen shirts, and the cuff-links and the platinum key- chains, and the cigarette cases?

lines.speaker: u7956
lines.text: Come on, Joe.

lines.speaker: u7959
lines.text: Come on where? Back to a one-room apartment that I can't pay for? Back to a story that may sell and very possibly will not?

lines.speaker: u7956
lines.text: If you love me, Joe.

lines.speaker: u7959
lines.text: Look, sweetie -- be practical. l've got a good thing here. A long-term contract with no options. I like it that way.  Maybe it's not very admirable.  Well, you and Artie can be admirable.

lines.speaker: u7956
lines.text: Joe, I can't look at you any more.

lines.speaker: u7959
lines.text: Nobody asked you to.

lines.speaker: u7957
lines.text: Goodbye, young fellow.  We'll see what we can do.

lines.speaker: u7965
lines.text: I'm not worried.  Everything will be fine.  The old team together. Nothing can stop us.

lines.speaker: u7958
lines.text: What's the matter, Norma?

lines.speaker: u7965
lines.text: Nothing.  I just didn't realize what it would be like to come back to the old studio.  I had no idea how I'd missed it.

lines.speaker: u7958
lines.text: We've missed you too, dear.

lines.speaker: u7965
lines.text: We'll be working again, won't we, Chief? We'll make our greatest picture.

lines.speaker: u7958
lines.text: That's what I want to talk to you about.

lines.speaker: u7965
lines.text: It's a good script, isn't it?

lines.speaker: u7958
lines.text: It's got a lot of good things.  Of course, it would be an expensive picture...

lines.speaker: u7965
lines.text: I don't care about the money. I just want to work again.  You don't know what it means to know that you want me.

lines.speaker: u7958
lines.text: Nothing would thrill me more -- if it were possible.

lines.speaker: u7965
lines.text: But remember, darling -- I don't work before ten in the morning, and never after 4:30 in the afternoon.

lines.speaker: u7959
lines.text: How's that about your being my friend?

lines.speaker: u7963
lines.text: Don't you know the finest things in the world have been written on an empty stomach?  Once a talent like yours gets into that Mocambo- Romanoff rut, you're through.

lines.speaker: u7959
lines.text: Forget Romanoff's.  It's the car I'm talking about.  If I lose my car it's like having my legs out off.

lines.speaker: u7963
lines.text: Greatest thing that could happen to you.  Now you'll have to sit behind that typewriter.  Now you'll have to write.

lines.speaker: u7959
lines.text: What do you think I've been doing? I need three hundred dollars.

lines.speaker: u7963
lines.text: Maybe what you need is another agent.

lines.speaker: u7961
lines.text: Well, it's one way to get her down stairs.

lines.speaker: u7960
lines.text: Okay.  And let's have the car right outside.

lines.speaker: u7965
lines.text: What is the scene? Where am I?

lines.speaker: u7962
lines.text: This is the staircase of the palace.

lines.speaker: u7965
lines.text: Oh, yes, yes.  They're below, waiting for the Princess ... I'm ready.

lines.speaker: u7962
lines.text: All right.  Camera!  Action!

lines.speaker: u7967
lines.text: But the Power Source, Zaltar.

lines.speaker: u7980
lines.text: It couldn't be helped. The city will have to make do with three.

lines.speaker: u7967
lines.text: But what will happen?

lines.speaker: u7980
lines.text: The Guardians will be angry. They may even send me to the Phantom Zone. You see, I didn't really have permission to borrow it. I must go explain to them...

lines.speaker: u7978
lines.text: At last. Ultimate Power.

lines.speaker: u7968
lines.text: And the first thing we do is get rid of Supergirl!

lines.speaker: u7978
lines.text: What do you mean we?

lines.speaker: u7969
lines.text: Is this Nigel's doing?

lines.speaker: u7978
lines.text: It's a warning, that's for sure.

lines.speaker: u7969
lines.text: Maybe it was just an accident.

lines.speaker: u7978
lines.text: There's no such thing as an accident. Everything has meaning, if you can read the signs.

lines.speaker: u7970
lines.text: Why the empty cage?

lines.speaker: u7978
lines.text: That one was for you. But I thought I'd wait and see how you behave when Supergirl gets here. I'd hate to lose you, Ethan.

lines.speaker: u7971
lines.text: Hey, where you going?

lines.speaker: u7978
lines.text: I've got things to do.

lines.speaker: u7971
lines.text: What about my proposal?

lines.speaker: u7978
lines.text: Call me next week. Maybe we can have lunch.

lines.speaker: u7972
lines.text: I've been in love with you for years. Remember how you used to visit your sister in the newsroom? And put your fingerprints on my lens.

lines.speaker: u7975
lines.text: Remember? I was trying desperately to get you're attention.

lines.speaker: u7972
lines.text: You were? You mean we could've been... you-know-what... all this time?

lines.speaker: u7975
lines.text: You bet your ass.

lines.speaker: u7972
lines.text: Why didn't you tell me?

lines.speaker: u7975
lines.text: You're supposed to guess.

lines.speaker: u7973
lines.text: I'm sorry... I didn't know.

lines.speaker: u7980
lines.text: It was my fault. You aren't old enough to use the wand. I shouldn't have given it to you.

lines.speaker: u7974
lines.text: Thank you both so much. It was a lovely lunch, Mrs. Danvers. I had a wonderful time. And you're a terrific chess player MR. Danvers.

lines.speaker: u7976
lines.text: What? Me?

lines.speaker: u7974
lines.text: Sure. Mate in five moves.

lines.speaker: u7978
lines.text: Which of you is willing to make that sacrifice?

lines.speaker: u7977
lines.text: You would! You revealed our existence so you could have all of our power.

lines.speaker: u7978
lines.text: Maybe you'd like to get rid of this Supergirl yourself, Nigel?

lines.speaker: u7977
lines.text: Why get rid of her at al1? You've used the Coffer of Shadow too much.  It is beginning to rule your heart.

lines.speaker: u7978
lines.text: Nonsense.

lines.speaker: u7979
lines.text: They'll be grateful. If you hadn't found it, it would still be lost. Look, up ahead.

lines.speaker: u7978
lines.text: Yes, I see it. Shining like a jewel.

lines.speaker: u7979
lines.text: That's home.

lines.speaker: u7980
lines.text: Goodbye...

lines.speaker: u7979
lines.text: Zaltar!

lines.speaker: u7983
lines.text: I just think Ricky would rather not get a bowling lesson in front of the other kids.

lines.speaker: u7982
lines.text: The kid needs a man to show him --

lines.speaker: u7983
lines.text: The kid will do fine on his own.  Give it your best shot, Ricky!

lines.speaker: u7987
lines.text: Keep talking to that state trooper so he doesn't notice where I'm going, okay?

lines.speaker: u7983
lines.text: What are you doing?

lines.speaker: u7987
lines.text: You know what Mr. White said. A photographer always goes after a story.

lines.speaker: u7984
lines.text: Ah yes, August Gorman. Have you looked for work this week, Mr. Gorman?

lines.speaker: u7986
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.speaker: u7984
lines.text: What kind?

lines.speaker: u7986
lines.text: Kitchen. . . Technician

lines.speaker: u7984
lines.text: Dishwasher? Any luck?

lines.speaker: u7986
lines.text: Nope, but --

lines.speaker: u7984
lines.text: Mr. Gorman, according to our records you have been unemployed for 36 weeks.

lines.speaker: u7986
lines.text: Thirty-five.

lines.speaker: u7984
lines.text: Not counting this week.  You secured employment last June as a messenger and were discharged after one day for. . .

lines.speaker: u7986
lines.text: They said I lost it on the subway, but it ain't the truth! It was a pickpocket took it!

lines.speaker: u7984
lines.text: A television set?

lines.speaker: u7986
lines.text: Well, it was one of them little bitty two-inch screen Japanese jobs.

lines.speaker: u7984
lines.text: The only other employment you found was in a fast-food joint--  -- which lasted. . . 28 minutes! Well! That's some kind of record. Talk about fast!

lines.speaker: u7986
lines.text: Man, them people was crazy! How they 'spect you to learn all that jive on the first day? "Hold the pickle! Hold the lettuce! Extra onions! Special sauce! No special sauce!" Ain't nobody found no meat inside that glop yet.

lines.speaker: u7984
lines.text: Mr. Gorman, the city of Metropolis is generous to a fault, but. . .

lines.speaker: u7986
lines.text: I know, I'm the fault.

lines.speaker: u7984
lines.text: Thirty-six weeks of chronic unemployment, thirty-six weeks of living off the taxes of hard-working citizens. Do you know what you are?

lines.speaker: u7986
lines.text: Don't call me a bum! I ain't no bum!

lines.speaker: u7984
lines.text: You are, I was about to say, no longer eligible.

lines.speaker: u7986
lines.text: What about this week's check?

lines.speaker: u7985
lines.text: Gus?

lines.speaker: u7986
lines.text: Say what?

lines.speaker: u7985
lines.text: The boss wants to see you.

lines.speaker: u7986
lines.text: Say who?

lines.speaker: u7986
lines.text: I know, by computers.

lines.speaker: u7997
lines.text: Will you stop interrupting ?!  You will command the pumps to stop pumping.

lines.speaker: u7987
lines.text: Why do I have to do this?

lines.speaker: u7992
lines.text: You! You're lucky I didn't fire you. I get a chance at exclusive on-the-spot pictures of the biggest forest fire in history and what does he come back with??? A broken leg and twelve melted rolls of film.

lines.speaker: u7987
lines.text: It was hot!

lines.speaker: u7996
lines.text: It's hard to believe... a great looking girl like you all alone like this. As she glances up at him, she is first flustered, then flattered, then...finally...just realistic:

lines.speaker: u7988
lines.text: Listen, are you sure you shouldn't do something about the bridge?

lines.speaker: u7996
lines.text: The bridge...?  I'd better get going!

lines.speaker: u7992
lines.text: Lois, I've got to hand it to you. You're amazing. Who else could manage to turn a three-week tropical vacation into a front page story that's going to blow the lid off government corruption in the Caribbean?

lines.speaker: u7989
lines.text: I just knew I was onto something when that taxi driver kidnapped me.

lines.speaker: u7997
lines.text: I can't! It's out of control!

lines.speaker: u7990
lines.text: But how? Where's it getting the power from ???!

lines.speaker: u7991
lines.text: It's modern. It's up-to-date. It's state-of-the art.  People, I am in love with this machine.  Go ahead, Mr. White.

lines.speaker: u7992
lines.text: Where's the handle?

lines.speaker: u7991
lines.text: There is no handle! You just push a button.

lines.speaker: u7997
lines.text: Yes! This time we got it right!

lines.speaker: u7994
lines.text: It's your genius, pal! You built a machine that can find anybody's weak spot, just like you said.

lines.speaker: u7998
lines.text: Gee. But --

lines.speaker: u8007
lines.text: No offense, Kent. You're good, but Lois is the best we've got.

lines.speaker: u7998
lines.text: No, I meant, it's awfully dangerous.

lines.speaker: u8003
lines.text: It has everything.

lines.speaker: u7999
lines.text: Wrong.

lines.speaker: u8003
lines.text: Why didn't you go before we left?

lines.speaker: u7999
lines.text: That was two days ago. Frankly, I think this place is a bit boring. It's all white. Why doesn't the guy put up some posters? Maybe some bullfight things . . .

lines.speaker: u8003
lines.text: It's beautiful.

lines.speaker: u8009
lines.text: Artemis? Do you read me?

lines.speaker: u8000
lines.text: What'd he say before? He saw a girl?

lines.speaker: u8009
lines.text: I think he said a "curl."

lines.speaker: u8000
lines.text: What's a curl?

lines.speaker: u8009
lines.text: Isn't that what the old Canaveral guys used to call a comet on an East-West trajectory?

lines.speaker: u8000
lines.text: How the hell would I know? I was in high school back in those days.

lines.speaker: u8007
lines.text: I can't understand it! Where is he? I mean, he shows up every time a cat gets stuck in a tree, and  now he decides to pull a disappearing act?

lines.speaker: u8001
lines.text: Maybe we just don' t know his game plan.

lines.speaker: u8007
lines.text: Game plan! It's fourth down and long yardage, the two-minute warning sounded and the ball's deep in our territory! How brilliant do you have to be?!

lines.speaker: u8001
lines.text: Superman's got something up his sleeve, that's for sure. We just haven't figured it out. Isn't that right, Miss Lane?

lines.speaker: u8002
lines.text: -- as the keeper of the archives of Krypton, it falls to me to tell you of the darkest episode in our planets history.

lines.speaker: u8005
lines.text: Now This I want to hear.

lines.speaker: u8002
lines.text: For many eons the peoples of our world have lived together in harmony. Then there appeared among us three anti-social elements - what on Earth are classified as "criminals."

lines.speaker: u8005
lines.text: My kind of people.

lines.speaker: u8002
lines.text: The three proved - after exhaustive efforts - incapable of rehabilitation. Now as you know, we had no death penalty -

lines.speaker: u8005
lines.text: Sensible enough.

lines.speaker: u8002
lines.text: And so our scientists constructed, from an irreversible mathematical equation, the Phantom Zone. In it we imprisoned these three arch-villains for all eternity.

lines.speaker: u8005
lines.text: No possibility for parole?

lines.speaker: u8002
lines.text: The Elders have, of course, thought long and hard about that question.

lines.speaker: u8005
lines.text: I asked the right question.

lines.speaker: u8002
lines.text: The one danger we have considered is that the Phantom Zone might - we cannot predict - just might be cracked by a nuclear explosion in space. I cannot say I am glad you asked me that -

lines.speaker: u8005
lines.text: I didn't ask her anything . . .

lines.speaker: u8003
lines.text: Oh, General, the world is a big place. Thank goodness, my needs are small...As  it turns out, I have this affinity for beachfront property . . .

lines.speaker: u8014
lines.text: What do you want?

lines.speaker: u8003
lines.text: Australia.

lines.speaker: u8004
lines.text: It must be tough, having to be Clark Kent.

lines.speaker: u8012
lines.text: Oh no.  I really like it sometimes.  And if it weren't for him, I wouldn't have met you.

lines.speaker: u8004
lines.text: But him is you.  Now I'm confused.

lines.speaker: u8005
lines.text: Hey, let's be fair. Actually, there've been two or three times --

lines.speaker: u8014
lines.text: Now I shall have the Son of Jor-El as my slave! Forever. If not, the millions of earthlings you protect will pay for your defiance.  Beginning with this one.

lines.speaker: u8014
lines.text: Who is this . . . Superman?

lines.speaker: u8008
lines.text: You'll find out, General! And when you do . . .

lines.speaker: u8014
lines.text: Come to me, Superman! If you dare! I defy you! Come! Come, and kneel before Zod!

lines.speaker: u8010
lines.text: And now they are willing to release the rest of the hostages?

lines.speaker: u8011
lines.text: In return for a guarantee that we will not launch an attack an them.

lines.speaker: u8010
lines.text: There will be no attack? No attempt to overpower the terrorists?

lines.speaker: u8011
lines.text: Um. . . .we have made this guarantee.

lines.speaker: u8010
lines.text: Yes, but will you honor it?

lines.speaker: u8011
lines.text: We have not the choice to refuse, have we, if we believe it is a real hydrogen bomb that they have.

lines.speaker: u8014
lines.text: Did you really believe we would give up our advantage?

lines.speaker: u8013
lines.text: "Super-sucker . " For once, Lex Luthor was right.

lines.speaker: u8021
lines.text: It must have been a super effort to get out of bed, Clark.

lines.speaker: u8015
lines.text: Well, I'm feeling a lot better . . . almost chipper . . .  . . . and all because I had a visit from a very good nurse.

lines.speaker: u8016
lines.text: Lex, we all appreciate how you've supported us lately and . . . uh . . . in recognition of your hard work we've decided to increase your commission to 12 percent.

lines.speaker: u8020
lines.text: Gee guys, that's swell of you. But  . . . I've got another idea.

lines.speaker: u8017
lines.text: Well . . . I see the ocean currents. . . and the rain . . . and mountains and rivers. . . but . . .

lines.speaker: u8023
lines.text: Go on . . .

lines.speaker: u8017
lines.text: But you can't tell where one country begins and another ends. You can't see any borders. It's just . . . one world.

lines.speaker: u8023
lines.text: Good. If you can see it, and I can see it, maybe some day everyone will see it.

lines.speaker: u8021
lines.text: Where's Clark?

lines.speaker: u8018
lines.text: He was getting on . . . and then this man with luggage and . . .  oh, it's a long story.

lines.speaker: u8021
lines.text: It always is with Clark.

lines.speaker: u8019
lines.text: You think he'll find us.

lines.speaker: u8020
lines.text: Never. But we have to hide out for a  while. Lay low. Say. . . a couple of years. By then I'll have a new plan.

lines.speaker: u8019
lines.text: Lucky I brought my drums.

lines.speaker: u8020
lines.text: But . . . but isn't the world about to be osterized?

lines.speaker: u8023
lines.text: No . . . it's the way it always is . . . on the brink . . . with good fighting evil.

lines.speaker: u8025
lines.text: Me?

lines.speaker: u8034
lines.text: Not you.  You.  Tell me again.

lines.speaker: u8033
lines.text: Oh, what a chance! If I could just  --  get to him.

lines.speaker: u8026
lines.text: You're not the only one.

lines.speaker: u8033
lines.text: Yes, but I'm the only one who knows him. I  --  I really like the guy. And he likes me.  I think. I mean, I could talk to him, you know? And he could talk to me.  Anytime...

lines.speaker: u8027
lines.text: Where's mine?! Where's my parachute?

lines.speaker: u8034
lines.text: Miss Teschmacher, Superman is a fairly bright individual. My understanding of the way he works is that he won't be fooled by a simple trick.

lines.speaker: u8027
lines.text: Good. Fine. Now where's my parachute?

lines.speaker: u8034
lines.text: I'm wearing it.

lines.speaker: u8027
lines.text: I mean the other one!

lines.speaker: u8034
lines.text: What other one?

lines.speaker: u8027
lines.text: You can't do this to me!

lines.speaker: u8034
lines.text: Of course I can. I love you.

lines.speaker: u8028
lines.text: Will you abide by the Council's opinion?

lines.speaker: u8031
lines.text: Neither my wife nor I will attempt to leave Krypton.

lines.speaker: u8033
lines.text: Need I ask who's favored to collect at the end of this week.

lines.speaker: u8029
lines.text: On the salary he pays me, I can't make my rent without it.

lines.speaker: u8035
lines.text: Oh, dear. That isn't what I --

lines.speaker: u8030
lines.text: What your mother means, Clark, is that she don't want folks to think you're special.

lines.speaker: u8035
lines.text: I bless the day you came to us, son. You know that. But some people wouldn't understand.

lines.speaker: u8031
lines.text: ....to feel yourself. Very well. You are revealed to the world. But still you must keep your secret identity. First of all, you will need it as an escape valve. You cannot be special twenty-eight hours a day -

lines.speaker: u8038
lines.text: Twenty-four.

lines.speaker: u8031
lines.text: Or twenty-four as it is in Earth time. Furthermore, if you will reveal yourself, your enemies will have a way of getting at you where you are vulnerable: by hurting the people you care for.  Ah, this Earth...this world you live in, Kal-El...  Resist its temptations, its rewards, especially its political system.

lines.speaker: u8038
lines.text: There are none of them any good anyway.

lines.speaker: u8031
lines.text: And it is forbidden for you to interfere with human history. All you can do, Kal-El, even now that you have...found yourself...is help them to evolve. Set an example. Show them they must strive towards the light. And... remember us...

lines.speaker: u8033
lines.text: Can you actually fly faster than the speed of sound?

lines.speaker: u8038
lines.text: Sure.

lines.speaker: u8033
lines.text: Do you like pink?

lines.speaker: u8038
lines.text: Very much.

lines.speaker: u8033
lines.text: Where do you hail from?

lines.speaker: u8038
lines.text: Well, I was born on a planet your scientists don't know too much about. It's in the Xeno Galaxy. Or it was. It was called Krypton. That's K-R-Y-P...

lines.speaker: u8034
lines.text: Now who's the dreamer, Superman? Even you can't fly that fast!

lines.speaker: u8038
lines.text: We'll see how fast I can fly.

lines.speaker: u8039
lines.text: Well, it was nice meeting you again, Mr. Stephens.

lines.speaker: u8045
lines.text: Mitchell.  It was nice to see you again, Ally.

lines.speaker: u8039
lines.text: Alison.

lines.speaker: u8045
lines.text: Alison.

lines.speaker: u8039
lines.text: Say hi to Zoe.

lines.speaker: u8045
lines.text: I will.

lines.speaker: u8039
lines.text: I hope she gets better.

lines.speaker: u8045
lines.text: I'll tell her that.

lines.speaker: u8048
lines.text: Is it true that you gave Nicole one of Lydia's dresses?  That she was wearing it when the bus crashed?

lines.speaker: u8040
lines.text: Yes.

lines.speaker: u8048
lines.text: Why did you do that, Billy?

lines.speaker: u8040
lines.text: You think that caused the accident, Risa?  That it brought bad luck? Christ, it sounds to me you're looking for a witch doctor, not a lawyer.  Or maybe they're the same thing.

lines.speaker: u8052
lines.text: It's for the school bazaar.

lines.speaker: u8041
lines.text: Oh, it's bizarre alright.  C'mon Bear.  Let's get you out of here.

lines.speaker: u8052
lines.text: Away from your crazy Mom.

lines.speaker: u8041
lines.text: The Ottos always waited for the bus with Bear.  They were the only parents who did that, together like that.  I guess they're what you might call hippies.

lines.text: I didn't ask if you wanted milk.

lines.speaker: u8045
lines.text: No.  A little sugar though.

lines.speaker: u8042
lines.text: We've only got honey.

lines.speaker: u8045

lines.text: Hey, Billy!  What brings you out on a night like this?  C'mon in.  Take a load off.
