lines.speaker: u8046
lines.text: That's right.

lines.speaker: u8044
lines.text: Well, if he knew magic - if he could get the kids into the mountain - why couldn't he use his pipe to make the people pay him for getting rid of the rats?

lines.speaker: u8046
lines.text: Because...he wanted to them to be punished.

lines.speaker: u8044
lines.text: The people in the town?

lines.speaker: u8046
lines.text: Yes.

lines.speaker: u8044
lines.text: So he was mean?

lines.speaker: u8046
lines.text: No.  Not mean.  Just...very angry.

lines.speaker: u8044
lines.text: Oh.

lines.speaker: u8046
lines.text: Should I keep reading?

lines.speaker: u8044
lines.text: Okay.

lines.speaker: u8053
lines.text: Been drinking since high school. Fucked himself up.  Used to be smart enough.

lines.speaker: u8045
lines.text: Any criminal record?

lines.speaker: u8053
lines.text: Probably half a dozen traffic convictions.  Drunk driving.  Lost his licence.  That's why he don't work no more.

lines.speaker: u8053
lines.text: Can't get off that shitty dump they live on.  What little money comes in goes to booze.

lines.speaker: u8045
lines.text: How does the family survive?

lines.speaker: u8053
lines.text: Don't know.  Food banks, welfare, church charity.  They scrape by.

lines.speaker: u8046
lines.text: What's going to happen to Dolores?

lines.speaker: u8049
lines.text: I don't know.

lines.speaker: u8046
lines.text: Will the police do anything to her?

lines.speaker: u8049
lines.text: It's too late for that.  She can't drive the bus anymore.  The school board saw to that right off.

lines.speaker: u8046
lines.text: She'll move away.

lines.speaker: u8049
lines.text: There's talk of that.

lines.speaker: u8046
lines.text: Someplace where no one knows her.  Someplace strange and new.

lines.speaker: u8053
lines.text: Yeah, well, they probably smoke weed.

lines.speaker: u8048
lines.text: You don't know that.

lines.speaker: u8070
lines.text: Where are we running?  What am I missing here?

lines.speaker: u8055
lines.text: Waiter, the check.  This man is trying to hold a gun to my head!

lines.speaker: u8070
lines.text: That's the horse!  Shotgun - Shotgun in the fifth!

lines.speaker: u8056
lines.text: He's somewhere...

lines.speaker: u8065
lines.text: Thanks, I see him...

lines.speaker: u8057
lines.text: ...People catch on quick to such an item.  Van Cleve already called me - he's firing the quintet.

lines.speaker: u8065
lines.text: Then what are you doing here?  Go over there and fight!  If Van Cleve fires your boy, it gives a lie the ring of truth!

lines.speaker: u8065
lines.text: Blessings on thee, the both...well... Gotta run now.  See you two kids later!

lines.speaker: u8058
lines.text: Hurry back.

lines.speaker: u8065
lines.text: Listen with care - this will cost me everything, so you know I'm telling you the truth!

lines.speaker: u8059
lines.text: You're incapable of the truth...

lines.speaker: u8065
lines.text: Susie, there's nothing wrong with Dallas!  Your brother and I arranged it all. And if the Leslie boy is still a squooshy item in your life, forget it! - your brother arranged that one, too!  I don't usually give away presents; but this is my gift to you: Get out of here!  Leave this man!

lines.speaker: u8065
lines.text: I thought he would.

lines.speaker: u8060
lines.text: Yeah...  And another thing - he's gonna say you 'resisted arrest'...  You know J.J....!

lines.speaker: u8065
lines.text: What's your favorite ribbon to go around your favorite chocolates?

lines.speaker: u8061
lines.text: Let's wait till Christmas - it's more legitimate then.

lines.speaker: u8062
lines.text: A girl needs a little romancing before she -

lines.speaker: u8065
lines.text: Next time I'll call in a guy to paint silver stars on the ceiling!

lines.speaker: u8062
lines.text: What would you think of me if -

lines.speaker: u8065
lines.text: Nothing I didn't think of you before.

lines.speaker: u8062
lines.text: - that's what I mean!

lines.speaker: u8063
lines.text: I swear, Sidney, I can't help it - sometimes I wonder what I see in you...

lines.speaker: u8065
lines.text: That's no way to talk...

lines.speaker: u8063
lines.text: Or what you see in me, for that matter...

lines.speaker: u8065
lines.text: Stay down town tonight.  Maybe we'll take in a show, etc.

lines.speaker: u8063
lines.text: If you want me to -

lines.speaker: u8065
lines.text: No more you don't!  What is this - You're showing off for her?  They're supposed to hear you in Korea?

lines.speaker: u8069
lines.text: He's intuitive - he knows he's getting fired!

lines.speaker: u8065
lines.text: If you're funny, James, I'm a pretzel!  Drop dead!

lines.speaker: u8067
lines.text: Steve, I feel exhausted...what do you want me to do?

lines.speaker: u8066
lines.text: Not what you're doing now.  At least don't ask me - don't ask him. You're fighting for your life! What do YOU want to do?

lines.speaker: u8067
lines.text: You are saying goodbye, aren't you...?

lines.speaker: u8071
lines.text: No good.

lines.speaker: u8077
lines.text: Let me try mine.

lines.speaker: u8074
lines.text: John, get out of the way!!

lines.speaker: u8072
lines.text: SHOOT!!!!

lines.speaker: u8074
lines.text: Kyle, don't go!

lines.speaker: u8073
lines.text: There's not much time left in the world, Sarah.

lines.speaker: u8074
lines.text: Are you afraid?

lines.speaker: u8077
lines.text: Yes.

lines.speaker: u8079
lines.text: It's not just a dream.  It's real, you moron! I know the date is happens!!

lines.speaker: u8080
lines.text: I'm sure it feels very real to you --

lines.speaker: u8079
lines.text: On August 29th 1997 it's going to feel pretty fucking real to you, too!  Anybody not wearing number two million sunblock in gonna have a real bad day, get it?

lines.speaker: u8080
lines.text: Relax now, Sarah --

lines.speaker: u8079
lines.text: You think you're alive and safe, but you're already dead.  Everybody, you, him...  everybody... you're all fucking dead!

lines.speaker: u8081
lines.text: Can I ask you a favour, Major?

lines.speaker: u8088
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.speaker: u8081
lines.text: When you question him again, could you treat him with more respect?

lines.speaker: u8088
lines.text: With more what? More what?

lines.speaker: u8081
lines.text: Major, he may just be the greatest conductor of this century and that merits respect.

lines.speaker: u8088
lines.text: David, I don't understand a thing about you. You're a Jew. Are you a Jew?

lines.speaker: u8081
lines.text: Yes, I'm a Jew. But I like to think first I'm a human being.

lines.speaker: u8088
lines.text: A human being, oh, good, I'm relieved, I thought you were going to say you were a music lover. This man, this great artist has made anti-Semitic remarks like you wouldn't believe. I got letters.

lines.speaker: u8081
lines.text: Major, show me someone who hasn't made an anti-Semitic remark and I'll show you the gates of paradise.

lines.speaker: u8088
lines.text: What is it with you, David? Where are your feelings? Where's your hatred, your disgust? Where's your fucking outrage, David?

lines.speaker: u8088
lines.text: I'm gonna get that fucking bandleader, Colonel. No deal. No fucking deal.

lines.speaker: u8082
lines.text: Then you're going to kill me.

lines.speaker: u8083
lines.text: I'm sorry but I have to leave. I'll find other work. You'll have to get someone else, that's all.

lines.speaker: u8088
lines.text: What is this, Emmi?

lines.speaker: u8083
lines.text: I can't do this. It's not right.

lines.speaker: u8088
lines.text: What's not right?

lines.speaker: u8083
lines.text: I have been questioned by the Gestapo just like that. Just like you questioned him.

lines.speaker: u8088
lines.text: Emmi, stop! I want to show you something. Let me show you something and then if you want to leave, you can leave, please please. His friends, they did this. And he gave them birthday concerts.

lines.speaker: u8083
lines.text: But he had no idea, a lot of people had no idea. I only realised what was really going on when I got arrested.

lines.speaker: u8088
lines.text: If he had no idea, why did the Jews need saving? This is the question, Emmi, to all Germans: Why did the Jews need saving in this country? Why, if people had no idea?

lines.speaker: u8083
lines.text: I would like to go now, please.

lines.speaker: u8088
lines.text: Have you ever smelled burning flesh? I smelt it four miles away. Four miles away, I smelt it. Have you ever seen the gas chambers, the crematoria? Have you seen the mounds of rotting corpses? You talk to me about culture, art and music? You putting that in the scales, Wilhelm? You setting culture, art and music against the millions put to death by your pals? They had orchestras in the camps. They played Beethoven, Wagner. The hangmen were playing chamber music at home with their families. I don't understand the Germans' relationship with music. What do you need music for? Your pals you could call to save a few Jews when millions of them were being annihilated? Yes, I blame you for not getting hanged, I blame you for your cowardice. You strutted and swaggered, you fucking piece of shit, king-pin in a shithouse. You talk to me about walking a tightrope between exile and the gallows, and I say to you, lies!

lines.speaker: u8084
lines.text: I love my country, I believe in music, what was I to do?

lines.speaker: u8088
lines.text: Look around you. See the country you served. Look at people who had real courage, who took risks, who risked their lives. Like Emmi's father.

lines.speaker: u8086
lines.text: And ask him about his private life.

lines.speaker: u8088
lines.text: His private life?

lines.speaker: u8088
lines.text: You ever seen Adolf Hitler's eyes when he was making a speech? I've seen 'em on films.

lines.speaker: u8087
lines.text: Yes.

lines.speaker: u8088
lines.text: Was looking at Furtwngler like that?

lines.speaker: u8087
lines.text: I don't know what you mean, Major.

lines.speaker: u8088
lines.text: When you got to the crescendo.

lines.speaker: u8090
lines.text: Dr. Furtwngler is a great musician. He actively opposed the Nazis and later on he helped many Jews to escape.

lines.speaker: u8088
lines.text: Then how do you explain him being made a Prussian Privy Councillor?

lines.speaker: u8090
lines.text: It was Hermann Goering. I was told he just made the maestro his Privy Councillor, no questions asked. Although Dr. Furtwngler stood up to him. And to Dr. Goebbels.

lines.speaker: u8088
lines.text: He also conducted for Hitler, didn't he?

lines.speaker: u8090
lines.text: Yes, that's true, but he refused to give the Nazi salute. He kept his baton in his right hand. In Hitler's presence. That was a brave act...

lines.speaker: u8088
lines.text: Brave?  To celebrate Hitler's birthday with some heroic piece by Wagner but without the Nazi salute? Bravo.

lines.speaker: u8090
lines.text: It was Beethoven's Ninth.

lines.speaker: u8088
lines.text: Do you really think it was brave? Didn't he bow to him and shake his hand?

lines.speaker: u8091
lines.text: Here you go.  You're a Bob's Girl now.  Nancy will check you out.

lines.speaker: u8096
lines.text: I won't let the fat kid down.

lines.speaker: u8092
lines.text: You can't to that...

lines.speaker: u8098
lines.text: Wrong.

lines.speaker: u8096
lines.text: I'm going to a movie, kiddo. See ya'.  You and Matt have a good time.

lines.speaker: u8093
lines.text: We will, kiddo.

lines.speaker: u8094
lines.text: Compared to me she is.  How come you're not at the cash anymore?  They catch ya steal- ing?

lines.speaker: u8096
lines.text: What's it to ya?

lines.speaker: u8097
lines.text: I can help you...

lines.speaker: u8095
lines.text: Who is in authority here?

lines.speaker: u8100
lines.text: Why don't you just stretch out here and get some sleep.  It'll take your mom a good hour to get here from Redlands.

lines.speaker: u8096
lines.text: I can't sleep.

lines.speaker: u8100
lines.text: Go ahead.  You're safe.  There're thirty cops in this building.

lines.speaker: u8096
lines.text: Okay.

lines.speaker: u8099
lines.text: That Silberman just crack me up.  He had this guy in here last week who set his Afghan on fire. Screwed it first, then set it on--

lines.speaker: u8100
lines.text: Shut up.

lines.speaker: u8101
lines.text: Are you finished?

lines.speaker: u8114
lines.text: No.  This is my lawyer, Samuel Sutherland.  I thought you two should meet.

lines.speaker: u8101
lines.text: We met, this morning.  I signed the termination contract for Baer/Grace. I accepted your settlement, Nicholas. you were right.  I'm going sailing.

lines.speaker: u8114
lines.text: Did you play recently?

lines.speaker: u8102
lines.text: Hm?  No, about a year ago.  I was working out of Los Angeles.

lines.speaker: u8114
lines.text: I've heard good things about their London branch.  You have to admit, it sounds like some fantasy, role-playing nonsense.

lines.speaker: u8102
lines.text: You want to know what it is?  What it's all about?  John.  Chapter nine.  Verse twenty-five.

lines.speaker: u8114
lines.text: I, uh... haven't been to Sunday school in years...

lines.speaker: u8102
lines.text: "Whereas once I was blind, now I can see."  Night, Nick.  Best of luck.

lines.speaker: u8103
lines.text: I have to get to the airport...

lines.speaker: u8114
lines.text: Where are you going in such a hurry?

lines.speaker: u8103
lines.text: There's another gig starting in Saudi Arabia.  I'm just a walk-on this time though.  Bit-part.

lines.speaker: u8114
lines.text: What about dinner sometime, when you get back?  Would that be... ?

lines.speaker: u8103
lines.text: Is this something you're interested in?  I'm not really that person I was.

lines.speaker: u8114
lines.text: I realize.  Maybe you could... tell me a little about yourself.

lines.speaker: u8103
lines.text: Like what... my favorite color... ?

lines.speaker: u8114
lines.text: Like... where are you from?

lines.speaker: u8103
lines.text: Originally, Connecticut.

lines.speaker: u8114
lines.text: Big family... small?

lines.speaker: u8103
lines.text: One brother, one sister.

lines.speaker: u8114
lines.text: Studied acting, I assume?

lines.speaker: u8103
lines.text: Julliard, yeah.

lines.speaker: u8114
lines.text: Single?

lines.speaker: u8103
lines.text: Yes.

lines.speaker: u8114
lines.text: Boyfriend?

lines.speaker: u8103
lines.text: No.

lines.speaker: u8114
lines.text: Underwear?

lines.speaker: u8103
lines.text: Always.

lines.speaker: u8114
lines.text: Really?

lines.speaker: u8104
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.speaker: u8114
lines.text: Split it?

lines.speaker: u8104
lines.text: Oh, God yes please.  Thanks, man. I'll take you up on that.

lines.speaker: u8114
lines.text: Where's Christine?  The waitress.

lines.speaker: u8104
lines.text: Yeah, yeah.  She called a cab. Said something about catching a plane.

lines.speaker: u8114
lines.text: Did she?

lines.speaker: u8105
lines.text: How much is it?  A few thousand, at least.  A Rolex like that... lucky for you they missed it.

lines.speaker: u8114
lines.text: Yes, very lucky.

lines.speaker: u8106
lines.text: We have to head out... just wanted to say goodbye.

lines.speaker: u8114
lines.text: You're going?  Well, thanks again.  Good to see you, Rachel...  Thanks for coming, Mel.  I'll get your car back.  Right now it's, uh... at the zoo.  Sorry.

lines.speaker: u8106
lines.text: Happy Birthday, Nicholas.

lines.speaker: u8114
lines.text: I'll call.  I really will.

lines.speaker: u8106
lines.text: I know.

lines.speaker: u8114
lines.text: Where?

lines.speaker: u8107
lines.text: I told you, they hired me over the phone.  I never met anyone.

lines.speaker: u8114
lines.text: Where'd you pick up your checks?

lines.speaker: u8107
lines.text: It was a different floor then...

lines.speaker: u8114
lines.text: Guess!

lines.speaker: u8107
lines.text: Like, this way... sort of...

lines.speaker: u8108
lines.text: Isn't this what you like?  They told me you had a thing for boats.

lines.speaker: u8114
lines.text: First they try to kill me, now you?  Put your damn clothes back on.

lines.speaker: u8109
lines.text: Show Mr. Van Orton to his room.

lines.speaker: u8114
lines.text: The key?

lines.speaker: u8109
lines.text: Hm?

lines.speaker: u8114
lines.text: Is there a room key?

lines.speaker: u8109
lines.text: Didn't I give you two?

lines.speaker: u8114
lines.text: No, you didn't...

lines.speaker: u8110
lines.text: Goodnight.  See you home.

lines.speaker: u8114
lines.text: Goodnight.  Where was she?

lines.speaker: u8112
lines.text: There were complaints by other guests, and damage to his room.  We did the best we could to accommodate his behavior.

lines.speaker: u8114
lines.text: His behavior... ?

lines.speaker: u8112
lines.text: He couldn't, or refused to pay.  We extended credit...

lines.speaker: u8114
lines.text: Look, where is he?!

lines.speaker: u8112
lines.text: There was an incident a few days ago... a nervous breakdown, they said.  The police took him.  They left this address, in case anyone...

lines.speaker: u8114
lines.text: "Under the Bleachers"... by Seymour Butts.

lines.speaker: u8113
lines.text: Pardon me?  I'm afraid I don't...

lines.speaker: u8114
lines.text: Cancel lunch.  Make reservations at Campton Place for me and Mr. Butts.

lines.speaker: u8116
lines.text: Bravo, young man.  you have to tell me what this was all about sometime.  I want you to know... when it looked there for awhile like you were going slowly insane... I was fully prepared to have you committed to the <u>finest</u> mental-health facility available.  I mean that sincerely, don't thank me.

lines.speaker: u8114
lines.text: You warm my heart.

lines.speaker: u8124
lines.text: Nell!

lines.speaker: u8117
lines.text: We can't stay here looking for her.  She doesn't want to be found...

lines.speaker: u8118
lines.text: Why are you working with her? Mary Lambretta was thrown out of the department for trying to get a Ph.D. in psychic studies.

lines.speaker: u8119
lines.text: And after she was thrown out, she needed a job.

lines.speaker: u8118
lines.text: You don't believe in the paranormal.

lines.speaker: u8119
lines.text: No, but she does, and that's all that matters.

lines.speaker: u8118
lines.text: Does she know that's why you're using her?

lines.speaker: u8119
lines.text: No.

lines.speaker: u8118
lines.text: I, I just can't...

lines.speaker: u8119
lines.text: She needed a job, Malcolm.  And she's smart.  And she helps me.

lines.speaker: u8118
lines.text: I have a bad feeling about what you're doing.

lines.speaker: u8119
lines.text: This is the last chapter.  Please, please give me clearance.  It's for science.

lines.speaker: u8124
lines.text: I'm not going back to New York City.  I'm going to find an apartment with a little flower garden, where you can just see the ocean and at night, when the wind comes in just right, you can hear the sound of the harbor.  What about you?

lines.speaker: u8119
lines.text: I'm a scientist.  I just conducted an experiment.  Now I have to write it up.

lines.speaker: u8124
lines.text: But the experiment was a failure.

lines.speaker: u8123
lines.text: Why?

lines.speaker: u8121
lines.text: Why'd she kill herself?

lines.speaker: u8123
lines.text: Yes.

lines.speaker: u8121
lines.text: She was unhappy.

lines.speaker: u8123
lines.text: Why?

lines.speaker: u8121
lines.text: Can't say.  Haven't been here that long.  Well, it's Labor Day, gotta get to work.

lines.speaker: u8122
lines.text: No one could.  No one lives any nearer than town.

lines.speaker: u8123
lines.text: No one will come any nearer than that.

lines.speaker: u8123
lines.text: Oh, Theo.  You know I don't have an apartment.

lines.speaker: u8124
lines.text: Then let's go get you one.

lines.speaker: u8141
lines.text: No.

lines.speaker: u8126
lines.text: Why not?

lines.speaker: u8141
lines.text: Because --

lines.speaker: u8141
lines.text: Where do <u>you</u> think he is, Mike.

lines.speaker: u8127
lines.text: We'll find him.

lines.speaker: u8141
lines.text: No.  I mean.  Not even your people should be involved.  Right?  It's too close now.

lines.speaker: u8127
lines.text: You could use a few of my prime shitkickers up here.

lines.speaker: u8141
lines.text: You think I'm staying?

lines.speaker: u8127
lines.text: There's already gonna be talk about how people close to you keep falling into canyons.

lines.speaker: u8141
lines.text: Well, can we make it one more.  Nowhere the fuck near me.

lines.speaker: u8128
lines.text: You broke last time.

lines.speaker: u8137
lines.text: Let him break - he likes to break.

lines.speaker: u8128
lines.text: Fuck you.

lines.speaker: u8137
lines.text: I wouldn't talk.

lines.speaker: u8128
lines.text: Huh?

lines.speaker: u8137
lines.text: I saw your mother on the Strip last night.  She went up to three guys, said she'd like 'em to stick one in each, know what I mean?

lines.speaker: u8130
lines.text: CQ what?

lines.speaker: u8129
lines.text: Close Quarters Combat.  Keep one in my own home.

lines.speaker: u8130
lines.text: I thought maybe you just came for the ride.

lines.speaker: u8131
lines.text: I'd rather be with him than without him. I don't want to be found dead in L.A.

lines.speaker: u8131
lines.text: You're just on a higher plane, Wilson.

lines.speaker: u8142
lines.text: Too bleeding true, 'n' it.

lines.speaker: u8132
lines.text: There's one thing I don't understand.  The thing I don't understand ... is every motherfucking thing you're saying.

lines.speaker: u8142
lines.text: Look, mush, you're the guv'nor here, I can see that, I'm on your manor now, right.  So there's no need to get out of your pram.  I'm Johnny-come-lately to all this.  Whatever the bollocks between you and this slag Valentine, it's got nothing to do with me.  I don't wanna know.

lines.speaker: u8132
lines.text: Well, I'll tell you.  I believe this Valentine screwed me out of a fair sum of money.

lines.speaker: u8142
lines.text: I can well believe it.  I'm sure he has done, son.  He's about as straight as a dog's hind leg.

lines.speaker: u8132
lines.text: But I can't be sure.  I don't even know who he is.  He's too insulated.  Too many layers around him.

lines.speaker: u8142
lines.text: Your guess is as good as mine, mate.  I'm here on another matter entirely.

lines.speaker: u8132
lines.text: Yeah, I guess you are.

lines.speaker: u8142
lines.text: Good job your lot showed up when they did or it would've been <u>me</u> for the high jump.

lines.speaker: u8132
lines.text: That dude who works for Valentine.  He's the one sent those guys after you.  You know that.

lines.speaker: u8142
lines.text: Yeah.  Shouldn't wonder.  Must've done.

lines.speaker: u8132
lines.text: So what's your beef, pal?

lines.speaker: u8142
lines.text: Nothing financial.  Strictly personal.  I can see how all this import-export malarkey might give rise to confusion where I'm concerned.  A foreigner, showing up unexpectedly, like.

lines.speaker: u8132
lines.text: It was you.  Downtown.

lines.speaker: u8142
lines.text: Eh?

lines.speaker: u8132
lines.text: Because that wasn't anything to do with me.  And suspicion has been cast in my direction.  Didn't make any sense.  Choosing those shitheads over me, cutting me out of the deal, then screwing them over too.

lines.speaker: u8142
lines.text: No, I can reassure you on that point. Valentine was just as surprised by that turn of events as you.

lines.speaker: u8132
lines.text: He'd already grabbed more than his allotted cut.  Didn't think he'd be so bold as to take all of it.

lines.speaker: u8142
lines.text: All of what?

lines.speaker: u8132
lines.text: Of the deal, man.

lines.speaker: u8142
lines.text: Oh, yeah, right.  The deal.

lines.speaker: u8132
lines.text: But if you're mad at him too and he's mad at you ... that must make us pals.

lines.speaker: u8142
lines.text: As you prefer, squire.  As you prefer.

lines.speaker: u8132
lines.text: In which case I'll just do what I usually do.

lines.speaker: u8142
lines.text: And that is?

lines.speaker: u8132
lines.text: What am I doing?

lines.speaker: u8134
lines.text: Valentine had himself a party, I hear.

lines.speaker: u8133
lines.text: My client has already given a statement regarding yesterday's events.

lines.speaker: u8134
lines.text: A <u>statement</u>?  I wouldn't mind getting a statement.  You see, <u>my</u> client -- the United States Government -- would love to get a statement about a few of the deals going down with your client.

lines.speaker: u8133
lines.text: Deals?  My client is involved in any number of deals at any given moment. You'd have to be more specific.

lines.speaker: u8134
lines.text: Your client have a deal in Long Beach? How about downtown?  There's some folks there -- oh, wait, they're all dead.  Any of this ring a bell?

lines.speaker: u8133
lines.text: My client is an entrepreneur.  I am his lawyer, not his business manager.

lines.speaker: u8134
lines.text: So you wouldn't have any idea how your client continues to make so much fucking money.

lines.speaker: u8133
lines.text: He's always been very forward-thinking. He invested wisely.

lines.speaker: u8134
lines.text: Where is he now?

lines.speaker: u8133
lines.text: He had urgent business in the north.

lines.speaker: u8135
lines.text: Don't you work with Ian?

lines.speaker: u8142
lines.text: Ian?

lines.speaker: u8135
lines.text: I could swear I met you with Ian at the EMI offices in London.

lines.speaker: u8142
lines.text: Sorry.  Wasn't me.

lines.speaker: u8135
lines.text: You sure?

lines.speaker: u8142
lines.text: Unless I'm not who I think I am.

lines.speaker: u8135
lines.text: That's too bad.  Ian's got a good thing going over there.

lines.speaker: u8142
lines.text: Yeah?

lines.speaker: u8135
lines.text: Turned that place completely around.  180 degrees.

lines.speaker: u8142
lines.text: No kidding.

lines.speaker: u8135
lines.text: What I like about Ian, he believes in a chain of command, but not a chain of respect, you understand what I'm saying?

lines.speaker: u8142
lines.text: Right.  Chain of respect.  That's good, that.

lines.speaker: u8135
lines.text: Yeah.  I really admire the guy.  Well. Good to meet you.

lines.speaker: u8142
lines.text: Yeah.  Cheers, mate.

lines.speaker: u8142
lines.text: But first I gotta give these lads a talking to, these geezers what sent me up the river, in a manner of speaking.

lines.speaker: u8136
lines.text: The ones whose burden you took upon your own shoulders.

lines.speaker: u8142
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.speaker: u8140
lines.text: We coulda used the other two-and-a-half grand.

lines.speaker: u8137
lines.text: There's more than a measly few grand in this.

lines.speaker: u8140
lines.text: There is?

lines.speaker: u8137
lines.text: Something's on.

lines.speaker: u8140
lines.text: What?

lines.speaker: u8137
lines.text: I happen to know more about Mr. Whatever- his-name-is than he thinks I know about him and his operation.

lines.speaker: u8140
lines.text: You do?

lines.speaker: u8137
lines.text: You bet.

lines.speaker: u8140
lines.text: Like what.

lines.speaker: u8137
lines.text: Like he'd never hire me for real.  Not week-to-week.  I don't have the credentials.  He thinks I'm just a sociopath, someone he can turn to when he needs "plausible denial."

lines.speaker: u8140
lines.text: Well, we blew it, didn't we?  He ain't wrong.

lines.speaker: u8137
lines.text: "He ain't wrong."  Listen, I know this asshole who <u>did</u> just go to work for him. Full-time.  And this dickhead's parents just told me he took a road trip up the coast.  <u>That's</u> the type of individual gets hired, someone who'll shoot his mouth off to his family while on the job.

lines.speaker: u8140
lines.text: I don't get it.

lines.speaker: u8137
lines.text: I don't know who that English guy is. Some kind of --  -- courier or something.  Maybe a seller. Maybe a buyer.  But Mr. <u>Avery</u> wanted him, those jigs wanted him -- and I betcha there's a briefcase somewhere.

lines.speaker: u8140
lines.text: What's in it?

lines.speaker: u8137
lines.text: Drugs?  Cash?  Both if we're lucky.

lines.speaker: u8140
lines.text: How we gonna get that lucky?

lines.speaker: u8137
lines.text: While they're all fucking each other over ... couple of parties like us could move right in.

lines.speaker: u8142
lines.text: Where is he, then?

lines.speaker: u8138
lines.text: Listen, get the fuck out of here before you get hurt.  Who the fuck do you think you are, waltzing in here, asking questions?

lines.speaker: u8139
lines.text: It's been five minutes and I'm packing to leave again.  I can't believe this.

lines.speaker: u8141
lines.text: That's right, your life is Shit, and I'm to blame.  It's that simple.

lines.speaker: u8141
lines.text: She could've had the deal!  I would've handed it to her if she wanted.  I would have given her everything.

lines.speaker: u8142
lines.text: <u>Why</u> then.  Why did you do it!

lines.speaker: u8150
lines.text: ...Yes?

lines.speaker: u8143
lines.text: At night, there were lights--we both saw them. We never told anyone, outside of our official report.

lines.speaker: u8150
lines.text: Ann--

lines.speaker: u8143
lines.text: A spacecraft. I saw the creatures. They led Big Dave onto the craft. He never told anyone what they did, outside of his report. Of course he told *me*. No one else.

lines.speaker: u8150
lines.text: Ann--

lines.speaker: u8143
lines.text: The government knows. I cannot repeat it to you. But this thing goes deep, Ed. This was not your wife. I goes deep, and involves the government. There is a great deal of fear. You know how certain circles would find it--the knowledge--a threat. They try to limit it, and--

lines.speaker: u8150
lines.text: Ann, will you come in, sit down, maybe have a drink?

lines.speaker: u8143
lines.text: Sometimes knowledge is a curse, Ed. After this happened, things changed. Big Dave... he never touched me again.

lines.speaker: u8150
lines.text: ...No, please.

lines.speaker: u8144
lines.text: Please, Mr Crane, it's OK, please--

lines.speaker: u8145
lines.text: ...she can go up there.

lines.speaker: u8150
lines.text: Well, look, I don't claim to be an expert--

lines.speaker: u8145
lines.text: Then you listen to me, for I am expert. That girl, she give me a headache. She cannot play. Nice girl. Very clever hands. Nice girl. Someday, I think, maybe, she make a very good typist.

lines.speaker: u8150
lines.text: ...You're not gonna screw me on this?

lines.speaker: u8146
lines.text: *Screw* you--Jesus! Take it to a lawyer! No, I insist! This is *dry* cleaning, this is not some fly-by- night thing here! I must say, I've been an entrepreneur for thirteen years and I've never--

lines.speaker: u8150
lines.text: All right.

lines.speaker: u8146
lines.text: And I've never been asked--Look, you want the dough back? You know who I am! You--

lines.speaker: u8150
lines.text: OK.

lines.speaker: u8147
lines.text: ...What kind of man *are* you?

lines.speaker: u8150
lines.text: ...Huh?

lines.speaker: u8147
lines.text: What kind of man *are* you?

lines.speaker: u8150
lines.text: Big Dave--

lines.speaker: u8147
lines.text: I'd understand if you'd walked in here. Socked me in the nose. Whatever. I deserved it.

lines.speaker: u8150
lines.text: I, uh...

lines.speaker: u8147
lines.text: I'm not proud of what I did. But *you*.

lines.speaker: u8148
lines.text: ...Hell, I hope I've done the right thing.

lines.speaker: u8150
lines.text: My wife and I had not... performed the sex act in many years.

lines.speaker: u8150
lines.text: ...Doris--

lines.speaker: u8149
lines.text: Nah, don't say anything. I'm alright.

lines.speaker: u8150
lines.text: Doesn't bother me.

lines.speaker: u8153
lines.text: Well, have you ever considered tar Macadam? People think it's just for public works and commercial purposes, roads, parking lots, so forth...

lines.speaker: u8151
lines.text: He's a barber.

lines.speaker: u8153
lines.text: Ah.

lines.speaker: u8151
lines.text: Second chair.

lines.speaker: u8153
lines.text: Not an owner.

lines.speaker: u8151
lines.text: No, he's family, he's my brother-in- law.

lines.speaker: u8153
lines.text: Ah-hah. It would be best if he waited here.

lines.speaker: u8152
lines.text: What'd he say? Does he understand?

lines.speaker: u8154
lines.text: He said OK. Is that what he said?

lines.speaker: u8162
lines.text: There's some kind of animal loose in the museum.  Pendergast's alone.  He needs help.  I want volunteers to go with me.

lines.speaker: u8159
lines.text: I'm in.

lines.speaker: u8160
lines.text: Don't know if it'll do any good, Mr. Cuthbert.

lines.speaker: u8161
lines.text: Why not?

lines.speaker: u8160
lines.text: No one broke into this room, sir. Someone broke out.  That lock was torn off from the <u>inside</u>.

lines.speaker: u8167
lines.text: Fifteen... what's next?

lines.speaker: u8161
lines.text: Eight to the right!  Look!  I found it!

lines.speaker: u8168
lines.text: Dear God.  Where are we, Lieutenant?

lines.speaker: u8162
lines.text: I'd say we're in its home.

lines.speaker: u8163
lines.text: Curious.  There's something missing.

lines.speaker: u8171
lines.text: The thalamus and the hypothalamus, perhaps?

lines.speaker: u8163
lines.text: Yes.  Two organs the size of a walnut have been removed with what looks like surgical precision.

lines.speaker: u8171
lines.text: Dr. Frock, I was wondering.  What happened to the rest of Whittlesley's plants?

lines.speaker: u8164
lines.text: They were sent to the Center For Disease Control in Atlanta.

lines.speaker: u8169
lines.text: It had a long tongue, teeth this big and yellow eyes.

lines.speaker: u8165
lines.text: They were green eyes and they were slit like a lizard's.

lines.speaker: u8169
lines.text: They were yellow!

lines.speaker: u8165
lines.text: You're color blind.

lines.speaker: u8167
lines.text: Oh no.  I smell it.

lines.speaker: u8171
lines.text: Keep the animal quiet.

lines.speaker: u8168
lines.text: Got to finish this thesis sometime.

lines.speaker: u8170
lines.text: How about lunch?

lines.speaker: u8168
lines.text: Not today.  Besides, I think the director of the museum is expecting you.

lines.speaker: u8170
lines.text: Okay.

lines.speaker: u8170
lines.text: I'm so glad to see you.  What's the occasion?

lines.speaker: u8171
lines.text: I'm in town on a case.  Dropped by to see Vince and we thought we'd see the new display.

lines.speaker: u8172
lines.text: I'm sorry to keep you.  How can I help?

lines.speaker: u8186
lines.text: I want to book a flight to Fiji.

lines.speaker: u8172
lines.text: Where exactly?

lines.speaker: u8186
lines.text: Fiji.

lines.speaker: u8172
lines.text: Where in Fiji? What island?

lines.speaker: u8186
lines.text: I'm sorry, er...the biggest one.

lines.speaker: u8172
lines.text: Viti Levu.  For how many?

lines.speaker: u8186
lines.text: One.

lines.speaker: u8172
lines.text: When do you want to leave, remembering, of course, you do lose a day on the way there?

lines.speaker: u8186
lines.text: Today.

lines.speaker: u8172
lines.text: I'm sorry.  I don't have anything for at least a month.

lines.speaker: u8186
lines.text: A month.

lines.speaker: u8172
lines.text: It's the busy season.

lines.speaker: u8186
lines.text: You are a travel agent, aren't you?  "Doris"?  Your job is to help people travel.

lines.speaker: u8172
lines.text: I do have a fabulous rate on a cruise ship departing for Fiji tomorrow.  But you wouldn't want to do that.

lines.speaker: u8186
lines.text: Why wouldn't I?

lines.speaker: u8172
lines.text: I thought you were in a hurry.

lines.speaker: u8186
lines.text: That's right.

lines.speaker: u8172
lines.text: You want to book the flight?

lines.speaker: u8186
lines.text: It doesn't matter.  I'll make other arrangements.

lines.speaker: u8186
lines.text: I have a map.

lines.speaker: u8173
lines.text: Truman, I've watched you your whole life. I saw you take your first step, your first word, your first kiss.  I know you better than you know yourself.  You're not going to walk out that door--

lines.speaker: u8186
lines.text: --You never had a camera in my head.

lines.speaker: u8174
lines.text: But why didn't he just follow her to Fiji?

lines.speaker: u8181
lines.text: Because his mother got sick - very sick.  He couldn't leave her.  He's a kind boy, maybe too kind.

lines.speaker: u8174
lines.text: I can't believe he married Meryl on the rebound.

lines.speaker: u8175
lines.text: How can they have a child?

lines.speaker: u8176
lines.text: It's not gonna be his, you idiot.

lines.speaker: u8175
lines.text: Why not?

lines.speaker: u8176
lines.text: You think she'd go through with it?

lines.speaker: u8175
lines.text: Sure she would.

lines.speaker: u8176
lines.text: Guess I always thought they'd adopt.

lines.speaker: u8178
lines.text: It's beautiful!  What are you waiting for?

lines.speaker: u8186
lines.text: I...I can't.

lines.speaker: u8179
lines.text: And the last thing I'd ever do is lie to you. Think about it, Truman, if everybody's in on it, I'd have to be in on it too. I'm not in on it, because there is no it.

lines.speaker: u8186
lines.text: So what are you saying, Marlon, the whole thing has been in my head--?

lines.speaker: u8179
lines.text: Not the whole thing, Truman.  You were right about one thing.

lines.speaker: u8186
lines.text: What's that?

lines.speaker: u8179
lines.text: The thing that started all of this.

lines.speaker: u8186
lines.text: --What are my plans now? Well, next I'm thinking of tackling the Yuba River in an authentic canoe from the Algonquin tribe. --I'm talking about the north fork, a class five rapid - only I'm not going down the Yuba, I'm going up. Do you honestly think for one minute I'd go back to some dreary office to rubber stamp meaningless documents...do you?

lines.speaker: u8180
lines.text: --Truman, you're gonna be late!

lines.speaker: u8186
lines.text: We ought to be getting you back, Mother.

lines.speaker: u8181
lines.text: Hold on a minute, dear.  Here's us at Mount Rushmore.  You remember, Truman--when Dad was still with us - that was quite a drive.  You slept all the way there.

lines.speaker: u8186
lines.text: It looks so small.

lines.speaker: u8181
lines.text: Things always do--when you look back.

lines.speaker: u8186
lines.text: I'm looking for my wife--Nurse Burbank. It's important.

lines.speaker: u8182
lines.text: I'm afraid that's impossible--she's in pre-op.

lines.speaker: u8186
lines.text: Sure.  Okay.  Fine.  Can you pass on a message?

lines.speaker: u8182
lines.text: I'll try.

lines.speaker: u8186
lines.text: Tell her, tell her...I had to go to Fiji. I'll call her when I get there.

lines.speaker: u8182
lines.text: When you get to Fiji?

lines.speaker: u8186
lines.text: You got it.

lines.speaker: u8182
lines.text: Fine.  I'll tell her.

lines.speaker: u8186
lines.text: Now what?

lines.speaker: u8183
lines.text: Leak at the plant.  They had to shut her down.

lines.speaker: u8186
lines.text: Is there any way around?

lines.speaker: u8183
lines.text: The whole area's being evacuated.

lines.speaker: u8186
lines.text: Well, thank you for your help.

lines.speaker: u8183
lines.text: You're welcome, Truman.

lines.speaker: u8185
lines.text: They're coming.  Any minute.

lines.speaker: u8186
lines.text: Who?

lines.speaker: u8185
lines.text: They're going to stop me talking to you.

lines.speaker: u8186
lines.text: There's no one here.

lines.speaker: u8185
lines.text: Just listen.  You remember when you were a little boy, you stood up in class and said you wanted to be an explorer like Magellan--

lines.speaker: u8186
lines.text: --How do you know about that?

lines.speaker: u8185
lines.text: --And your teacher said, "You're too late, Truman.  There's nothing left to explore."

lines.speaker: u8186
lines.text: Were you there--how do you know?

lines.speaker: u8185
lines.text: --It doesn't matter.  Everybody knows about it.  They know everything you do. The point is, you got scared.

lines.speaker: u8186
lines.text: I don't understand.

lines.speaker: u8185
lines.text: You must listen.  Everybody's pretending, Truman.

lines.speaker: u8187
lines.text: See you tomorrow, Truman.

lines.speaker: u8186
lines.text: You can count on it.

lines.speaker: u8198
lines.text: I think you better tell us.

lines.speaker: u8188
lines.text: We don't even know you.

lines.speaker: u8198
lines.text: Well, we're FBI agents.

lines.speaker: u8188
lines.text: You're not FBI agents.

lines.speaker: u8189
lines.text: I think that about does it, Spooky.

lines.speaker: u8197
lines.text: Does what?

lines.speaker: u8189
lines.text: Why don't you go home to the old lady --

lines.speaker: u8197
lines.text: Sorry. Don't have one.

lines.speaker: u8197
lines.text: I need your clothes, Byers.

lines.speaker: u8190
lines.text: Me?

lines.speaker: u8198
lines.text: What is it you find incredible?

lines.speaker: u8191
lines.text: Well...where would you like me to start? Antarctica is a long way from Dallas, Agent Scully. I can't very well submit a report to the Attorney General that alleges the links you've made here. Bees and corn crops do not quite fall under the rubric of domestic terrorism.

lines.speaker: u8198
lines.text: No, they don't.

lines.speaker: u8191
lines.text: Most of what I find in here is lacking a coherent picture of an organization with an attributable motive. I realize you're very lucky to be alive Agent Scully. The ordeal you've endured has clearly affected you -- though the holes in your account leave this panel with little choice but to delete these references from our final report to the Justice Department. Until which time hard evidence becomes available that would give us cause to pursue such an investigation.

lines.speaker: u8201
lines.text: Do they know?

lines.speaker: u8192
lines.text: Mulder was in Dallas when we were trying to dispose of evidence. He's gone back there again. Someone has tipped him.

lines.speaker: u8201
lines.text: Who?

lines.speaker: u8192
lines.text: Kurtzweil, we think.

lines.speaker: u8193
lines.text: You want a call if we turn up Kurtzweil?

lines.speaker: u8197
lines.text: No. Don't bother.

lines.speaker: u8197
lines.text: You said you knew the location of the archeological site where these were found.

lines.speaker: u8195
lines.text: Show you right on a map.

lines.speaker: u8196
lines.text: You'd be shit out of luck if not for me. You saw what you saw because I led you to it. I'm putting my ass on the line for you.

lines.speaker: u8197
lines.text: Your ass? I just got chased across Texas by two black helicopters.

lines.speaker: u8196
lines.text: And why do you think it is you're standing here talking to me? These people don't make mistakes, Agent Mulder.

lines.speaker: u8201
lines.text: You have precious little time. What I've given you the alien colonists have no idea exists. You hold in your hand the power to end the project.

lines.speaker: u8197
lines.text: How?

lines.speaker: u8201
lines.text: The vaccine you hold is the only defense against the virus. Its introduction into an alien environment may have the power to destroy the delicate plans we've so assiduously protected for the last fifty years.  Or it may not.

lines.speaker: u8197
lines.text: What alien environment?

lines.speaker: u8201
lines.text: Find Agent Scully. Save her. Only her science can save the future.

lines.speaker: u8197
lines.text: What about you?

lines.speaker: u8201
lines.text: My life is over.  Go.

lines.speaker: u8201
lines.text: You can't kill Mulder. He's got too much light on him.

lines.speaker: u8200
lines.text: You need not kill a man to destroy him.

lines.speaker: u8201
lines.text: No, you need only take away what is most precious to him.

lines.speaker: u8203
lines.text: Who says?

lines.speaker: u8205
lines.text: Mocky-Lock.

lines.speaker: u8203
lines.text: Oh no... No you don't.

lines.speaker: u8205
lines.text: "Mocky-Lock is the bogeyman.  Mocky-Lock wants me where I am."

lines.speaker: u8203
lines.text: I bet we can fix it.

lines.speaker: u8204
lines.text: Lattimer sold the hoist to a guy named Bainbridge who tired to build a machine works out near Delano.  Bainbridge ends up in bankruptcy court and the state winds up with the land - it's just sitting there.

lines.speaker: u8208
lines.text: Delano?

lines.speaker: u8204
lines.text: Yep.  And guess who they hired to seal up the place?

lines.speaker: u8208
lines.text: You're kidding me.

lines.speaker: u8204
lines.text: I never kid.  My wife hates it.  Says I'm too serious.

lines.speaker: u8206
lines.text: Instead of going into his mind...

lines.speaker: u8207
lines.text: She's bringing Stargher into hers.

lines.speaker: u8208
lines.text: How's the patient.

lines.speaker: u8207
lines.text: Awaiting his arrival.

lines.speaker: u8208
lines.text: What about the cat?

lines.speaker: u8207
lines.text: Completely unaware.

lines.speaker: u8209
lines.text: You're bettin' the farm on something you saw after they pumped you full of god knows-what kind of shit?

lines.speaker: u8208
lines.text: I saw her.  Julia.  Alive.  I saw everything.

lines.speaker: u8209
lines.text: You might've seen Jimmy Hoffa dancing with Timothy Leary.  I don't care.

lines.speaker: u8211
lines.text: Thank you, you have been so kind. Anna moves down to stand CL of Paine.

lines.speaker: u8219
lines.text: Well, I'll be saying good night. Good night, Miss.

lines.speaker: u8211
lines.text: Good-bye.

lines.speaker: u8218
lines.text: I would very much like to meet you, Baron. Come around.

lines.speaker: u8212
lines.text: Austrians aren't allowed in your hotel. Couldn't we meet at the Mozart cafe?

lines.speaker: u8218
lines.text: Where?

lines.speaker: u8212
lines.text: Just around the corner.

lines.speaker: u8218
lines.text: How will I know you?

lines.speaker: u8212
lines.text: I'll carry a copy of one of your books. Harry gave it to me.

lines.speaker: u8219
lines.text: Shall I go over there, sir?

lines.speaker: u8213
lines.text: No, no. Leave them for a while.

lines.speaker: u8218
lines.text: ...his number.

lines.speaker: u8214
lines.text: I'll look it up for you.

lines.speaker: u8218
lines.text: Well, look, is there a car here I can use?

lines.speaker: u8219
lines.text: ...leaving tomorrow, sir.

lines.speaker: u8215
lines.text: Excuse me, have you got tooth...

lines.speaker: u8218
lines.text: ...this way.

lines.speaker: u8216
lines.text: What do you want?

lines.speaker: u8217
lines.text: Are you mad?

lines.speaker: u8218
lines.text: All right - I'm mad. I've seen a ghost...

lines.speaker: u8218
lines.text: Lime.  Harry Lime.

lines.speaker: u8223
lines.text: Okay.

lines.speaker: u8218
lines.text: I thought he'd be here to meet me.

lines.speaker: u8226
lines.text: You. You're the guy that lent me the money.

lines.speaker: u8230
lines.text: Yeah, that's right. Now could you be quiet so I can get some sleep.

lines.speaker: u8226
lines.text: Ten dollars. I'll find a way to pay you back. How would you like to know About somewhere special? The perfect beach. Paradise. No one else knows about it. That's got to be worth something. What do you say?

lines.speaker: u8230
lines.text: Look I don't care about the money right now: I just want some sleep. So if you could be quiet -

lines.speaker: u8226
lines.text: Yea, OK. I will be, I will be, I promise.

lines.speaker: u8230
lines.text: Thanks.

lines.text: What are you doing in Thailand? Tourist?

lines.text: He never sent them... Don't you understand?  He doesn't want this war anymore... he has his crown now, that's all he ever wanted...

lines.speaker: u8329
lines.text: No!
